The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) is Singapore’s central bank and integrated financial regulator. As central bank, MAS promotes sustained, non-inflationary economic growth through the conduct of monetary policy and close macroeconomic surveillance and analysis. It manages Singapore’s exchange rate, official foreign reserves, and liquidity in the banking sector. As an integrated financial supervisor, MAS fosters a sound financial services sector through its prudential oversight of all financial institutions in Singapore – banks, insurers, capital market intermediaries, financial advisors, and stock exchanges. It is also responsible for well-functioning financial markets, sound conduct, and investor education. MAS also works with the financial industry to promote Singapore as a dynamic international financial centre. It facilitates the development of infrastructure, adoption of technology, and upgrading of skills in the financial industry. Join us now, if you have a genuine interest in making an impact to help shape Singapore’s economic and financial landscape. You will be working in a fast-paced environment that would require the ability to manage multiple priorities and needs of stakeholders, as well as the agility to respond to changes and developments. Normal office hours, but off-office hours standby to respond to exigencies is expected As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment.

Get to know our Team: We are living in exciting times. Technology is reshaping how we live and we want to use it to redefine how financial services are offered, which is why Singtel and Grab are coming together. Singtel is Asia’s leading communications group connecting millions of consumers and enterprises to essential digital services while Grab is the leading technology company in Southeast Asia offering everyday services to consumers. Together, we have big dreams to unlock financial inclusion for all Southeast Asians. We design and provide products and services that empower our customers to enjoy greater banking convenience while they extract more value from their money. In particular, we are focused on promoting and developing healthy saving and investment practices across generations. Get to know the Role: The Head of Creative is focused on building the Digibank brand in Singapore, and ultimately our Southeast Asian markets. By combining user insights, strategic thinking, beautiful designs and storytelling, this role ensures Digibank's reputation for improving banking for all through inclusive products and services, is expressed accurately and delightfully . As the SG Head of Creative, you will work closely with the senior stakeholders, including the Chief Marketing Officer from our central SG hub and Country Marketing Heads to formulate and execute compelling campaigns that achieve OKRs and strengthen the relationship between the brand and our target audience. You will play an important role in everything from setting up the creative framework in which all creative/brand teams can integrate into their marketing process, as well as helping to develop campaign ideas, and craft a visual language for the brand by collaborating with cross-functional partners internally and externally. The day-to-day activities: Work closely with the Chief Marketing Officer and Country Marketing Heads to tell Digibank's story to our customers and strengthen the target audience’s views of the brand. Partner with cross-functional teams and agency partners to develop communications for marketing campaigns, ensuring them to be cut-though, on-brand, and visually compelling. Establish a creative framework that helps govern marketing outputs through best practices and a robust evaluation process. Solicit, synthesize and manage feedback from senior stakeholders to iterate within a dynamic and ambiguous environment. Build, inspire and eventually lead a team of creatives across different markets to understand varying cultural nuances in order to deliver considerable & appropriate marketing communications in each market. Manage and oversee creative marketing budget. The must haves: 10+ years of creative/design experience from a design/brand/creative agency, or in-house team Knowledge of design, technology trends, cultural trends, as well as an understanding of consumer insights and how to apply these to different briefs Experience working across video and emerging technology productions Experience leading a team to produce creative/design solutions with measurable results Experience with Adobe Suite Experience telling brand value stories that trigger positive reactions from stakeholders and target audiences Unafraid to roll up sleeves and provide hands-on support across multiple capacities to ensure creative standards are upheld and projects are delivered on time Good writing skills to convey complex concepts clearly and persuasively to varying levels of the Digibank from peers to senior stakeholders.

CONFIDENTIALITY REGIME In application of Article 114.1 of INTERPOL’s Rules on the Processing of Data (RPD), the General Secretariat is “responsible for determining authorization procedures or a system of security clearance at each data confidentiality level”. Member states which are not able or willing to assist INTERPOL in performing such a check should be aware that some INTERPOL information might not be made available to their nationals working at INTERPOL. In order to be able to access police information classified as “INTERPOL For official use only” or “INTERPOL RESTRICTED”, the individual has to obtain “INTERPOL Restricted” security clearance. This clearance is granted after Basic security screening. In order to be able to access police information classified as “INTERPOL CONFIDENTIAL”, the individual has to obtain “INTERPOL Confidential” security clearance. This clearance is granted after Enhanced security screening. Under no circumstances should clearance be granted simply because of an official’s rank, post held, or length of service. Staff may only gain access to General Secretariat premises and to police information if the appropriate INTERPOL security clearance has been obtained. In order to reduce the contract timeline, and as the Enhanced security screening may take some time, the Official requiring INTERPOL Confidential security clearance may be authorized to start the appointment if the NCB can confirm that the equivalent to Basic security screening has been performed. Access to INTERPOL CONFIDENTIAL information will not be authorized until Enhanced security screening is confirmed.

Job Description:: “Join us and fly the world!! Join our team! Kuwait Airways is currently looking to hire ambassadors who are talented, motivated and culturally aware, to be a part of our expanding distinguished team. We are looking for Chief Cabin Crew who arable to create a truly pleasant flight experience for our passengers by providing exceptional customer service while ensuring their comfort and safety throughout the flight. In this role, your tasks will include but not be limited to: Oversees the activities of the crew assigned to a particular flight. He performs supervisory duties and exercises financial powers at the level specified by the administration for such a position. The information is given to the crew members in the contact room before take-off and explains all the details of the flight segments, stops and different timings of the passenger load. Highlights the requirements of specific passengers such as patients, CIP’s, unaccompanied children and specific meal requirements identified from the Passenger Information List (P.I.L. ). The crew members are authorized to perform various duties and appropriate functions according to their training and experience needs. It examines crew members’ documents such as their passports, identity cards, crew membership certificates and emergency licenses. Make sure that their appearance and uniforms are in line with the needs of the institution as they test their knowledge of safety procedures by asking them about emergency procedures, evacuation of passengers and regulations for first aid. Requirement: 6 years’ experience as Cabin Crew. Minimum education High School (12 years of schooling or more) or equivalent. License of two or more types of aircraft. Minimum height of for female 160 cm, male 167 cm and weight proportionate to height. Well-groomed and physically fit to work as a Flight Attendant. Great command of English (Spoken & written). Can swim 20 meters unaided. Skills: In addition to the job requirements, we believe our cabin crew should possess the following skills: Excellent customer service skills. Good communication and excellent interpersonal skills. The ability to remain calm in emergencies or when dealing with difficult passengers. Good general health and fitness. Positive attitude and Assertiveness. Ability to work flexibly in a challenging schedule. Being professional at the same time having empathy for others. If you meet the above criteria, you will be invited to attend KAC Cabin Crew screening and only shortlisted candidates will undergo written & oral tests in English followed by an interview.

Job_Title: Principal Software Engineer - International Business Unit
Job_Descriptions: Your job If you are an engineer who's passionate about building innovative products that scale to tens of millions of page views a day, Indeed is looking for you. Indeed offers smart developers like you a complex development ecosystem with short release cycles. Every week sees the new release of multiple products that meet the growing needs of millions of jobseekers worldwide. Indeed’s job search engine serves billions of search queries every month connecting tens of millions of jobseekers to relevant job opportunities. As part of a small collaborative team from engineering, operations and product management, you will work on areas such as feature extraction, document indexing, retrieval, and relevancy scoring. We constantly dig into the data available at Indeed to analyze, inform and develop solutions to the right problems. If looking at data, slicing and dicing it in multiple ways and coming up with interesting insights is something you thrive upon, you will fit right in. As a principal software engineer working out of the Singapore Engineering Centre, you will be tasked in providing the technical leadership and influence for all products & services across the International Business Unit. This will involve driving significant engineering initiatives across multiple product areas and mentoring Indeed’s current and future technical leaders through establishing and evangelizing engineering best practices. The International Business Unit consists of teams on International Platforms such as International Payments, Challenger Markets EU, International Employer Engagement etc. At Indeed, we love data. As a part of a highly data-driven organization, you won’t have to guess at the impact you’re having; you’ll leverage our large-scale data analysis infrastructure to define, measure, and test your hypotheses and deliver the best possible experience for the jobseeker. Our primary technology stack is Java-based, but we believe strongly in using the right tool for the right job. As such, we’re employing best-of-breed technologies and incorporating them into our stack. This includes things like Spring Boot, Node.JS, Next.JS, React/Redux, MongoDB, Mesos, Kubernetes, to name a few. Additionally, sometimes the right tool for the job doesn’t exist, so we’ve created and open-sourced a number of our core systems. You can explore them on Github and YouTube. Who You Are: BS in Computer Science or related area, or relevant work experience Proven success working in a technical individual contributor leadership role for top tech companies 10+ years of experience managing large-scale software development Strong ability to coach developers, helping them improve their skills and grow their careers Solid knowledge of data structures and algorithms and excellent programming skills The desire to solve tough problems with quality software at scale An understanding of the value derived from shipping code rapidly to production and learning/iterating on the results. A deep understanding of the web Strong knowledge of databases, both SQL and NoSQL Experience with service-oriented and event-driven system architectures Experience building high-performance distributed systems

Role Summary We have a fantastic opportunity for an IT Operations Tech Lead to join our team in APAC region based out of Singapore. The person in this role will work as part of the IT Support team and will be a key point of contact for the End User community. Alongside the team, the person in this role will support the activities of desktop services. This position would be great for someone with some experience in an IT Leadership support role who is keen to develop their leadership skills further. The ideal candidate will be passionate about delivering the highest standard of IT support, with a genuine interest in technology and its application and use in the business, as well as customer oriented with a desire to learn and develop a career in technical service delivery. What you will be doing Work within the IT Operations Engineering team, you will be a key point of contact for user incidents & service requests. Deputise for the Divisional Director, IT APAC in their absence where needed. Drive and maintain set delivery standards through all incident and request queues, ensuring that no calls are unanswered or unassigned. Ensure adherence to the set KPI’s and CSF’s to support the IT strategic direction and objectives. Continuously look for and drive development / training improvements for the entire team. Help to lead, triage and resolve user incidents & service requests, taking ownership, trouble shooting and liaising with other IT teams to resolve and manage user expectations. Create and maintain accurate and concise ticket update/knowledgebase documentation within ServiceNow, with high focus on regional specifics. Educate colleagues on best practise, adoption and utilisation of technology, applications, and services. Work with the IT Manager to identify trends and spot potential problems. Improve and iterate on service support provision to the office. Ensure computers, printers and other peripherals are operational. Provide support with hardware and software maintenance. Assist in leading, championing and adhering to all global policies and processes to resolve issues and problems. Work locally and at a global level, the role will provide support, knowledge, and delivery request-based services that we can measure, improve, and iterate on. Ensure the mechanisms and measures are in place to ensure IT teams and on-site colleagues work safely and securely within the boundaries of the existing security parameters, security principles, and policies such as but not limited to – Acceptable Usage, Security Incident Management, Data Breach and Vulnerability management events. Act as the first management point of escalation and complete ownership for EMEA user incidents, service requests and service quality, with a set, agreed backlog of service improvement. Additional / ad hoc duties as needed to meet the needs of the business. Team Management Responsibilities: Ensure succession, training and development plans are in place with each colleague in the team. Mentor, train, and coach teams locally on service management and technical development. Take the lead in local initiatives for the improvement of the team. Support the broader leadership team in achieving global level targets and ensuring companywide updates and passed and explained to all teams. Drive best practise approach through the teams across all avenues of work. Lead teams in actively encouraging, motivate and support a culture of learning and knowledge sharing. What we are looking for Experience & Knowledge Previous experience within an IT Support role. Previous experience within an IT Support Team leadership role. Good knowledge of ServiceNow ITSM. Customer oriented, with a passion for delivering excellent service and for continuous improvement of services. Excellent communication skills, able to provide technical support over the telephone, chat, or face to face. Professional manner with a strong work ethic. Good problem-solving skills, with a solution focused approach. Ability to adapt and handle a constantly changing flow of support calls and walk-up technical assistance. Ability to multitask effectively during busy times and remain calm during stressful situations. A team player who can work within a framework of procedure and policies. Self-motivated and able to use initiative. Flexible and willing to work outside of the core hours if necessary. Knowledge and some experience of products within the Microsoft 365 suite. Good working knowledge of Productivity and collaboration applications such as Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive, and Exchange would be advantageous. Knowledge and experience of – Active Directory & Azure Active Directory administration Server administration HP Servers and enterprise SAN solutions Able to learn quickly and work within a fast-paced environment. Desire to learn and to undertake on-the-job training and continuous personal development. Skills Knowledge/experience of the following are required: Active Directory, Exchange (both on-prem and M365) VMware (vCenter + Horizon) MS Office standard workloads (EO, EoP, Office, PowerPoint) Microsoft Server 2008 onwards HP Hardware incl DL servers and SAN’s Multi Factor Auth setup (MS MFA, DUO) MS Intune ServiceNow ITSM tool ITIL Foundation certification CUCM

About Symrise AG Symrise is a global leading authority of flavours, food, nutrition, fragrances and cosmetic ingredients. Its clients include manufacturers of food and beverages, perfumes, cosmetics, pharmaceuticals and producers of nutritional supplements and pet food. Headquartered in Holzminden, Germany, Symrise is well represented by more than 100 locations across Europe, United States, Latin America, the Middle East, Africa, Turkey and Asia Pacific. Symrise has been growing faster than the market for many years and one of the most profitable companies in the industry. Our over 10,000 employees share goals based on shared values. By pooling their knowledge, experience and skillsets, we are able to forge new paths again and again and to offer our customers tailor-made solutions for healthy nutrition and modern personal care. Quality Control Assistant We are seeking passionate freshers to join us in exploring a fruitful career to grow as a QC specialist in the flavors and fragrance industry. The incumbent plays an important role in assisting the QC Analyst in sample preparation samples which are critical to QC Process; this helps the QC Analyst to make critical and appropriate decisions for the qualification of Raw Materials and Finish Goods. These activities require significant amount of time due to the heavy load, and the help of QC Assistant would assist to better manage the lead time to complete the task and mission. The Position: • Support in sample preparation, retention sample management, and routine administrative tasks • Assist in the routine physical, chemical, sensory and other analysis as it may be required • Assist in the data entry and documentation process (SAP System). • Support other QC team in other additional tasks as assigned by the supervisor The Ideal Candidate: • Diploma in chemistry, food science or other related fields • 1 or 2 years of working in Lab experience will be preferred, we would consider fresh graduates from related backgrounds. • Basic knowledge of chemistry, chemical properties and lab working experience • Knowledge of Lab safety and GLP • Basic Computer Skills (Word, Excel, Power point) • Excellent skill in writing technical communication/reports is an added advantage.

Atomionics is a Singapore based VC-backed startup building quantum sensors for resource exploration and navigation. We measure gravity, acceleration, and rotation 1000x better than the state of the art. Our sensors can build a complete map of the underground, thus help pinpoint underground structures, like bunkers and tunnels, predict earthquakes, provide precise navigation, and build a universal positioning system that works everywhere – underground, underwater, and even in space. We have deep expertise in bringing complex technologies from a lab environment to the dynamic real world. We are a small, focused group in a high-energy environment. The core of what we are building is called cold atom interferometry, where we cool down atoms to microkelvin temperatures by shooting lasers at them. This allows us to precisely measure the forces acting on them. Our team has over 30 years of combined relevant research experience. And due to the complexity of our work, our employees get to interact with other domains such as electronics engineering, mechanical engineering, physics, and software engineering. Our company likes to treat our work as a “gym for our minds”. In addition, we are backed by some fantastic investors from the private and public sectors, such as Wavemaker, SGInnovate, Cap Vista, 500 Startups, and other prominent angels. Responsibilities Work closely with the BD team to explore different use-cases of our state-of-the-art quantum gravimeter and identify target markets Validate the target markets to discover the early adopters and the right nodes in the different customer segments Model the value of the service/application for the different markets identified and create market intelligence reports Conduct extensive hypothesis testing while managing clientele located on all corners of the world and work within a multicultural team About you An absolutely driven individual with demonstrated creative problem-solving skills, analytical mind, and persistence You want to gain an understanding of the nitty-gritty details of building a startup that one can only learn from experience Detail-oriented with a strong ability to connect the dots Even better if you have A background in philosophy or psychology Worked in an early-stage company environment Worked on sponsorship requirements for events, organizations, and college teams or have demonstrated a strong intuition in sales What we can offer you A chance to learn about the intricacies of deep-tech research, product development, and strategy in a high-growth startup while working with some of the best engineers and physicists Learn how to validate different markets and get hands-on experience on building the right value proposition and strategy for a startup A book/hobby project allowance to help you grow and collectively build the Atomionics library Board games and curry night Point to note: Must be able to start on Feb 14 or earlier and continue for at least 3 months

Job_Title: Corporate Treasury Operations - Liquidity Management - Associate - Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Corporate Treasury Operations - Liquidity Management - Associate - Singapore Job Summary & Responsibilities Corporate Treasury is a dynamic, multi-faceted division that partners with all areas of the firm to deliver banking, sales and trading and asset management capabilities to clients around the world. Alongside this vital service delivery role, Corporate Treasury provides essential risk management and control, preserving and enhancing the firm's assets and its reputation. Corporate Treasury span all product lines and markets, serving as internal business partners who develop the processes and controls, and help to specify the systems that deliver accuracy, timeliness and integrity to our business. Liquidity Management is the firm's "central bank" for managing the firm's overall funding positions. The team works in a time sensitive environment in which accuracy of processing and timely escalation and communication with the various Operations teams and the firm's external Nostro Agent Banks is essential to a smooth settlement process. The successful candidate will work in the cash management team to support daily cash funding, new business build-out, and also aggressively drive forward control and efficiency initiatives. Liquidity Management manages short term liquidity by forecasting the firm's daily cash requirements. Liquidity Management then distributes the liquidity across Goldman Sachs' entities and bank accounts via intercompany loans (between different Goldman Sachs entities) or intracompany transfers (within the same entity). The team also partners with various agent banks to secure and manage the intraday liquidity to facilitate the successful cash settlement across all products/markets for the firm. Additional responsibilities include anticipating short-term borrowing needs and securing necessary funding, investing excess cash balance in short-term money market instruments. Responsibilities: Managing multiple Asian currency liquidity throughout the day. Work with the cash managers to meet the firm's short term funding requirement for bank accounts in Asia; monitor day to day cash payments/receipts in stringent regulatory markets. The individual will work with other teams supporting trading and client activities, responding to queries, and working through exceptional processes. Successful candidate will have an opportunity to become a SME in liquidity management in APAC and eventually become a team leader/manager. In addition, the individual would represent Liquidity management in evaluating new business opportunities. Basic Qualifications University degree holder Minimum of 3.5 years experience within Operations (liquidity/funding operations preferred) The individual will need strong communication Self-driven personality Preferred Qualifications Good attention to detail Ability to work to tight dealines and multi-task Creativity and an ability to think laterally Goldman Sachs is an equal opportunity employer. © The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2021. All rights reserved

What the role is The candidate will be part of a team that will plan and execute strategies to:  make the radio spectrum available for government and non-government uses to maximise socio-economic benefits from the implementation of radiocommunication services; and  ensure the efficient and effective use of the spectrum to support national goals and objectives. What you will be working on Key Responsibilities  Manage the use of radio systems or services through radio frequency assignment and coordination.  Conduct technical analysis of radio frequency requirements of proposed radio systems by applicants.  Evaluate the compatibility of the new system(s) with existing in-band and adjacent band systems to ensure minimum potential of causing Radio Frequency Interference (RFI).  Perform the assignment and coordination of frequencies in accordance with the national frequency allocation plan.  Perform Secretariat duties for multi-lateral meetings with neighbouring countries, e.g. frequency registrations, organising meetings, hosting of events and providing meeting minutes/meeting documents.  Analyse and evaluate technical and operating parameters of various radiocommunication services, e.g. mobile, satellite, fixed, radar and broadcast.  Perform analysis using spectrum engineering tools to determine the radio performance of mobile cellular and other wireless networks, e.g. coverage, radio interference, co-existence parameters (both technical and operational), that promote efficient and effective spectrum use.  Undertake engagement with spectrum users, network service providers, and equipment manufacturers (both domestic and international) to determine long-term spectrum requirements and use. What we are looking for Requirements  Bachelor/Master Degree in Telecommunications, Electronic Engineering or relevant discipline.  Good technical understanding of radio engineering principles, e.g. wireless system characteristics and performance, link budget, radio propagation models.  Technical knowledge and expertise in cellular mobile systems and architecture (including core and radio access networks, etc.) will be an advantage.  Strong technical aptitude, interest and willingness to learn and understand new technologies.  Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills.  Team player with good interpersonal and stakeholder engagement skills.  Self-driven, fast learner, detail-oriented and able to operate in evolving environment.  Good report writing and verbal communication skills. This position will commensurate with experience. Only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

Job Description This role is part of the NYC Youth Corp Community Internship*. This position is responsible for assisting the Curriculum R&D team to explore different methodologies and open source online resources that help less vulnerable children (7-12 years old) from disadvantaged families to build digital literacy skills. The focus is to research and develop a 1 year program that nurtures the relevant digital skills, competencies and confidence focusing on a) Digital Identity - Digital Co-creator Identity b) Digital Literacy - Content Creation, Computational Literacy. Roles and Responsibilities: 1) Work closely with clients to understand pain points and current gaps the children (7 to 12 years old) and families are facing with higher screen time 2) Design a long term Digital Literacy program for children between 7 to 12 years old from SHINE 3) Design, test and iterate digital creation projects 4) Create and develop learning materials and collaterals such as activity sheets etc for programs Learning Objectives and Outcomes: 1) Understand different pedagogical approaches 2) Understand families' challenges in digital control and access 3) Understand children's (between 7 to 12 years old) learning abilities and development stages 4) Understand how to design and develop non-academic curriculum 5) Learn to work and communicate with a lean and young team that focuses in a dynamic and fast-paced environment 6) Learn more about the operations of impact-driven organization About the Youth Corps Community Internship* Youth Corps Community Internship (YCCI) (previously known as Youth Corps Internship Scheme) provides students from Institutes of Higher Learning (IHLs) with more internship opportunities ranging between five to six months in the community and social sectors. The objective of the YCCI is to enable youth to continue their development through on-job-training and learning experiences in the community and social sectors, and contribute back to society. Requirements Be a Singapore Citizen or Permanent Resident aged 17 to 25 years old; Be a Student/Undergraduate from ITE, Polytechnics, Autonomous Universities, or other educational institutions (e.g. private educational institutions and overseas institutions); and Be available for a full-time internship ranging from five to six months between 7 Mar 2022 – 30 Sep 2022 Benefits to Youth • Gain valuable skills and exposure to working in the real world; • Develop empathy and understanding of the community and social sector; • Undergo a specially design virtual onboarding programme and training workshops; • Receive an accomplishment card detailing the skills attained from the internship at the end of the internship; • Receive a monthly internship allowance of $800, regardless of educational qualifications if you are successfully offered an internship under the YCIS; and • To be given opportunity to complete and be conferred as a Youth Corps Leader.

This role is part of the NYC Youth Corp Community Internship*. Brief Description: This position is responsible for assisting the team to develop a community asset map for the digital literacy program that will run at SHINE Spooner Road. Taking an asset-based approach, interns will also assist the team to identify and connect with different community partners and create a sustainable system for program to run for vulnerable children and youths from disadvantaged families. Roles and Responsibilities: 1) Liaise with SHINE to understand the community and assist to create the community asset map for the Digital Literacy program for the children at SHINE 2) Identify and connect with individuals/organizations who have complementing assets (eg funders, volunteers, physical laptops etc) 3) Develop and implement a system to manage effective and consistent engagement with different community partners Learning Objectives and Outcomes: 1) To be exposed to asset based community development framework and learn how to implement it in local context 2) To build interpersonal skills and learn how to communicate effectively when engaging different stakeholders 3) To gain knowledge on the digital issues faced by vulnerable children from disadvantaged families About the Youth Corps Community Internship* Youth Corps Community Internship (YCCI) (previously known as Youth Corps Internship Scheme) provides students from Institutes of Higher Learning (IHLs) with more internship opportunities ranging between five to six months in the community and social sectors. The objective of the YCCI is to enable youth to continue their development through on-job-training and learning experiences in the community and social sectors, and contribute back to society. Job_Title: Project Manager, Warehouse Management System (WMS), 12 month recurring contract

Introduction Automata Network (https://ata.network) is a decentralized service protocol that provides privacy middlewares for dApps on Ethereum and Polkadot to achieve privacy, high assurance and frictionless computation. Leveraging on the latest crypto and privacy-protection algorithms, along with hardware-based trust, the service protocol enables versatile use-cases not previously possible in the past, such as anonymous voting, MEV minimization, and no-tracking indexing. It is built by the industry’s foremost blockchain veterans and award-winning researchers, who previously worked at Zilliqa, LongHash, and the National University of Singapore. Founded in 2019, Automata Network is a recipient of Web3 Grant (2020), and a participant of the Web 3.0 Bootcamp (2020), Berkeley Blockchain Xcelerator (2021), Polkadot Decoded Mainstage speaker (2021). It has raised $3.4 million in total funding in early 2021. We are looking for self-driven and experienced frontend developers who can build Dapps with a product mindset. You are expected to work closely with the core team members to build user-friendly interfaces. We are based in Singapore but remote working is also acceptable. Responsibilities Create production-grade Dapps running on desktop or mobile platforms Collaborate with backend developers (e.g. blockchain, oracle) to exchange data through APIs. Perform design reviews and code reviews regularly Create technical specifications and documentation Qualifications Over 2 years of experience in frontend development Experience in web development frameworks such as React or Vue. Ability to collaborate with designers using tools such as Figma Familiarity with open-source development and collaborations Strong problem-solving and communication skills Fast learner on new technologies Perks Great career development opportunities in a growing company Competitive compensation with crypto incentives Flexible working hours and casual work attire

Senior Backend Developer Our client is a global market leader in a commercial real estate space that is robust and strong even during pandemic times. They are looking to achieve net zero carbon emissions by 2040 across all areas of its operations, including the sites they manage. The team hired will get a chance to work on a sustainability management system that would help our client bring their operational carbon footprint and greenhouse gases down. Responsibilities: Work with the product management team to design new products or enhancements. Take part in system development including analysis, coding and testing in an agile product development team. To develop business requirements into cost-effective and elegant technical solutions. Consult with the business to develop documentation and communication materials to ensure accurate usage and interpretation of the business requirements. Understand the business requirements in sufficient detail such that a technical solution can be designed and engineered. Mentor less experienced engineers on proper standards/techniques to improve their development practices and efficiency. Write scripts to perform unit testing, system integration testing and assist with user acceptance testing support. Skills and Experiences: Have 5 - 8 years' experience in back-end systems, server-side development in ASP.NET Framework, C#. Experienced with technologies such as SQL Servers, Entity Framework and public cloud platforms (i.e. Azure). Familiar working with RESTful API (Apigee or Azure APIM) and able to source code control in git. Able to use CI/CD pipelines for building and deploying and architecting Applications in Microsoft Azure. Excellent technical, analytical and organizational skills. Quick learning capability under agile, rapidly changing environments. Strong business sense and analytical ability. Go-getter attitude and willing to challenge the status quo. Able to show respect for differences in opinions. Possess a one-team spirit. For more information you can email Jessie Ng in our Singapore office on jessie.ng@tekysystems.com quoting Job Reference 525761 or alternatively, apply here to register your interest. http://jobs.en-sg.teksystems.com/kBd9fX/senior-backend-developer-itcommunications-singapore-048619-singapore-14693486 Allegis Group Singapore Pte Ltd, Company Reg No. 200909448N, EA Licence No. 10C4544

AVP - Client Onboarding Asia Client Onboarding Manager Singapore As a Barclays, Client Onboarding Manager you will be supporting our investment banking function in providing day-to-day services for internal and external stakeholders. This will include facilitating onboarding requests for new Markets entities and new products as principal, ensuring requests are fully completed in our onboarding systems and are ready to trade. The team support investment banking desks Globally and you will be responsible for managing a team of analysts and ensure all Onboarding needs are being met. Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity - helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted. What will you be doing? Act as a single point of contact for client onboarding related escalations from Business, using strong evaluative judgement based on the analysis of information Partnering with Business Management on an ongoing basis to understand expectations, manage BAU priorities and assess demands. Ongoing governance to ensure service levels are being adhered and ensure zero disruptions in Business activities. Displaying commercial awareness to ensure there are zero onboarding related revenue impacts Partnering with global counterparts regularly to implement changes and awareness with an aim to create a streamlined function You will be a champion your team through regular 1-1s, providing ongoing feedback, mid-year and year end reviews Utilizing internal systems for workflow management and data storage Reviewing control reports, investigating and resolving breaks What we're looking for Bachelor's Degree equivalent work experience in the Onboarding, KYC, Regulatory area. Proven Stakeholder Management and Leadership skills Excellent decision-making and problem Solving Previous experience within the Financial Sector Skills that will help you in the role: Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to communicate both written and verbally in Mandarin Knowledge of AML/KYC, Product, Regulatory, Credit, Legal, Ops would be beneficial Strong Microsoft Office Skills including Outlook, Excel Where will you be working? Our office is located in Marina Bay Financial Centre, which has been carefully crafted into a "city in a garden". Overlooking the scenic skyline along the Marina Bay waterfront, the green spaces and rooftop terraces have been designed to optimise employee well-being. The centre provides an integrated live-work-play development, surrounded by shops, restaurants, gyms and an alfresco dining area. Our convenient office location means you're just a 5-minute walk from the nearest MRT station.

Job_Title: Transaction Services Finance – Real Estate Due Diligence
Job_Descriptions: Posted by: Michael Durkin Associate Director - Specialist in recruitment in the Finance and CFO space for Banking & FS View profile & contact Our client is the real estate asset management and investment arm of a global financial services group. They are looking for a candidate to join their Transaction Services Finance team. This role will be responsible for providing the financial oversight in real estate transactions across the APAC region by overseeing financial due diligence and technical accounting assessments. Some of the key responsibilities will include: Conduct financial due diligence or oversee external advisors to carry out financial due diligence for real estate transactions across the APAC region. Analyze targets and their financial statements. Coordinate with external service providers. Support negotiations of purchase and sale agreements. Participate in acquisition structuring under tax, regulatory and accounting aspects. Support and review modelling of acquisition structures. Prepare financial due diligence and IFRS findings for Investment Committee. Interface between accounting, treasury, risk and various other Group departments. Document technical IFRS accounting assessments, including implications & handover (IFRS/ HGB), investment restructurings, impairment risk and changes in accounting standards. Support post deal closing and integration matters. To be eligible for this role you will require: University degree, preferably with major subjects in accounting/auditing, valuation or taxes. Minimum 10 years of professional experience with a strong accounting background, experience of financial due diligence on real estate transactions – could suit someone currently doing financial due diligence on real estate within a Big 4 firm, looking to move out into industry. Strong knowledge in IFRS, additional APAC local GAAP knowledge is advantageous. Please contact Michael Durkin on +65 8894 1963 or email your cv directly in word format with job reference no. Jo0000006483 to bankingandfinance-SG@theedgepartnership.com Please note that due to the high number of applications only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. If you do not hear from us in the next 5 business days we regret to inform you that your application for this position was unsuccessful. EA License : 16S8131 Recruiter License : R2090716

General Information Job Title Sales Transaction Coordinator Department: APAC, Sales Transactions Support Reporting Working Relationships Reports to: APAC Quote Support Manager Supervises: none Internal: APAC Sales: Sales Reps, Sales Transactions Support, Sales Engineers, Finance, CSM, Capacity, Billing, Data Team, Global and Regional Sales Ops; BSA/IT, External: NA Job Description Roles The Sales Transaction Coordinator for APAC is part of the APAC Sales Transactions Support. Main responsibilities include creating quotes for the Customer and Sales Representatives and shepherding all these quotes through the approval process up to booking. This role also involves coordination with Sales Reps and working cross-functionally to solve issues related to quotes. The nature of the accounts will require working across different countries of APAC and engage with counterparts in the Global organization of Equinix if applicable sure the customer is aware and help the internal customer through adoption. In addition, the role includes creation of quotes and will also be responsible to handle order and assets related requests coming from different internal departments. The Sales Transaction Coordinator will get engaged via cases in SFDC and will work off a queue. The role will have a close working relationship with SSA, Sales Reps, Customer, CSM’s and Sales Engineers for obtaining the required order information to ensure quotes are not delayed. Responsibilities: Monitor/manage the quote request queue (cases in SFDC/Siebel) Validate the quoting info provided by Sales Rep, SSA and CSM. Follow up directly on any clarifications or additional info required to accurately generate quotes. Accurate and timely creation of all assigned quote requests in Siebel. This applies to both initial quotes and revisions to existing quotes (especially for SO amendments, Custom, Migration, Replacement, Add/Delete/Change SO’s and Terminations) Monitor all approval queues within the Quoting Processes and escalate any delays. Manage the manual signature process and ensure contracts are stored and provided to customers if signature process is handled outside of the system. Provide 1st level support to SSA, Sales Reps on generating legal Agreements in SFDC and submitting nonstandard term requests to Legal (e.g. for MCA, GTC, Policies) Work cross functionally with a variety of departments within Equinix and function well within a team. Job Requirements Education and Experience BA/BS degree or equivalent experience, preferably in computer-related field 2-3 years of experience in Sales Support preferably in Telecommunications or IT industry with a basic understanding of the Order Processing cycle Siebel, Oracle and Salesforce.com knowledge/experience is a plus Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Ability to work and adapt in an international, fast pace and continuously changing environment Excellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skills. Strong team player Ability to professionally communicate and interact with all levels of internal and external customers Customer service focus Ability to juggle multiple priorities Data analytical skills, ability to make structure in complex situations. Strong attention to detail with a high degree of accuracy Self- starter attitude, ability to work independently, a fast learner Expertise in MS Word, Excel (including Excel pivot tables), PowerPoint required Good command of English language (Written and Oral)

Job_Title: Commercial Cards Regional Sales Manager - Senior Vice President
Job_Descriptions: Position Summary and Objective The role is within the Asia regional Commercial Cards team based in Singapore. The candidate will be responsible for leading a skilled team of Account Managers who service Citi Commercial Card’s top tier clients, which includes both Asia and Non Asia parented multinational companies, all with complex requirements across multiple product sets. In addition, the candidate will manage a team who directly manages their client’s activities across 14 markets within Asia Pacific, as well selective Asia parented clients who require global leadership. Given the nature of the role, the regional head will also be expected to have a portfolio of their own, which represents the most complex clients needing their leadership. The role requires leadership qualities which include but not limited to being highly motivated, excellent communication skills, high EQ, in depth industry knowledge and a sense of TEAM ethics. The key objective of the role is to strategically manage the Account Management portfolio of clients and position their accounts for growth and ramp, so our clients can meet their program goals across all product sets. As a trusted advisor the Account Management team is expected to lead and advise our clients in best practices and navigating the payments ecosystem. Given strategic nature of the role, the candidate will be expected to design, plan and execute on growth strategy in partnership with business partners and senior management sponsors globally and regionally. Team management responsibility will also be a key factor within the role, with the candidate needing to display a in depth understanding of their teams development goals, motivational factors and client portfolios. Background: Citi Treasury and Trade Services (TTS) offers a broad range of cash management and trade services including Commercial Cards. Citi’s global platform is unique in the industry for its reach, interoperability and flexibility. It provides clients with timely, accurate information and dynamic, web-based tools to effectively manage their securities portfolios, financial positions, working capital and supply chain around the world. Combined with a worldwide network of dedicated and experienced transaction services professionals, TTS is well-suited to serve clients anywhere they do business. Citi Commercial Cards Citi Commercial Cards is a marquee product line within the global TTS business. Citi is the most global provider of Commercial Cards with the ability to issue local currency solutions issue in 65+countries, leveraging its own proprietary platforms and issuance infrastructure. Citi Commercial Cards has been growing at or above industry rates for the past 3 years. Citi’s growth in Asia has been unprecedented. Asia represents a significant continued growth opportunity. The business supports comprehensive cards solutions across Travel, B2B, Purchasing, and Meeting & Events to Citi’s institutional clients, including the public sector. Key Responsibilities: Clients: Delivering new client flows in relation to sales targets both individually and for the team. Execution on deal RAMP for revenue realization across all clients within Account Management. Responsible for all Account Management client retention through sales process, pricing, contract and delivery. Conducting client reviews in alignment with business partners either as a Regional Account Manager or Global Account Manager, depending on client. Management of individual portfolio of clients directly under your responsibility. Organization and management of client events in partnership with business partners. Engagement of internal country, regional and global partners when designing and executing client strategy, including meaningful updates on program progress. Establishing client case studies and industry papers to help drive and guide the business. Team: Responsible for Account Managers and their day to day client activities. Have an in depth understanding of each team member – appreciating their respective approach to the role, skills and characteristics. Motivate, guide and respect each member by driving a sense of TEAM to amplify their skills and provide a platform for success. Clear development plans to help each member drive their career goals. Conduct and have regular 1:1’s and team meetings to ensure alignment. Strategic management of all Account Management clients through detailed account plans that position programs for greater efficiency, growth and best practices. Business: Facilitate and drive all cards and TTS initiatives. Be aware and mindful of business performance and growth strategy. Actively participate within the regional cards leadership team. Address all revenue impacting issues regardless of cause and support business needs. Champion change within the business and its clients as needed. Development Value: Part of the Commercial cards Asia leadership team and exposure to the global leadership seniors. Development of client and team management strategy, with complex account and products. Exposure to domestic, regional and global cards payments markets. High degree of partnership within TTS with knowledge of broader cash management products. Innovate and digitize cards payments infrastructure by being a client champion. Exposure to multi-regional engagements and Citi’s top TTS client base Drive innovation based on client feedback and experience Ability to grow and expand responsibilities within TTS and Citi Qualifications: Knowledge/Experience: Strong knowledge of commercial card products, industry and target clients Strong knowledge of the Asia markets and card technologies. Understanding of ecosystem players and their position/value proposition within the market. Experience in leading teams and ability to demonstrate business growth. Experience in a large, multi-national financial services firm and matrix organizational structure preferred Skills: Strong written and verbal communication/presentation skills – we are looking for an individual who is confident presenting to both small and large groups of people – including senior management within the client’s organization, as well as at Citi Must have strong consultative sales & negotiation skills Strategic Project Management – we require an individual who has an eye for detail and who can co-ordinate multiple teams to meet the project objectives Individual with excellent EQ and the ability to adapt to the multicultural team and markets they will operate within. Influence without authority – somebody who can navigate teams beyond their direct management and help drive business and client goals. Qualifications: 8 years minimum industry sales experience, preferably in the large market sector University Degree Excellent interpersonal skills to deal internally and externally with clients at senior level Ability to work in a global matrix environment Able to travel regionally, estimated 5-10% of the time depending on client or business needs.

Job_Title: Treasury and Trade Solutions - Account Management Senior Specialist - VP
Job_Descriptions: The Account Mgmt Sr Specialist is a strategic professional who stays abreast of developments within own field and contributes to directional strategy by considering their application in own job and the business. Recognized technical authority for an area within the business. Requires basic commercial awareness. There are typically multiple people within the business that provide the same level of subject matter expertise. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide, influence and convince others, in particular colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers. Significant impact on the area through complex deliverables. Provides advice and counsel related to the technology or operations of the business. Work impacts an entire area, which eventually affects the overall performance and effectiveness of the sub-function/job family. Responsibilities: Interface with a portfolio of Clients to develop an understanding of their operating procedures, organization structures and needs in identifying and supporting the delivery Citi Products Work closely in partnership with Sales and Coverage partners, focusing on revenue expansion and revenue realization through cross sell opportunities Responsible for driving deals through Implementation ensuring ramp up of revenue from deals implemented and monitoring revenues to ensure retention of existing revenue, manage and report attrition across client portfolio Be the client advocate in managing the Citi network, +100 countries to ensure client satisfaction: Identify and coordinate new cross-sell opportunities within own portfolio Drive revenue realization on deals implemented in partnership with the Sales Team and Implementations Develop and maintain industry knowledge Penetrate client organization and cultivate client contacts working with the Sales Specialist, Operations and Client Delivery to deliver superior client satisfaction Track all deals pending Implementation with Client Delivery and Operations partners Work in partnership with Global / Regional Solution Sales Specialist in the preparation and delivery, where applicable of Relationship Reviews Review, screen and co-ordinate timely responses to all clients related enquiries either personally or through redirecting to CEM, Service, ops or appropriate Product Specialists Build effective network working closely with overseas Citibank branches to be client advocate Co-ordinate and oversee (in partnership with Operations) the updating of customer account and/or product structures. Ensure CITIKYC/AML requirements met for new business opportunities and work in partnership with Operations and Implementations to ensure deals implemented and support provided to the client where necessary to drive revenue realization Assist with client communication of product migrations, regulatory changes and market updates for portfolio Coordinate and work closely with Sales Specialists for client Relationship Reviews and call briefing memos Responsible for monthly revenue analysis ensuring MIS systems accurately reflects account profitability; prepare summaries and forecasts communicating findings. Ensure AML enquiries handled promptly and thoughtfully ensuring adherence to Citi policies. Work with Global partners to ensure references are provided Drive the Service Quality Process at the client level Provide client feedback on product, process and service needs Take ownership, lead and track specific customer issues/problems including pricing and billing issues and work with the customer and internal departments until issues are resolved Work in close partnership with control functions such as Legal, Compliance, Market and Credit Risk, Audit, Finance in order to ensure appropriate governance and control infrastructure Build a culture of responsible finance, good governance and supervision, expense discipline and ethics Appropriately assess risk/reward of transactions when making business decisions Be familiar with and adhere to Citi’s Code of Conduct and the Plan of Supervision for Global Markets and Securities Services Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency. Qualifications: University Degree Proven track record of successful client focused activity, Back Office Cash Management or Trade Operations Experience Advanced problem solving skills Excellent interpersonal skills Committed, Trusted team player High energy and initiative Time Management and Organizational Skills Education: Bachelor’s/University degree, Master’s degree preferred This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required.

INTRODUCING The Product Success Manager StaffAny’s mission is to shape and empower the future of work. As the Product Success Manager, you ensure that our clients achieve product value and customer satisfaction,  directly contributing to the retention and account expansion rates of the Company. This role is uniquely different from other customer success roles as there is a huge emphasis on product success on top of the client facing customer success responsibilities. You will still be involved in the entire customer success process, from onboarding to client management. A huge part of the role also includes being the voice of the customer, collecting, analysing and presenting customer feedback to steer product direction and improve user experience. If you are someone who believes in product led growth and is able to continually drive business value to people around you, apply to join our rocketship. You Are Highly proficient in writing and speaking in English. Able to converse in Mandarin. Diplomacy, tact, and poise under pressure when working through customer issues. Empathy for customers and colleagues. Process-driven in your approach to work. Excellent coaching, writing, discovery, and presentation skills. Comfortable and willing to be a hands-on contributor. Great at setting up processes, measuring and improving them over time. Interested in contributing to product discovery and research, with basic understanding of statistics. You Will Find Yourself Drive customer success and help them to get the outcomes through the entire life cycle to ensure adoption, growth, and renewal. Define success plans jointly with customers and key stakeholders to deliver high value outcomes. Apply our customer maturity model to facilitate customer enablement, consumption, and growth in a phased and effective manner. Build trusted customer relationships by coupling deep domain and product expertise with constructive customer engagement. Act as the voice of our customers (VOC), conveying needs and issues internally across departments. Run the VOC programme and chair the meetings where you prioritize input from customers, Sales, and partners so the Product Team  can fully represent customer feedback in our Go-To-Market processes and product roadmap Document customer success stories and make them referenceable. Resolve customer escalations and restore customers’ path to success. Foster the customer community through direct engagement, content development, and webinar delivery in partnership with the marketing team. As the leader of the customer onboarding experience, you'll be actively involved in helping clients successfully launch and adopt StaffAny. You will help onboard and transition new customers from sales to implementation and full deployment with StaffAny solutions, whether this is 1:1 or 1 to many. Document your customer interactions and achieve measurable adoption results Analyse statistics to increase client retention How the department’s success is being measured % of newly onboarded customers achieving product success (internal definition will be shared during interview) in 30 days CSAT score Adoption of initiatives representing voice of the customer The Offer As a Product Success Manager, you'll have the opportunity to lead processes in the space of adoption, onboarding, support and success You’ll have the opportunity to cross collaborate with multiple departments and learn how customer centric tech products are being built Growth opportunities within 12 months window as we are expecting to double our team in the next 12 months Be part of a fast-paced growth environment where you learn how to be uncomfortable. Work together with a passionate and driven bunch of do-ers in a young and vibrant environment. Apply to us here: https://www.staffany.com/careers-product-success-manager/

Job_Title: Young & interested in Accounting? Join our Accounts team!
Job_Descriptions: Job description Our company marks the dedication to provide Singapore and people across the world a diverse range of Drug, Alcohol and Infectious Disease testing equipment and Services. We are committed to developing a drug-free workplace. Providing a safe working environment for your employees is important to protect your business, staff and customers. Our specialist’s consultants help you tailor towards your requirement based on the nature of your business and environment you aim to create. Our services include pre-employment drug testing, workplace random drug screening, post-accident testing. Over the years, our global network of specimen collectors has grown. We have just been granted approval to sell Self-testing ART kits and we are expanding our team. By joining us, you will have the following opportunities, and many more: Career Advancement: When working with us, you will always have the opportunity to succeed. We will actively support and encourage you to develop your career and grow as a professional. Continuous Learning: You will be mentored and trained by our team. Remarkable Colleagues: When you join our team, you join a group of diverse individuals who are dedicated and passionate about the work they do every single day. The day-to-day activities: Assist in monthly closing of AP/ AR Raise tax invoice and credit notes Full set of accounts Monitor and follow up on long overdue debts with relevant parties Assist to entering receipt into system Prepare Aging Report In charge of petty cash Any other ad-hoc administrative work The must haves: Accounting knowledge and/or experience Must be computer-literate and proficient in MS Office and preferably have hands-on experience with accounting software Responsible, meticulous and independent Highly proficient in English Accuracy and quality-driven mindset Ability to work well in a fast-paced environment Tech savvy Working hours is Monday - Friday, 9am - 6pm Location: Bukit Batok Salary: $2,500 - $3,100 / month Job Types: Full-time, Permanent Fresh graduates and experienced candidates are welcome. COVID-19 considerations: It is compulsory for masks to be worn throughout the whole interview and in workplace.

About us VFlowTech (VFT) is reinventing energy storage with Vanadium redox flow technology, with a vision to develop the cheapest and most scalable Vanadium redox flow batteries in the world. VFT storage solution has an expected life span of 25 years and is proven to be one of the safest and most environmentally friendly battery technologies. VFT founders have deep experience in the renewable space, and Vanadium redox flow technology. VFT is a spin-off of the CleanTech lab of Nanyang Technological University (NTU), Singapore, and benefits from unique IP arising from many years of intensive research at NTU. Responsibilities: · Participating in the design, analysis, and execution of all technical aspects of electronic products and projects which meet or exceed the hardware requirements. · Ensure design solutions meet product specifications and functional requirements on performance, reliability, serviceability, compliance with regulatory standards. · Prototype and implement new product design including analogue and digital hardware · Hardware development and production test setup development · Resolve technical issues and ensure changes implemented to avoid reoccurrence. · Improve product, process, and consistency in technical execution. · Participate in Electronics knowledge development, innovative technology, and market trends to assist in the contribution to the battery management technology roadmap. · Prototypes bring-up, testing and debugging · Executes component- and system-level simulations · Safeguard compliance to IEC/UL standards and regulatory requirements · Maintains documentation per product and technology type · Collaborates in a team environment across multiple engineering disciplines Requirements: · Minimum 2+ years’ experience in design and development of Electronics Hardware circuits and system · Design knowledge and experience in major aspect of Electronics: Power Electronics, Motor control, Analog, Digital and sensing technology with its interfacing · Have understanding on Embedded ARM Cortex microcontroller-based platforms/PLC · Working Knowledge of Schematic capture, PCB layout software · Experience in EMC will be an advantage · Knowledge in Wiring design/SLD will be an advantage · Experience is Design QA, DFMEA will be an advantage · Experience in Battery Management System PLC will be an advantage · Knowledge in regulatory standards. Your Benefits · Enjoy a work-life balance · Medical & Dental insurance · Variable bonus · Competitive remuneration package and benefits scheme Our Company Culture Our team is diverse, international and shares the drive to make a difference and create change. · We encourage our team to bring in their ideas and take initiatives that make them proud of being part of VFT · We foster a rapidly scaling working environment with a very entrepreneurial, innovative, and collaborative culture · We see the opportunities, where others see problems · We never stand still and constantly seek opportunities to improve

Aladdin Business, Implementation, Associate Description About this role About this role: The Aladdin Business is growing rapidly, with the volume and complexity of new client deals and strategic partnerships growing each year. We are at the next phase of our growth and are evolving into a platform focused business with multiple new product launches and external partnerships. Successful candidates will join in our efforts to help sophisticated investors onboard the world's leading end-to-end operating system for investment portfolios to see their whole portfolio, understand risk exposures, and act with precision. Associate and Vice President roles are available within the team's practice areas, including Aladdin Core, Aladdin Front Office, Aladdin Accounting, Aladdin Provider, Aladdin Wealth, Aladdin Whole Portfolio, and Aladdin Studio & Data Warehouse . Your team: The Aladdin Implementation Team is responsible for the installation and deployment of Aladdin and related products and services, globally. Aladdin Implementations, including both institutional and retail assignments, are high profile initiatives that require team members to have senior level exposure and play an active role in redefinition of investment organizations. A typical implementation is at least as much about processes and implementing change as it is about investments & technology. We help clients achieve ambitious strategic objectives, which range from streamlining investment operations to integrating teams, to unifying their investment analytics & risk reporting framework, to modernizing their overall investment process. BlackRock's implementation model is unique in the sense that we take full responsibility for the Client going live on our solution. It also means that we develop true partnerships with our clients at the most senior levels, which continue to grow post go live. Your responsibilities: Understand client objectives and goals paired with strong emotional ownership to deliver on solutions utilizing Aladdin capabilities Engage the Client's key leaders to understand, redesign, and deploy strategic business workflows across the full spectrum of the investment cycle, including pre-trade decisioning, order management, trading, investment operations, risk management/compliance/oversight, closed-book accounting, or performance measurement & attribution Collaborate closely with the Client's senior management team (e.g. Chief Investment Officer, Chief Risk Officer, Head Portfolio Managers, Head of Investment Operations, Chief Technology Officer) and provide strong leadership throughout the Aladdin implementation Work directly with the Client to create and administer the implementation project plan, as well as the coordination of resources across multiple functional areas Lead and document investment and operational workflow design sessions for various asset classes, including equities, fixed income, alternatives, derivatives, and related workflows Gain an in-depth knowledge of Aladdin functionality and workflows, as well as industry expertise (e.g., pensions, insurers, asset managers) to ensure clients take full advantage of the suite of Aladdin products and workflows Lead, coordinate, and assist in client-specific Aladdin configuration, testing and user training Work closely with the Client and Aladdin Product Managers to support client development needs Work closely with the Client and key internal functional teams to ensure the full range of capabilities are considered during an Aladdin implementation to ensure standard methodologies are achieved Participate in Aladdin business development activities, assisting in platform demonstrations, implementation pre-planning, or client due diligence, as a product/workflow subject matter authority Actively manage client communications regarding Aladdin product changes and configurations, as related to Aladdin onboarding Aid in developing improved practices to make the Implementation model more efficient with each new implementation Develop strong relationships within BlackRock Solutions and BlackRock to ensure the best client experience Your qualifications: Deep understanding of investment operations, investment accounting, front office, or investment risk as a provider or practitioner, with 4-10 years of relevant industry experience Experience implementing scalable and repeatable business processes Excellent interpersonal skills with proven ability to build relationships with internal and client senior management Superior communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts simply and clearly to clients Well organized with the ability to manage several priorities with a hands-on approach Strong familiarity with capital markets instruments (equities, fixed income, private markets, derivatives), either analytically or via strong knowledge of investment life cycle Excellent creative, analytical and computer skills with an entrepreneurial approach to large, complex projects, and ability to execute autonomously Enjoys a fast paced, high-intensity and complex environment, troubleshooting time critical issues and working with people Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Strong attention to detail; willing to take proactive action, and desire to roll up sleeves Expected to travel periodically, including international opportunities Nice if you have: Track record of leading successful implementations of investment technology solutions (order/trading systems, risk platforms, operations tools) Working experience in investment risk management, fixed-income, equity and derivative markets and solid understanding of the investment lifecycle. Programming background or experience with query languages desired Served as a provider or market practitioner in the areas of portfolio management, trading, investment operations, investment accounting, risk management, or data warehousing Deep investment subject matter and investment workflow expertise Experience with order management systems, electronic trading platforms, or derivative platforms Understanding of investment risk (e.g., sustainability analytics, market risk analytics) Familiarity with buy-side institutional investment management process Experience with platform integrations (e.g., interfaces, APIs) Line management experience Project management experience (e.g., PMP) MBA, CFA, or FRM preferred SQL, Python, VBA experience a plus Our benefits To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about. About BlackRock At BlackRock, we are all connected by one mission: to help more and more people experience financial well-being. Our clients, and the people they serve, are saving for retirement, paying for their children's educations, buying homes and starting businesses. Their investments also help to strengthen the global economy: support businesses small and large; finance infrastructure projects that connect and power cities; and facilitate innovations that drive progress. This mission would not be possible without our smartest investment - the one we make in our employees. It's why we're dedicated to creating an environment where our colleagues feel welcomed, valued and supported with networks, benefits and development opportunities to help them thrive. For additional information on BlackRock, please visit careers.blackrock.com | www.blackrock.com/corporate | Instagram: @blackrock | Twitter: @blackrock | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/blackrock BlackRock is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law. BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.

Introduction Automata Network ( https://ata.network ) is a decentralized service protocol that provides privacy middlewares for dApps on Ethereum and Polkadot to achieve privacy, high assurance and frictionless computation. Leveraging on the latest crypto and privacy-protection algorithms, along with hardware-based trust, the service protocol enables versatile use-cases not previously possible in the past, such as anonymous voting, MEV minimization, and no-tracking indexing. Job_Descriptions: Redshift Database Engineer, 6 month contract renewable About TEKsystems: We're in the business of building tomorrow. Job Description: You will lead a new project to upgrade, build and optimise a new Data Warehouse / Data Lake combination. As a senior member of the team your role will encompass elements of project management to set and drive the product roadmap, allocation of resources and provision of technical leadership. You'll be working in a technology driven environment utilising the latest tools and techniques such as Redshift, S3, Lambda, DynamoDB, Athena and Kafka. Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture by designing and implementing data ingestion solutions on AWS using AWS native services or using data management technologies such as Talend or Informatica hosted on AWS. Integrate and assemble large, complex data sets using AWS services such as Glue that meet a broad range of business requirements. Design and optimize data models on AWS Cloud using AWS data stores such as Redshift, RDS, S3 Integrate AWS or 3rd party KMS, HSM with AWS data services for building secure data solutions Operationalize self service data preparation tools e.g. Trifacta and Paxata on AWS. Design operations architecture and conduct performance engineering for large scale data lakes in production environment Participate in client design workshops and provide tradeoffs and recommendations towards building solutions. Mentor other engineers in coding best practices and problem solving. Requirements Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent work experience 10+ years of experience using databases, out of which 5 years hands on experience of Amazon Redshift Architecture or equivalent Columnar DB. Hands on experience in Data Warehouse (DW) and BI tools is mandatory Should understand nuances of moving data from RDBMS sources to Columnar DB (Redshift) AWS Pipeline knowledge to develop ETL for data movement to Redshift Strong knowledge on AWS environment and Service knowledge with S3 storage understanding Strong knowledge multiple cloud technologies including VPC, EC2, S3, Amazon API Gateway, DynamoDB, SimpleDB, AWS Route 53 For more information you can email Michelle Hoang in our Singapore office on michelle.hoang@teksystems.com quoting Job Reference 527697 or alternatively, apply here to register your interest. http://jobs.en-sg.teksystems.com/TtaOqI/redshift-database-engineer-6-month-contract-renewable-itcommunications-singapore-central-singapore-14872755 Allegis Group Singapore Pte Ltd, Company Reg No. 200909448N, EA License No. 10C4544
