Product Designer, Enterprise, Group Design Your team and career You will be part of the DBS enterprise design team. The enterprise design team is redefining what great internal tools look like: working on a collaborative platform to enable bankers, credit risk managers and credit controllers to manage corporate loans digitally. Behind the scenes, the team understands how important it is for a proper design process and system to be in place before great things can happen. What you'll be doing You'll spend most of your time trying to simplify very complex products and ideas. It may be an uphill battle, but it's worth it. If you succeed, your designs will enable thousands of people to serve millions of our customers better. We say that, if you can work in a bank, you can work anywhere. Don't worry, we're a nice bunch of people. Around here, we go out of our way to help one another. Here's what your week might look like You'll spend time with our wonderful research team. Together you'll try to understand the business goals of your project and, more often than not, meet the stakeholders to redefine the problem statement. Once you know where you're going, it's time to tackle the behemoth tech systems and legal restrictions of a bank. Your product manager will become your best friend. You'll message the tech lead more than your parents. You'll get a crash course in finance law. We do respect the privacy of people with headphones-on, trying to avoid eye contact. So you'll have the time to actually produce work you're proud of. We want to hire people who have opinions, believe in their ideas and are willing to fight for them. But we also want people who can recognise when a better argument or solution is put before them. All of us participate in user testing, and so will you. Like we said, producing good work is not good enough if it doesn't get built. We love you, Dribble/Behance. It's not you, it's us. You will meet stakeholders from different departments and articulate your ideas so clearly that you'll become an honorary Toastmaster. To prepare for those meetings you'll need to check the latest relevant data. Before you know it, it will be Friday and time for team dinner, drinks or Creative Day (we do something fun and creative together once a month). Here are the experience and skills we'd love you to have You're an end-to-end designer: you can turn high-level requirements into well-posed problem statements, wireframes, prototypes or Powerpoints for the management teams. You can talk confidently and clearly about design and build lasting relationships with our stakeholders. And you're not afraid to improvise-to think on your feet-when required. You can brainstorm the next big thing one moment and still tweak pixels right before launch. You have the ability to prioritise (you don't focus on illustrations if the UX looks like a love child between Frankenstein and Krusty the Clown). You work smart and are ready to improve processes. You have enough curiosity to stay savvy about industry and UX trends. You have confidence in your ideas and the ability to communicate them clearly. You follow through-when built, your designs actually look and work like they should. You monitor products after launch and are ready to suggest improvements. Bonus points You actively contribute to the UX community. You're kind of a behavioural science geek. You have personal pet projects you work on for fun in your free time. You have experience with Agile methodology and financial products in Treasury domain is ideal Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognizes your achievements

Posted by: Jacylnn Tan Onsite Recruitment Lead View profile & contact 2022 Operations Academy Programme - Singapore Company Overview We're a global investment manager. We help institutions, intermediaries and individuals around the world invest money to meet their goals, fulfil their ambitions, and prepare for the future. We have around 5,000 people on six continents. And we've been around for over 200 years, but keep adapting as society and technology changes. What doesn't change is our commitment to helping our clients, and society, prosper. We're committed to investing sustainably and integrate Environment, Social and Corporate Governance (ESG) into our decision-making across all investments whilst maintaining long term performance for our clients. We can back this up with our impact measurement tool which combines measures of harm and good effect of companies to provide the overall social and environmental impact. Our Operations Team We support our global business by providing high quality and efficient operational oversight, processing and reporting across all of our business channels. Operations covers a broad spectrum of responsibilities from ensuring confirmation and settlement of trade activity, daily oversight of the funds Net Asset Value (NAV) to ensuring that we meet all of our Client, Fund and regulatory reporting obligations. It's a busy and dynamic area with many exciting opportunities to build and develop your career. The Base In Singapore, Schroders' presence dates back to the mid-1970s. Since then, we have successfully built a strong local franchise and are one of the largest asset management companies in Singapore today. We manage funds for a broad range of clients including official institutions, sovereign wealth funds, insurance companies, charities, government-linked companies, high net worth individuals and retail investors. Singapore is our Asia Pacific operations hub, providing operational oversight to other offices in the region such as Australia, Indonesia, Hong Kong and Japan. The team constantly seeks to develop and adopt innovative and collaborative solutions to bring the best results for our clients. The Programme You will join as a permanent employee and start your career in the Operations Academy before moving into a dedicated team.  Over the two-year programme, you will be rotated across a number of areas to give you an introduction into operations.  You will also have the opportunity to network and meet with the wider business groups, which will give you insight into the world of asset management. We want you to be innovative and creative in your approach in understanding what we do and how we do it. We will provide training throughout the two-year programme which will cover: aspects of the asset management industry via accredited learning to gain the Level 3 - Investment Operations Certificate; functional knowledge through a regular rotation into different teams; application training as part of the on-the-job experience; as well as non-functional training, such as organisation skills and written/verbal communication effectiveness, to help broaden your overall skills set. You will learn from experienced colleagues as they guide you through the various applications and processes which will allow you perform your role more efficiently. The knowledge, experience, and qualifications • Demonstrates strong communication skills and working well within a team environment. • Experience of prioritising workload, demonstrating a keen eye for detail, problem solving and confidence in communicating escalations when required. • Show great interpersonal and analytical skills. We will teach what you need to know about the job. We just need you to bring your drive, passion and enthusiasm to make the most of the opportunity. The candidate we are looking for We take pride in hiring the right people for our programmes. People who can hit the ground running and want to make a difference. • We look for people who are naturally curious about the world around them and who are eager to learn more about our industry and what we do. • We want someone who is not afraid to bring new ideas to the table • You are someone who is flexible and able to think independently, be proactive and an advocate for change • A team player with strong communication and collaboration skills are essential as you will work as part of a team to overcome challenges and share ideas. • A growth mindset: we understand you may make mistakes, and when you do, we are looking for you to learn from these • We want you to contribute to our continuously evolving culture, whether it's participating in our recreational clubs and campaigns or starting your own. Recruitment process 1.    Online application form and CV 2.    Online assessments 3.    Online video interview 4.    Assessment centre 5.    Final round interview Applications will close approximately 2-3 weeks before the assessment centre, but please note that we recruit on a rolling basis so we would recommend that you apply early.

What the role is The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) is Singapore’s central bank and integrated financial regulator. As central bank, MAS promotes sustained, non-inflationary economic growth through the conduct of monetary policy and close macroeconomic surveillance and analysis. It manages Singapore’s exchange rate, official foreign reserves, and liquidity in the banking sector. As an integrated financial supervisor, MAS fosters a sound financial services sector through its prudential oversight of all financial institutions in Singapore – banks, insurers, capital market intermediaries, financial advisors, and stock exchanges. It is also responsible for well-functioning financial markets, sound conduct, and investor education. MAS also works with the financial industry to promote Singapore as a dynamic international financial centre. It facilitates the development of infrastructure, adoption of technology, and upgrading of skills in the financial industry. Join us now, if you have a genuine interest in making an impact to help shape Singapore’s economic and financial landscape. What you will be working on You will be part of the team responsible for defining and delivering the digital transformation of the MAS internal processes and industry facing platforms. In this role, you are expected to: Lead the overall UI/UX design efforts across the organisation, which would include overseeing the MAS design system, developing a framework to facilitate a repeatable process for UI/UX Design across multiple products, guiding and mentoring UI/UX designers Lead the design process for specific digital products Understand the as-is process with the product team and identify pain points for improvements Analyse, develop and refine user personas, journeys and stories to design potential solutions Conduct UX research and testing to translate user requirements into customer journey maps and task flows using tools such as wire-framing and prototyping Develop intuitive and user-friendly UI designs Determine information architecture and define appropriate interaction model, and evaluate success Communicate design ideas and prototypes to developers Promote service offerings, plan and execute change management activities to transit users to adopt new technologies Work with business and technology subject matter experts to define scope, develop project plans, and produce other planning documentation as needed You will be working in a fast-paced environment that would require the ability to manage multiple priorities and needs of stakeholders, as well as the agility to respond to changes and developments. What we are looking for Previous experience in UI/UX design and implementation, with strong portfolio of design projects (3+ years). Preference will be given to candidates who have experience designing complex solutions for complete digital environment Experience in standard UX software such as Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD, InVision and Adobe Photoshop Good understanding of user experience mapping/design thinking Familiarity with mobility challenges and solutions, with a focus on end user services domain Self-driven, creative person with good interpersonal and communication skills to be able to work independently as well as in a team. Candidates with UX Design, Design Thinking and Secure web front-end coding certifications, and knowledge of HTML 5, CSS3 and Javascript will have an added advantage As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

Restaurant Cashier Job Description, Duties, and Responsibilities The restaurant cashier’s job description covers interacting with customers and accepting payment from them for products and services provided. An essential position in any restaurant will involve the person handling money. Such personnel are referred to as restaurant cashiers. They can also be regarded as the waiter/waitress, the floor manager, or host of the restaurant. The shift or restaurant manager usually reviews the contents of the drawer at the start and end of the cashier’s working period to ensure accuracy in calculations. The restaurant cashier in this context may be responsible for calculations involving a lot of cash, and in separating checks. Having basic experience working with check authentication appliances and credit card machines will be a valuable quality for the cashier. Customers mostly have the opportunity to speak with only the cashier during the whole period of their stay at the restaurant. He/she is therefore obligated to welcome customers with a warm smile. Payments are immediately entered into the payment system and collected by the cashier at the completion of the meal. A productive restaurant cashier is able to switch roles quickly between performing major restaurant tasks and attending to the needs of customers. He/she serves each visitor respectfully, swiftly and effectively with an honest, positive, friendly, and exuberant attitude. His/her responsibilities also include filing orders, receiving money, and carrying out suggestive selling while managing all cash issued and received during his/her shift. He/she may need to perform smaller tasks to assist other personnel in quickly rounding up and closing the restaurant for the night. These duties are usually done while the supervisor or manager reviews the cashier register. Tasks scheduled for closing period may include clearing of trash, cleaning the front station, and restocking, among other duties. Restaurant Cashier Job Description Here is an example of job description normally executed by cashiers working at most restaurants, showing key duties, tasks, and responsibilities of the job. Take customer orders at the counter Receive payments and present change to customers Pack food items, make coffee, and fill beverage cups Function as the host/hostess of the restaurant Make reservations for customers Receive food checks from waiters or customers Appeal to impatient or irritated customers, especially during rush hours Manage the register, including all credit card and cash operations Ensure a balance of the register at the end of the shift or working period Requirement: High school diploma with experience in related positions, as well as working knowledge in a similar role Excellent mathematical, multitasking, and computer skills Proficiency in using computers, calculator, and other machines required for transactions Outstanding customer relation skills and ability to ensure a customer priority culture Ability to work with flexibility in a continuous schedule of day, nights, holidays, and weekends

Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. Lead to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank's Conduct Principles : Fair Outcomes for Clients; Effective Financial Markets; Financial Crime Compliance; The Right Environment. To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages . We welcome conversations on flexible working.

Job_Title: Senior Associate, Product Designer, Consumer Banking Group
Job_Descriptions: Senior Associate, Product Designer, Consumer Banking Group About the design team Hi, we are the DBS user experience design team We create digital products that deserve to be built because they solve real problems in an impactful way with empathy. How we design We go beyond numbers Every dollar means something. No one actually wants money. We want what it can give us. So we acknowledge that money is not really about money. We inject emotion into our products to go from transactional to magical. We have one profound idea Because ambiguity is the enemy of good user experience. What is our unique value proposition? Would adding another feature dilute the idea or make it stronger? What you'll be doing You'll spend most of your time trying to simplify very complex products and ideas. It may be an uphill battle, but it's worth it. If you succeed, your designs will enable thousands of people to serve millions of our customers better. We say that, if you can work in a bank, you can work anywhere. Don't worry, we're a nice bunch of people. Around here, we go out of our way to help one another. You'll spend time with our wonderful research team. Together you'll try to understand the business goals of your project and, more often than not, meet the stakeholders to redefine the problem statement. Once you know where you're going, it's time to tackle the behemoth tech systems and legal restrictions of a bank. Your product manager will become your best friend. You'll message the tech lead more than your parents. You'll get a crash course in finance law. We do respect the privacy of people with headphones-on, trying to avoid eye contact. So you'll have the time to actually produce work you're proud of. We want to hire people who have opinions, believe in their ideas and are willing to fight for them. But we also want people who can recognize when a better argument or solution is put before them. All of us participate in user testing, and so will you. Like we said, producing good work is not good enough if it doesn't get built. We love you, Dribble/Behance. It's not you, it's us. You will meet stakeholders from different departments and articulate your ideas so clearly that you'll become an honorary Toastmaster. To prepare for those meetings you'll need to check the latest relevant data. Before you know it, it will be Friday and time for team dinner, drinks or Creative Day (we do something fun and creative together once a month). Your team and career: You will be part of the DBS enterprise design team. The enterprise design team is redefining what great internal tools look like: working on a collaborative platform to enable bankers, credit risk managers and credit controllers to manage corporate loans digitally. Behind the scenes, the team understands how important it is for a proper design process and system to be in place before great things can happen. Experience You're an end-to-end designer: you can turn high-level requirements into well-posed problem statements, wireframes, prototypes or Powerpoints for the management teams. You can talk confidently and clearly about design and build lasting relationships with our stakeholders. And you're not afraid to improvise-to think on your feet-when required. You can brainstorm the next big thing one moment and still tweak pixels right before launch. You have the ability to prioritize (you don't focus on illustrations if the UX looks like a love child between Frankenstein and Krusty the Clown). You work smart and are ready to improve processes. You have enough curiosity to stay savvy about industry and UX trends. You have confidence in your ideas and the ability to communicate them clearly. You follow through-when built, your designs actually look and work like they should. You monitor products after launch and are ready to suggest improvements. You actively contribute to the UX community. You're kind of a behavioural science geek. You have personal pet projects you work on for fun in your free time. Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognizes your achievements

Job_Title: Network Production Services Lead - 1 Year Contract
Job_Descriptions: Posted by: Irfana Farhath Recruiter View profile & contact The Position is responsible for assisting in both Event and Incident management focusing on the network infrastructure connecting from the front-end web services and applications right to the backend mainframes and databases. This highly visible and critical position of the bank’s client facing platforms covers 24x7 network event monitoring. Partnering with other subject matter experts on customer impacting issues that arise. Ensure the issue is triaged and addressed promptly and mitigated or resolved in the quickest and most efficient manner, to minimize impact to our customers. Post an incident, perform initial root cause analysis, identifying potential gaps and opportunities. Key Responsibilities • Event monitoring of networking components ranging from Cisco switches /F5 Loadbalancer / Firewalls / Proxies / DNS • Provide support during change windows, validation and certification of change completion • Engagement & triage for network related issues, or assist in isolation of issues at the application layer relating to response times, connectivity etc. • Proactively reaching out to understand connectivity and interdependency between applications and the network components between • Value add through gaining a strong end to end knowledge and understanding of the infrastructure. To eventually possess the ability to dive deeply when activated without the need to ask for specific source/destination to start with, but by just the application name. • Communicate with various audiences leaders regarding network related issues. Possess the ability to drive a call and bring an issue to a mitigated point • Participate in post incident review for high impacting network related issues. Assist in the follow-up and potential permanent fixes with the respective teams/vendors • Fast paced team environment, ability to work independently under highly stressful situations and yet think logically to work around the problem is essential Key Requirements • Position requires demonstrated actual hands on experience troubleshooting production related issues on Cisco Network devices, F5 loadbalancers, Proxy, Firewalls , DNS • Due to the end to end nature of the role, knowledge in webservers/ operating systems (Linux/windows), Java virtual machines, database interconnectivity, performance tuning backgrounds would have an added advantage • Candidates who possess prior experience in loadbalancing design and implementation would be a plus • Candidate should possess at least 5 years working experience in equivalent environments • Candidate should hold a degree in IT or equivalent qualification • Candidates with current relevant product certifications e.g. CCIE, CISSP etc would have an added advantage • Candidate will need to effectively lead a network related triage or participate actively until resolution • Possess critical thinking and experience to manage high customer impacting scenarios in a logical effective manner is a must

Job_Title: Manager – Data Analytics and Intel (Data Scientist)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Data Operations and Intel Division in IMDA is the cybersecurity arm that process and analyse data to discover trends and precursors to potential incidents that can impact the resilience and cybersecurity posture of the infocomm and media sector. You will be part of the team that research and gather data to analyse and generate intel on potential resilience and cybersecurity risks and threats. You will work closely with the team to develop the supporting capabilities that enable intel gathering, analysis, sense making and sharing of data. What you will be working on The successful candidate shall be responsible, among others, to: Strategise data analytics development focus areas to meet organisation’s cybersecurity and resilience needs Research and implement new statistical or machine learning models, using an ensemble of mathematical methodologies as needed for specific models or analysis Research and implement approaches to enhance and optimise existing data analytics models to improve performance, precision and confidence level Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyse model performance and data accuracy. Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes. Work with stakeholders throughout the organisation to identify opportunities for leveraging data to improve cybersecurity capabilities Work with vendors to develop data analytics systems and validate accuracy of data models developed. Monitor advancements in big data technologies and identify new tools and frameworks that could improve efficiency and fine tune existing data analytics platforms. What we are looking for Requirements: Degree / Masters in Computer Science / Computer Engineering / Mathematics / Statistics / Data Science and Analytics. At least 4 years of experience in quantitative data analytic or machine learning model development for cybersecurity or network infrastructure use cases using big data platforms. Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks. Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modelling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc. Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with their application. Experience in using databases and frameworks for big data analytics such as Hadoop / Hive / Spark, and able to write complex SQL queries. Familiarity with big data streaming tools, database frameworks and visualisation tools such as Apache NiFi, Storm, Spark, Hadoop, Airflow, Kibana, Tableau and their areas of applicability. Domain knowledge and experience in Computer networking, Network security, or System security is preferred. Good understanding of Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and Deep Learning concepts. Good writing, communication and presentation skills. Fast learner with self-motivation and independence to acquire knowledge on new domains or technologies quickly. This position will commensurate with experience Only shortlisted applicants will be notified

Job_Title: R0175824 Chairman – Group Audit – Corporate Banking Principal Auditor (Technology focused) - AVP
Job_Descriptions: Posted by: Sandeep Virothu Recruiter View profile & contact The Principal Auditor leads or works independently on audits of a specific business/functional area/region, and evaluates the adequacy and effectiveness of internal controls relating to risks within those business areas. They will proactively develop and maintains professional consultative working relationships within their own function and with stakeholders inside and outside the bank and respective support areas. They will use a range of approaches to collect relevant information to assess key risks, resolve major issues or carry out tasks. Job Description Executes day-to-day operational audit work and contributes to the delivery of audits Plans audits e.g. documenting activity flows of the processes to be reviewed, identifies risks and the key actual controls in place to mitigate the identified risks and attends meetings with internal stakeholders as and when required. Drafts audit findings for review by the Lead Auditor and the Principal Audit Manager, facilitates issue tracking and validates them to closure. Executes audit fieldwork in line with the agreed audit approach e.g. documenting Activity Flows, identification of key risks, testing of key controls to determine whether they are properly designed and are operating effectively and documenting work in accordance with divisional standards. Engage with CB IT teams to deliver audits in collaborative manner. Reviews and provides expert opinions on action plans provided by clients, helping them develop robust remediation plans. Completes all assigned audit work in line with agreed budgets, including ad hoc projects and special investigations. Acts as a competent partner and challenger to clients in the closure process of findings. Communicates openly with divisional management and the internal stakeholders; keeps them informed of potential issues and escalate problems/delays accordingly. Presents complex and sensitive messages (such as audit issues) comprehensively, professionally and reduces complex topics to simple statements. Participates in exit meetings as required. Proactively keeps abreast of pertinent industry, regulatory and business practices. Establishes and maintains a client service/relationship approach with clients in order to understand their business needs. Interprets stakeholder feedback on key business developments/risks and understands the clients’ marketplace in order to address their needs and expectations while delivering ‘one voice’ to the client in all communications and correspondence. Additional Job Description Details of the Division and Team: Principal Auditor role within the Corporate Bank (CB) Audit team reporting into CB APAC Principal Audit Manager (PAM) who in turn reports into the APAC Chief Auditor (CA). The Principal Auditor leads or participates in audits of a Corporate Bank business/function area identifying key automated application controls as well as performs CB product audits in accordance with the Audit methodology and evaluates the adequacy and effectiveness of internal controls relating to risks within those business areas. The Principal Auditor may occasionally participate in ad hoc projects and special investigations. The Principal Auditor works in a cooperative manner with subject matter experts and other teams from across the function to provide ‘front-to-back’/SME audit coverage and actively contributes to the delivery of team plans in support of the functional and business strategies under limited supervision. The Principal Auditor uses a range of sources and methods to obtain knowledge and applies judgment based on sound business knowledge of day-to-day audit work; this includes identifying and assessing key risks and designing testing to assess the design and operating effectiveness of the key controls in place to mitigate risk. The Principal Auditor needs to have a good understanding of the relevant business area’s technology environment and needs to continuously develop technical expertise relevant to the industry. The Principal Auditor must proactively develop and maintain professional consultative working relationships with the audit team, with internal stakeholders, clients and respective support areas and must use a range of approaches to collect relevant and readily available information to assess risk, resolve issues or carry out tasks. Your key responsibilities: Executes day-to-day operational audit work and contributes to the delivery of audits Plans audits e.g. documenting activity flows of the processes to be reviewed, identifies risks and the key actual controls in place to mitigate the identified risks and attends meetings with internal stakeholders as and when required. Drafts audit findings for review by the Principal Audit Manager, facilitates issue tracking and validates them to closure. Executes audit fieldwork in line with the agreed audit approach e.g. documenting Activity Flows, identification of key risks, testing of key controls to determine whether they are properly designed and are operating effectively and documenting work in accordance with divisional standards. Engage with wider CB IT team to deliver audits in collaborative manner. Reviews and provides expert opinions on action plans provided by clients, helping them develop robust remediation plans. Completes all assigned audit work in line with agreed budgets, including ad hoc projects and special investigations. Acts as a competent partner and challenger to clients in the closure process of findings. Communicates openly with divisional management and the internal stakeholders; keeps them informed of potential issues and escalate problems/delays accordingly. Presents complex and sensitive messages (such as audit issues) comprehensively, professionally and reduces complex topics to simple statements. Participates in exit meetings as required. Proactively keeps abreast of pertinent industry, regulatory and business practices. Establishes and maintains a client service/relationship approach with clients in order to understand their business needs. Interprets stakeholder feedback on key business developments/risks and understands the clients’ marketplace in order to address their needs and expectations while delivering ‘one voice’ to the client in all communications and correspondence. Your skills and experience: At least 7-10 years of experience in Audit including IT Audit. Robust knowledge and experience of auditing IT application controls. Some knowledge in Corporate Banking application controls is required. Exposure to Corporate Banking products supporting Trade Finance, Cash, Securities Services and the transaction/payments processing lifecycle F2B including operations. Candidate that can demonstrate auditing knowledge in Corporate banking context will be an added advantage. Knowledge of APIs and data analytics would be beneficial. Experience of risk-based auditing and clearly understand the relationship between IT risk and underlying business risk. Strong communication skills, communicating with clarity, both orally and in writing, in a logical order and structured approach. Fluent in English (written and verbal) Strong relationship management, analytical, problem solving, communication, influencing, planning and presentation skills. Ability to work in a fast-paced business environment. Able to work in virtual, global teams in a matrix organisation, transfer knowledge and develop capability of team members. Bachelor Degree preferably in a Technology related field (or equivalent) from an accredited college or university (or equivalent) or equivalent work experience. Professional/industry recognised qualifications e.g. CISA, CISM, CRISC. , are highly beneficial.

Job_Title: Manager - Data Sourcing and Development (Acquisitions and Strategisation)

Monitor advancements in big data technologies and identify new tools and frameworks that could improve efficiency and fine tune existing data analytics platforms. Conceptualise and project manage the development of infrastructure required for optical extraction, transformation, and loading of large volume data from various data sources. Identify and acquire the necessary data Identify and acquire tools and platforms to facilitate data analytics and management Identify resilence and cybersecurity use cases to support operation needs and improve work efficiency What we are looking for Requirements Degree in Computer Science / Computer Engineering / Information Systems, preferably with knowledge of cyber security. At least 2 years of experience in project managing of system using big data technologies, preferably for cybersecurity projects. Able to strategise, plan and conceptualise ideas into presentation format (e.g. powerpoint slides) to senior stakeholders Familiarity with government procurement guidelines and have at least 3 years of experience in purchasing for information technology projects. Familiarity with big data streaming tools, database frameworks and visualisation tools such as Apache NiFi, Kafka, Storm, Spark, Hadoop, Airflow, Kibana, Tableau and their areas of applicability. Good understanding of Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and Deep Learning concepts. Domain knowledge and experience in Computer networking, Network security, or System security is preferred. Good writing, communication and presentation skills. Fast learner with self-motivation and independence to acquire knowledge on new domains or technologies quickly. Strong analytical and problem-solving ability. Willingness to delve into administrative, legislative, technical, research and development works. This position will commensurate with experience Only shortlisted applicants will be notified

Introduction Automata Network is a decentralised service protocol that provides middleware services for dApps on Ethereum and Polkadot to achieve traceless privacy, high assurance and frictionless computation. Leveraging on the latest crypto and privacy-protection algorithms, along with hardware-based trust, the service protocol enables versatile use-cases not previously possible in the past, such as anonymous voting, MEV minimization, and no-tracking indexing. It is built by the industry’s foremost blockchain veterans and award-winning researchers, who previously worked at Zilliqa, LongHash, and the National University of Singapore. Founded in 2019, Automata Network is a recipient of Web3 Grant (2020), and a participant of the Web 3.0 Bootcamp (2020), Berkeley Blockchain Xcelerator (2021), Polkadot Decoded Mainstage speaker (2021). It has raised $3.4 million in total funding in early 2021. As an early team member and an integral part of the wider marketing team, you will have the opportunity to define Automata’s visual identity and bring our brand narrative to life. As part of the role, you will help create engaging and impactful visuals for our website, blog posts, presentations, social media and more. You will also help develop and maintain Automata’s websites and user interface, so some front-end development experience is strongly preferred. We are based in Singapore but remote working is also acceptable. Responsibilities Conceptualize, design, and animate assets as part of the marketing plan. This includes icons, social media graphics, GIFs, and infographics; Develop and maintain brand guidelines to ensure consistent brand identity across all owned channels; Create and manage all brand collateral including logos, presentations and pitch decks for internal reference and external use; UI/UX design for landing pages and microsites; Work cross-functionally to support the Marketing and Developer team; Requirements At least 1 year of relevant work experience in digital/web design, UI design, or illustration role positions Strong portfolio showing conceptualising and technical abilities in digital visual communication Proficient in design tools such as Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, Photoshop, Illustrator, Lightroom, etc. Experience with programming languages such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript Meticulous attention to visual details. Familiarity with blockchain/cryptocurrency is a plus. Perks Great career development opportunities in a growing company Competitive compensation with crypto incentives Flexible working hours and casual work attire

What the role is The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) is Singapore’s central bank and integrated financial regulator. As central bank, MAS promotes sustained, non-inflationary economic growth through the conduct of monetary policy and close macroeconomic surveillance and analysis. It manages Singapore’s exchange rate, official foreign reserves, and liquidity in the banking sector. As an integrated financial supervisor, MAS fosters a sound financial services sector through its prudential oversight of all financial institutions in Singapore – banks, insurers, capital market intermediaries, financial advisors, and stock exchanges. It is also responsible for well-functioning financial markets, sound conduct, and investor education. MAS also works with the financial industry to promote Singapore as a dynamic international financial centre. It facilitates the development of infrastructure, adoption of technology, and upgrading of skills in the financial industry. Join us now, if you have a genuine interest in making an impact to help shape Singapore’s economic and financial landscape. What you will be working on You will investigate offences and regulatory breaches of the Financial Advisers Act and the Securities and Futures Act.   As a member of the MAS-CAD joint investigation arrangement, you will be gazetted as a Commercial Affairs Officer with criminal investigative power.   You can expect to be challenged intellectually and professionally as you work closely with other investigators, surveillance and computer forensic officers, legal officers to carry out investigations. You will provide litigation support in prosecution, civil penalty court action and regulatory appeals.   You will gain insight into how the capital markets participants operate and the rules and regulations at play, as you play an important role in MAS' enforcement regime of the capital markets. What we are looking for At least 3 years' working experience. Interest in investigation work. Strong analytical, communication and writing skills. Ability to be innovative and creative in solving problems. Prior relevant experience would be an added advantage. Applicants should be Singapore Citizens All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

Hiring_Company: The CAP Consulting Group Pte Ltd
Job_Title: VP Finance Ops with a growing e commerce/consumer finance MNC
Job_Descriptions: VP Finance Ops with a growing e-commerce/consumer finance MNC • Role will require travel to Jakarta about 50% of the time for Sgp based candidates • Minimum 12 years experience of accounting and finance operations (covering AP, AR, GL) • Open to cands based in Singapore who are able to commute between Jakarta and Singapore Our client is a growing e-commerce set up with huge expansion plans. For this role, you will report to an SVP finance based in Singapore. For this role, Singapore-based candidates are required to travel to Jakarta (where the team is based) about 50% of the time. As the VP of Finance Operations, you are responsible for the overall aspects and activities of the accounting and finance operations across the firm covering Singapore, Thailand and Indonesia. You will assist the Group Controller to process the financial activities so as to maximize the company’s profit and plan for its growth, including operational implementation, new business, as well as identifying and solving arising and existing operational issues in relation to the financial process. You are additionally expected to work with other finance departmental heads in deciding on complex modeling of the business’s accounting and financial approaches that cut across the entire business. Key functions: • Manage monthly closing of accounts and preparation of annual financial reports supporting all stakeholders within or outside of finance: • a. review of journal entries for accruals, revenue recognition and preparation of variance analysis • b. timely submission of accurate monthly reporting deliverables to Consolidation team • c. provide coaching and guidance to team members in terms of accounting expertise • Manage AP, AR and GL team: • a. optimise processes and performance • b. ensure full balance sheet justification • Ensure an effective and efficient control environment in line with SOX standards and compliance with financial policies and procedures • Support external and internal audits and ensure implementation of agreed upon recommendations resulting from the audit findings • Motivate and develop team members • a. be proactive to ensure a culture of trust • b. provide opportunity to grow, demonstrate career path and development plans • Work collaboratively with Consolidation team for appropriate accounting treatment for transactions and events which require the application of significant professional judgement • On ad hoc basis, participate in projects and support the business and finance activities including system implementation and process standardisation. Requirements (Education Technical Skills, Relevant Experiences) • Minimum 12 years’ experience of accounting and finance operations (covering AP, AR, GL) • CPA with accounting expertise, of which at least 8 years in managerial role or more. Has experience managing bigger teams. • Open to cands based in Singapore who are ok to traveling to Jakarta about 50% of the time. • A mixture of private and public accounting backgrounds is preferred. • Experience in US-listed company and familiar with Asia-based operating company and understand the SEC requirements, especially on what’s required during the PCAOB audit process • Knowledge in Oracle or SAP is mandatory. • Solid understanding of the activities performed in the entire finance function and ability to translate those financial concepts to – and to effectively collaborate with all colleagues and stakeholders to support business growth while complying with the accounting standards. • Understands internal controls principles (Sarbanes Oxley) and experience in risk and control identification. • Advanced knowledge in Excel and/or SQL is an advantage. • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and detailed oriented. • Strong attention to detail and thoroughness in all aspects of the accounting policies, standards, and finance processes. • Excellent communication and relationship-building skills with an ability to prioritise, negotiate, and work with a variety of internal and external stakeholders. Able to manage multiple priorities and ability to work within tight timeframes. To apply, please send your cv in word doc to [email protected] Please also include details on your current salary, expected salary, and notice period in your cv. We regret to inform you that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Posted by: CAP Consulting (EA license: 14C7175) Caroline Poh (EA registration: R1105649) Date Posted - 20 Jan 2021

Job_Title: Deputy / Assistant Director (Strategy Lead) – Open Innovation Platform
Job_Descriptions: What the role is We are looking for a Deputy or Assistant Director to drive the next phase for our Open Innovation Platform (OIP). The OIP is our government platform matching corporates with real-world business problems to start-ups with game-changing solutions. Our mission is to distribute innovation to corporates and build successful start-ups at scale, to ensure Singapore’s place in a digital future. This role will report directly to the Director (Innovation). We are part of the Infocomm Media Development Authority (IMDA), which shapes Singapore’s digital future by developing and deploying emerging frontier technologies. The IMDA Dreams, Designs and Delivers in the technology and media space. Join us to build Singapore’s digital metropolis. Why Join Us: Be a key part of a transforming team to strategise, refine and execute the OIP for the next bound Shape the ethos of being a start-up within government, being scrappy, running fast and lean, and failing forward Rare opportunity to create a platform within Government, to benefit the Singapore economy and Singapore-based companies at scale What you will be working on Lead a lean team to develop and execute OIP strategy, project management and platform operations. This requires you to be hands-on as an individual contributor as well. OIP strategy. o Communicate and present to senior stakeholders and agencies on the business, including contextualising the progress and success stories. This includes writing papers, submissions and decks o Own the business process. This includes deploying the business budget for maximum effect, and refining the process to achieve the business objectives of scale and speed, including (but not limited to) reviewing the playbook, how we partner stakeholders (internal teams, agencies and associations), leveraging incentives in the landscape, according to user needs and insights Project management. Work with an external vendor to project manage and develop the OIP platform product. This requires working closely with the business team and vendor to create the product vision and to develop its core components in a timely manner to achieve the business objectives. o This includes features such as (i) a consumer-facing, mobile-responsive front-end with attractive content and resources to inspire innovation; (ii) a Discovery Engine that allows matching of corporates and tech solutions at scale; (iii) productising OIP’s high-touch services to enable scale; (iv) a Digital Bench to accelerate prototyping through a prototyping sandbox and Reusable Assets. o Plan the roadmap and develop additional product features through user insights and integrating business objectives Platform operations. Manage the site’s daily operations of the site, including monitoring and scaling the adoption of product features, and managing customer feedback and tickets, to ensure a seamless experience. Be responsible for delivering on KPIs, define appropriate metrics and track user behaviour Partner the Director (Innovation) and team leads to deliver the overarching OIP strategy and product, to leverage our incubator PIXEL’s synergies What we are looking for Proven Analytical, Communication and Leadership Abilities 5 years of experience in a strategic, analytical or planning function with outstanding analytical abilities 3 years of leadership experience in leading team mates across analytical and operational functions Great communicator to clearly explain insights, data, and inspire action through written or presented form Proven at working with and influencing internal and cross-functional stakeholders, including senior ones, with clarity, to fulfil common business objectives Independent Problem-Solver and Executor Strong bias for action and sense of ownership to roll up your sleeves to do Relentless in cutting through blockers and getting things done. Ambiguity and challenges energise, rather than demoralise Passionate about the Mission User-centric and curious about our users and what makes them tick, to keep improving our products Developmental mindset in leading teams to coach and share learnings, to level up the team Team player in advancing the overall team cause, to discuss openly, and to disagree but commit Value-Adding Qualities Experience in tech industry-facing roles Experience in a fast-paced digital product management, development and/or project management role with external vendors, preferably within Government Experience tendering and managing substantial projects and budgets within Government Proven record of successfully delivering high-impact, complex projects Position and salary will commensurate with experience.

Manager - Business Information Security Role: Business Information Security Senior Manager Location: Singapore Geographic Coverage: ASEAN and Greater China What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating many opportunities for people like YOU - people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world. The Business Information Security (BIS) is a global team responsible for ensuring all security risks on Client Delivery engagements are managed end to end and establish trust across a wide variety of exciting engagements. The group frequently engages with our business leaders and customers to identify, assess and mitigate security risks. The team is also the primary touchpoint between the wider Corporate Security community to deliver our security obligations to customers. Cognizant requires Information Security leaders to expand, lead and manage the security improvements across Asia-Pacific (APAC) region, particularly within Australia and New Zealand. Candidates will have a proven ability in Security Governance, Risk and Compliance with a solid background in Security Engineering, Architecture and Program Management. Duties & Responsibilities Security Governance Manage and implement security Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC) for our wide variety of client delivery engagements within the region, including banking, insurance, mining, telco and public sectors. Observe and apply regional and international cyber security and privacy laws, frameworks and standards such as ISO 27001, NIST-CSF, MAS TRM, SG & PRC Cybersecurity Act, SG PDPA, PRC PIPL and EU GDPR. Work with the Business Information Security Officer (BISO) and affiliated Centre of Excellence (CoE) leaders to ensure organisational practices align with business objectives and evolving threat landscape. Security Risk and Control Management Engage with variety of stakeholders: business leaders, auditors, customer security officers, legal, HR, and IT teams to understand security requirements and risk scenarios. Apply end-to-end risk management principles guided by business context and risk appetite. Identify, assess and respond to risks. Develop security management and data protection plan for key accounts: identify assets & threat vectors. Define mitigations and control framework. Conduct periodic risk and control assessments of our adherence to obligations and security management plan. Provide implementation plans to close gaps. Security Operations and Program Management Manage third party or client audit/security assessment activities such as SOC report, PCI-DSS and ISO 27001. Plan audit scope and schedule, and coordinate with various corporate functions to collect/produce evidences. Assist delivery team to review Technical Solution Designs and Secure SDLC processes to ensure IT products and services are foundationally secure in accordance to risk appetite. Coordinate corporate incident management response and support investigations within a strict timeframe. Liaise with customers and external parties. Develop Security Training and Awareness materials, and conduct or facilitate awareness sessions. Skills and Experience Must have a Bachelor's degree or above in a related field or equivalent experience Must have relevant security certifications such as CISA, CISSP, CRISC, CISM or equivalent Must have experience in managing internal Information Security functions for a highly regulated industry 10+ years of Cyber Security experience 5+ years of management experience Knowledge in security frameworks such as ISO 27001, NIST-CSF, ISM, PSPF, etc. Experience in attaining certifications or attestations such as ISO 27001, SOC report, PCI, etc. Experience with Security Infrastructure Design Engineering or Architecture Experience in Project/Program Management Additional Skills Excellent stakeholder engagement skills Excellent presentation and communications skills; ability to convey complex security risks and their control mitigations in a concise and business-relevant manner Ability to plan tactically and strategically; deliver outcome with a sense of urgency with attention to detail Demonstrate pragmatism by recommending risk mitigation that balances cost and business value. Strong collaboration skills and willingness to be a team player, working as one team to solve problems by incorporating input from various sources Willing to travel (10%)

Seeking a PM or senior researcher in the algo/ stat arb / quant space, who can bring ready (or close to ready) to deploy strategies to provide diversification to the team’s PnL stream. Proficient in Python programming and C++ Trading track record Mandarin Speaker a plus

Job Description & Requirements The Learning Facilitator is part of the early intervention teaching team and works under the guidance of experienced educators to provide quality learning experiences for students and support the best deliverance of the curriculum. The Early Intervention Programme serves students with developmental needs who are 6 years and below. Key responsibilities include: Preparing teaching materials, resources and setting up the environment. Providing support to early interventionists in classroom learning and facilitate student learning and development. Working within a team of different professionals to plan and support implementation of intervention approaches and strategies, as well as preparing documentation and reports as required. Supporting and participating in programme-wide initiatives and activities that innovate and improve processes for the development of students and the functioning of the organization. This is an entry position for individuals passionate about teaching students with disabilities. On-the-job training and in-service training programmes will be provided. Candidate Requirements At least a GCE ‘A’ Level or Diploma (Polytechnic, Nanyang Academy of Fine Arts or LASALLE College of the Arts) You must respect the intrinsic and unique worth of every individual, and serve with compassion and dedication to discover, build and celebrate the ability of each person. You are expected to act with integrity and be able to work in teams. Teaching students with disabilities can be physically demanding – you may be lifting and carrying students and equipment and will be expected to clean and maintain equipment and facility. At all times, the Learning Facilitator must take precautions to ensure the health and safety of students. At Rainbow Centre we envision a world where persons with disabilities are empowered and thriving in inclusive communities. We are always on the lookout for people who share our values, who are passionate about serving persons with disabilities and their families; and who are keen to keep learning so they can bring their best to the people we serve.

Job_Title: Lecturer (Aerospace Engineering) - School of Electrical and Electronic Engineeri
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The job of an academic is challenging and meaningful. Not only will he/she have both the knowledge and working experience, he/she must also possess a passion for working with youths, nurturing and moulding their characters. There will be opportunities to develop the curriculum, introduce new courses as well as be involved in consultancy and other applied research projects. Administrative work related to teaching and School/Institutional strategic initiatives will be an important part of the job. The successful candidates will be expected to be resourceful and innovative with initiative and good communication skills. What you will be working on Conduct lessons, create teaching and assessment materials and mentoring of students Develop and maintain new/existing teaching curriculum for modules stated below Undertake projects/consultancy work with both internal and external stakeholders Deploy effective pedagogy to facilitate learning What we are looking for Competent to teach at Diploma and higher levels in one of the following areas: (a) Unmanned Aircraft Operations (b) Airport Operations and Management (c) Air Traffic Management (d) Aerospace Engineering (Avionics) Possess at least 3 years’ of relevant working experiences in one of the above areas Candidates who possess CAAS certified Unmanned Aircraft Pilot license will have an added advantage Passionate about education and possess strong interest in teaching and mentoring students Self-driven, independent and possess readiness to work as a team People-oriented individual with strong interpersonal, written and communication skills Candidates who possess experience in teaching will have an added advantage Keen interest to develop new capabilities through projects and self-learning Possess strong interest in exploring new technologies Willingness to commit to teaching night classes, at least once a week Successful candidate will be offered a 2-year contract in the first instance. Closing date: 8 February 2022 If you are shortlisted for the position(s), you should hear from us within 30 days of the closing date of the advertisement.

What the role is Job Purpose Singapore Food Agency is the national authority that ensures and secures a supply of safe food for Singapore. The Ops Tech Department (OTD) implements the Agency’s Enterprise Architecture including data analytics infrastructure, and to build up the Agency’s capability to support the development of a new food safety ecosystem that is nimble, comprehensive and encompasses every food-related transaction across the value chain, where all players along food supply chain take ownership to ensure food is safe for consumers. As a member of the Ops Tech Department, you are responsible for the system architecting and project management and implementation of the projects and initiatives that support and enhances the national food safety ecosystem. You will need to pro-actively manage the relationship with the SFA System Owners and provide leadership to the project management teams. You will be involved in the implementation of Operational IT systems and deployment of smart technologies for food safety assurance. What you will be working on Areas of work Work with the other members of the team in the implementation of projects and initiatives as follows: Manage outsourced digitalisation projects Coordinate internal resources and vendors for the flawless execution of projects Ensures that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope and within budget Develop project scopes and objectives involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility Develop a detailed project plan to track progress Measure and verify project performance Manage relationship with various stakeholders Conduct UAT Ensures System Commissioning Ensures the delivery of Training and Documentation Plans for maintenance support What we are looking for Requirements Degree in Information Technology, Software Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent. At least 5 years of relevant work experience in Project Management roles. Strong stakeholders’ management and engagement with ability to work closely with the project management team. Self-motivator and team player Strong analytical, organisational and planning skills. Good conceptualization skills with ability to drive initiatives. Possess strong written, verbal and presentation skills. Work Location SFA HQ at JEM We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified for the interview.

What the role is HDB houses more than 80% of Singapore’s resident population spread across 24 towns and 3 estates, and is continually leveraging Information & Communication Technology (ICT) to make its towns and estates more liveable, efficient, sustainable and safe for its residents. In line with this proliferation in use of ICT, more data of the urban environment is being collected. You will be involved in a multi-disciplinary area of analytical research to derive actionable insights amidst vast amounts of data to shape a HDB town’s development. You will look into utilising multiple emerging forms of data, combined with new and multi-faceted computational approaches and data analytics methodologies (e.g. machine learning, geospatial techniques, statistical regression, predictive analytics) to derive evidence-based findings to better understand the various phenomena of the urban environment. What you will be working on Your responsibilities will include data acquisition and data fusion, creation of 3D models, and exploring the use of new techniques and algorithms in analysing the urban environment of HDB towns and estates. You will also work closely with stakeholders to scope analytical use cases to work towards transformation of data into valuable knowledge and actionable insights that can be used to streamline processes or formulate solutions. What we are looking for You should possess a degree in Engineering (Electrical or Mechanical or Civil) recognised by the Professional Engineers’ Board, and have at least 2 years of experience in field of engineering and/or analytics. Having relevant qualifications or experience in Computer Science/Data Science/Statistics would be an added advantage. Candidates should be proficient in coding/scripting in various programming languages such as Python/R. Additional knowledge in 3D modelling, probability and regression analysis, spatial analysis, and machine learning would be preferred. You should possess good problem-solving aptitude and an analytical mind with a sharp business acumen. You must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams, and also have excellent communication and written skills. All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted for the position within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

Project close out Prepare final SOA Refund rental deposit Perform other duties as assigned by superior Requirements: Minimum a bachelor’s degree in civil engineering or related fields Minimum of 5 years working experience in formwork sector preferably in the Sales sector Fluent English, both oral and written Good knowledge of MS Office applications Experience in AutoCAD Software (preferred) Meticulous, strong sense for flexibility and responsibility Strong professional ethics, open and trustworthy Self-motivated, independent and committed Self-confidence and high self-assertion Open-minded personality with ample cultural awareness Ability to work under pressure e.g. because of irregular working hours Eagerness to work in a multicultural team Eagerness to learn and adopt knowledge Diligence and precise working style

What the role is As Engineer/Architect (Project Management), you will represent HDB to work with the consultants and contractor to manage and oversee the construction of building and upgrading projects. What you will be working on You will be involved in managing the project from inception till completion. Your responsibilities include coordinating and facilitating the design, tender and construction processes to ensure quality, cost, safety and timely delivery of the project. During the construction phase, you are required to manage the consultants and contractors to ensure and oversee the daily construction activities including: works are carried out by the contractor in accordance with the Contract Documents works are supervised to ensure the quality of works are of an acceptable standard of workmanship site safety requirements are adhered to works are completed within the period stipulated and the budget allocated resolve technical and design issues with the consultants and contractors coordinate with other agencies on any development issues identify potential construction related issues for solutions handle post construction feedback and improvement works related to the project. You may be involved in studies in the areas of construction productivity and environmentally friendly construction practices. What we are looking for You should possess a degree in Architecture or Engineering (Civil/Structural/Mechanical/Electrical) recognised by the Professional Engineers Board in Singapore. You should have a positive learning attitude, strong technical problem solving skills as well as good writing and communication skills. Candidates with relevant working experience and with the right attitude are welcome to apply. Successful candidates will be offered a 1+1 year contract. All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted for the position within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

Job_Title: Temporary Teacher Aide, Yishun Park School
Job_Descriptions: Roles & Responsibilities Always wanted an opportunity to understand more about students with special needs? Look no further! We are looking for Relief Learning Facilitators across our three campuses in Singapore. The Relief Learning Facilitator will join the teaching team of our Special Education Programme, which caters to students between 7-18 years old, on a short-term basis. You will work under the guidance of experienced educators to provide quality learning experiences for students and support the best deliverance of the curriculum. This is achieved through assisting in the implementation of lessons, supporting the students’ learning through various learning intervention and behaviour management strategies. This is an entry position for individuals passionate about teaching students with disabilities. On-the-job training will be provided. Do note you will be required to lift and carry students and equipment in this role. Do also note this role will be on a short-term contract basis , to provide you the opportunity to explore this sector of work. Candidates who perform well as a Relief Learning Facilitator can be subsequently considered for a full-time position with us. You: At least A levels or a polytechnic diploma Ensure the health and safety of our students A team player - to act with integrity and be able to work in teams To respect the intrinsic and unique worth of every individual, and serve with compassion and dedication to discover, build and celebrate the ability of each person. We: At Rainbow Centre we envision a world where persons with disabilities are empowered and thriving in inclusive communities. We are always on the lookout for people who share our values, who are passionate about serving persons with disabilities and their families; and who are keen to keep learning so they can bring their best to the people we serve.

Infra Dev Specialist Principal Infra Developer Qualification : Science / Engineering graduate Responsibility : Requirement Gathering : - Participate in requirement gathering JAD sessions and support documentation where applicable (business, functional, UI, usability, data, compliance, data migration, NFR, 3rd party tools & products). Raise clarifications with customer / onsite to eliminate any ambiguity on the scope of work assigned from the Client / Project Cocoordinator. track to closure any open clarifications with customer / onsite. understand and translate requirements into design. (FOR ONSITE) : conduct meetings with customer SME's, BA's and architect to understand and clarify functional and technical requirements Technology Advisory & Consulting (for clients) : : Engage with client stakeholders during advisory engagements. Gather information relevant to the client's context and conduct detailed analysis using technology solution frameworks. Seek guidance Infra Development Manager as required. Arrive at draft recommendations based on analysis. Provide thought leadership on implementation of specific technology. Engage with client stakeholders. Solution Design & Development : : Document / review the design / blueprint / specifications of the solution. Provide guidance to project teams on how functionality works together and how it works / fitment from technology perspective for complex requirements. Define the product feature requirements / criteria based on the requirements finalized (for complex requirements). Resource/ Efforts Estimation and Monitoring : : Provide input on technical effort estimation to arrive at resourcing plans. participate in management reviews and teleconferences and report weekly status and walkthrough to the Project Manager / Client. Followup with customer POC to resolve team issues and dependencies. raise concerns regarding changes in timelines and expectations with customer point of contact to resolve the same. Design & Analysis : : Develop proof of concept as designed by architect. setup development environment for team to work in. break up the modules considering technical aspects. Understand interdependencies of the various components in work packages that are being developed. Create design documents with the support of the architects for the assigned scope. Work with architect to understand the architecture of the application, high level approaches and ensure that the design is in line with overall direction. conduct peer review, as required. Organize design review sessions with various stakeholders to validate design is as per requirements. Identify and use Reusable components from the repository. Coding : : Identify the standards applicable for the work packages / components. Familiarize the team with development environment and CTS and customer specific coding standards, guidelines and best practices to be followed through sessions and document sharing. Design and develop reusable components Analyze and reuse such developed components from the repository during the design process. Review the code created by team and provide review comments to the developers. develop code for core module(s) needed for the project. Contribute towards development of framework. Develop/ review tier coding, business layer coding, interface development, service development, creation of stored procedures etc as applicable for the work package / project. Write efficient queries and understand logical and physical data models. follow up with Developers to ensure integration of components (input / output). troubleshoot critical technical issues. Handle escalations related to critical technical issues. create detailed tasks for the scope and share timelines for the same with the team. track the status of the tasks assigned, maintain detailed task information for the work packages owned and do periodic reporting. conduct technical review and audit. Create quality check points for all deliverables. estimate at task level in the area of work concerned, measure and report the actual effort against the estimated effort and ensure task progress reporting in C20 or any other applicable tool. Prepare and report status for the scope responsible. conduct peer reviews in coding and testing phase. Testing : : Develop comprehensive unit testing cases for modules developed (as required) and unit test plans. execute unit testing. Create unit test logs. prepare unit test strategy, test plan document and data requirements. automate unit testing and contributing to automation of unit testing. Perform developer integration testing by integrating the components developed by each individual team member and ensure that the integration for the teams work has been completed before the next phase of testing (system testing). Signoff on test cases created by team. discuss results / actions from NFR testing and signoff on the same for system testing / NFR. Defect Management : : Participate in defect triage meetings with the team and confirm the defects identified, highlight any new change request to the agreed scope and identify actions to reduce defects. Monitor rework carried out on the code based on review comments from code review / defects raised in unit testing, peer testing, SIT, UAT testing or any other relevant testing phase for core / critical modules. Follow up with the team to close out on the defects. identify ways to prevent defects. Participate in transition of knowledge and to support organization with any defects raised post production as required. Knowledge Management : : Contribute towards updating knowledge assets, user manual, online help document, installation scripts and installation manual and leverage the same. Support process audit activities. Conduct knowledge transfer sessions for new joiners in the project team. conduct training through academy (if approved). Guide and mentor team junior members from a technical perspective to ensure quality delivery of the components. People Management : : Engage with team. resolve conflict within team. Define the teams goals. set performance expectations. conduct appraisals. set stretch targets and track performance against the same periodically. Identify, groom, reward and develop high performers. create training plans for team. Conduct technical evaluation for building team and share inputs with supervisor / project manager. Must Have Skills Docker DevOps AWS DevOps Python

Job_Title: AD/DD (Strategic Procurement and Contracts Management), Kallang Alive Project
Job_Descriptions: What the role is At Sport Singapore, we aspire to transform the nation through an active lifestyle designed around innovative, fun and meaningful sporting experiences. Sport has the unique ability to bring people together through play, regardless of age, gender, race, ability or social status. It imparts life values, nurtures character and builds resilience. It inspires and evokes the Singapore spirit through shared experiences and strengthens our national identity. We help Singaporeans Live Better Through Sport. Sport Singapore is constantly on the lookout for individuals who are passionate about what they do. Anchored in our values of Passion for Sport, Strength through Teamwork and Care for People, we believe in working and playing, not just as a team, but as a family. What you will be working on Responsibilities Be a strategic business partner to the divisions/subsidiaries, providing support and advice for their procurement activities. Lead and manage the procurement operations, including formulate and implement internal control policies and guidelines to achieve good corporate governance and ensure compliance to Government Instruction Manual (IM) and statutory requirements. Provide support, advice and training to end users on procurement policies and processes, review procurement submissions such as expenditure papers, requirement specifications and recommendation report submitted by end users for approval Collaborate with project managers and assist with tender procurement and/or contract novation Propose and implement aggregation of procurement for common ICT systems, goods and services. What we are looking for Requirements We are looking for self-motivated individuals who value integrity, teamwork and take pride in going the extra mile to provide excellent service to stakeholders and the community. This individual should be a sport advocate through living an active lifestyle and staying active.
