Can exercise independence of judgement and autonomy. Acts as SME to senior stakeholders and /or other team members. Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency. Technical Skills Required: Very strong core java 8/11 Spring (Apache Camel is a plus) Multi-threading Solid understanding of OO principles Unix/Linux experience Relational database concepts and knowledge in SQL Experience working with large complex applications Nice to have: FIX protocol, Socket’s API, middleware’s such as Tibco EMS, Tibco RV, Solace Non Technical Skills Required: Relevant knowledge in the Financial Service industry Passion for technology, especially Java Self-motivated and a desire to progress your career Flexible and adaptive, team player Excellent analytical and interpersonal skills Ability to work well under pressure, prioritize work and well organized Comfortable in presenting suggestions for change and or improving work flow Ability to pick up new concepts and apply the knowledge. Understanding of financial concepts Desirable Knowledge: Experience of working with large financial software systems Knowledge of E-Trading or ecommerce applications is desirable Qualifications: 2-5 years of relevant experience in the Financial Service industry Intermediate level experience in Applications Development role Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication Demonstrated problem-solving and decision-making skills Ability to work under pressure and manage deadlines or unexpected changes in expectations or requirements Education: Bachelor’s degree/University degree or equivalent experience This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required.

Job_Title: Senior Research Officer (Field Entomology Section) – Contract
Job_Descriptions: What the role is We are looking for a self-driven and committed researcher to augment our research and surveillance programmes at the Environmental Health Institute. If you enjoy working in a fast-paced, multi-disciplinary environment where your research is translated into evidence-based public health programmes and policies, we invite you to join us. You will be part of a dynamic team that works closely with a network of local and international collaborators to impact our public health landscape. What you will be working on The successful candidate will work in the Environmental Health Institute, and be part of a multi-disciplinary team that supports Project Wolbachia – Singapore, an innovative project that aims to reduce the risk of dengue in Singapore. You will have the chance to work with various inter-disciplinary teams. You will be involved in field entomology activities, including mosquito releases, mosquito surveillance and field studies, and in public engagement and outreach activities. You will also be expected to review scientific literature, contribute to peer-reviewed publications, partake in data management and contract management. What we are looking for Job Requirements: Degree in Life Sciences or related disciplines Knowledge and interest in insects will be desirable Willing to handle mosquitoes Interest in process improvement and innovation Able to work independently and in a team Able to systematically perform routine workflow with an eye for detail Good interpersonal and communication skills Aptitude in working in a fast-paced and highly volatile environment with the ability to manage multiple priorities and stakeholders at the same time. Good knowledge in Microsoft Office Physically fit and possess the physical endurance for the challenges of field work. Possess Class 3/3A driving licence. Willing to work staggered hours or after office-hours, weekends and public holiday Applicants will be updated on the status of their applications within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting. As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment.

What the role is At Sport Singapore, we aspire to transform the nation through an active lifestyle designed around innovative, fun and meaningful sporting experiences. Sport has the unique ability to bring people together through play, regardless of age, gender, race, ability or social status. It imparts life values, nurtures character and builds resilience. It inspires and evokes the Singapore spirit through shared experiences and strengthens our national identity. We help Singaporeans Live Better Through Sport. Sport Singapore is constantly on the lookout for individuals who are passionate about what they do. Anchored in our values of Passion for Sport, Strength through Teamwork and Care for People, we believe in working and playing, not just as a team, but as a family. What you will be working on Key Responsibilities: 1. Grant Management You are required to take on the role of an ‘Accounts Officer’ for a total of 10-12 projects/events awarded through the Blended Events 2.0 Grant and Blended Events 3.0 Grant. This would essentially involve working closely with the Grant Awardees for effective management of each project/event in the following key areas: i. Safe Management Measures (SMM) -to liaise with relevant authorities, government agencies and vendors for event safety requirements/approvals, and to work with each Grant Awardee for effective planning and execution of SMM as required for the events. ii. Innovation Adoption (if and where applicable) - to work with each Grant Awardee in ensuring the delivery of key innovation milestones and actual application of the specific innovations to the events. iii. Marketing and Publicity– to liaise internally with @SportTeam and PR Team for activations via Active SG Circle, for endorsement of marketing collaterals and for raising visibility of the projects/events via a good mix of PR channels. iv. Event Operations– to work with each Grant Awardee in ensuring effective planning, execution and post-event evaluation of each project/event. v. Project Monitoring & Evaluation -to work with each Grant Awardee to ensure effective monitoring of progress milestones and final evaluation of the KPI as established for each project/event. 2. Grant Administration You are required to take on the role of a ‘Grant Officer’ to ensure effective administration of the Blended Events 2.0 Grant and Blended Events 3.0 Grant. This would essentially involve working closely with the overall Grant in-charge for effective administration in the following key areas: i. Grant Application, Evaluation and Award -processing of applications, shortlisting and preparation for panel evaluation and communication of the official award to successful applicants. ii. Grant Disbursements – processing and disbursement of grants in a timely manner. iii. Grant Monitoring & Evaluation– submission of required progress reports and final reports. iv. Grant Reporting –preparation and submission of required presentation materials for both internal stakeholders (e.g. SportSG Senior Management) and external stakeholders (e.g. MCCY, MOF). 3. Support for any other programmes/activities/tasks as per assigned. What we are looking for Requirements: We are looking for self-motivated individuals who value integrity, teamwork and take pride in going the extra mile to provide excellent quality and value for our key stakeholders and the larger community. This individual should be a sport advocate in living an active lifestyle and through staying active. In addition, ideally, you should possess Some experience in Grant Management & Administration Some experience in Events Planning & Organization Good networking skills with clients, stakeholders, government agencies and corporate partners. Only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

Hiring_Company: Home Team Science and Technology Agency (HTX)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is HTX supports the Home Team’s operations through the harvesting of technological innovations and capabilities to ensure mission success in an increasingly complex operating landscape. The Partnerships Directorate works closely with S&T stakeholders domestically and internationally, across governments, industry, international organisations, academia, to curate and develop an ecosystem for homeland security S&T in Singapore. You will be part of a dynamic team that is responsible for forging close partnerships to enhance the S&T capabilities of the Home Team. What you will be working on Key Responsibilities Identify/curate key S&T government partners and plan a roadmap to cultivate new relations and enhance existing collaborations for the same purpose. Encourage and support bilateral and multilateral engagements with strategic government partners through a spectrum of purpose-built platforms and outreach levers. Maintain strong technology foresight through horizon scanning and watch of emerging trends to identify opportunities across a broad spectrum of scientific and technological areas that can be applied in the Home Team and facilitate joint projects or collaboration efforts with foreign Government Partners. Secondary Responsibilities Any other tasks to help meet the needs of the Directorate. What we are looking for Tertiary qualifications in Business, Political Science, International Relations, Security studies, Law or Engineering preferred. At least 2 years of relevant work experience. Able to think strategically and conduct forward planning to pursue purposive engagements. Understanding of the Home Team’s work across the various subject matter domains and relevant work experience within the Home Team will be an asset. Able to work independently to deliver outcomes in a timely manner; and in a team to facilitate the sharing of ideas and knowledge. Able to prioritise and monitor ongoing tasks effectively, and multi-task to ensure that all deliverables are met. Good staffing abilities in the form of written submissions and verbal presentations are essential. Strong sense of responsibility and integrity. Good command of the English language, both written and verbal. Proficiency in other languages will be useful. Able to travel. All new appointees will be appointed on a two-year contract in the first instance. As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment. Please note that you may also be required to declare your vaccination status. All applicants will be updated on the status of their applications within 4 weeks upon closing of the advertisement.

What the role is Support Prime Minister’s Office (PMO) in leveraging social media and digital channels to engage the public, as well as to amplify and communicate messages effectively. What you will be working on Conceptualise and develop quality content for social media and online communication channels. Monitor and effectively manage the respective online channels. Support online coverage of events related to the respective online channels. Develop strategies to drive growth and engagement with followers. Regular scanning of online space for trends and developments that will impact the respective online channels. Conduct data analysis to track performance of the respective online channels. What we are looking for Background in communications-related fields 2-3 years’ experience in a communications or new media-related role Strong communication and writing skills (fluency in a mother tongue would be an advantage) Well-versed in social media platforms and online culture Socio-political awareness/acumen and knowledge of current affairs Good research and analytical skills Photography and videography skills, or familiarity with website management would be an advantage Professional and positive attitude Able to work irregular hours as well as on some weekends and public holidays Able to travel for work Please note that this is a 1-year contract position.

Job_Title: Senior Assistant Executive (Development Admin), Boarding and Development Svcs
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) aspires to be a world-class organisation in delivering safety and security for our people. In pursuing our mission to make Singapore our Safe and Best Home, we remain constant and true to our core values of Honour and Unity. The HRSC is a centre under the HR Division of Ministry HQ providing key HR services for MHA’s workforce. There are six branches in HRSC. This post is under the Boarding and Development Services Branch, which oversees hiring, exit and development admin services in MHA. What you will be working on The SAE assists Senior Manager, Development Admin on the administration of in-service sponsorships matters, confirmation and emplacement of officers, courses and appraisal and development plan (ADP). He/She is required to work closely with Home Team Departments (HTD), officers and education institutes to ensure timely and accurate processing of sponsorships, courses and ADPs. In-service sponsorship 1. Plan and process applications for Sponsorship programmes such as post-graduate, degree and diploma programme for MHA officers. 2. Management of sponsored officers (disbursement of book allowance, processing of sponsorship related claims, prepare necessary documentation for approved withdrawal/ extension of sponsorship/ maintain database, etc). 3. Certification of invoices for school fees and monitoring of sponsorship budget. Confirmation and Emplacement 1. Process confirmation and emplacement of officers. 2. Raise Service Requests for payment of increment for eligible officers. Course Administration 1. Work with course coordinators and HTDs to nominate officers for courses based on course criteria and eligibility. 2. Manage attendance and replacement of nominees and provide attendance report to HTDs. Appraisal & Development Plan Administration 1. Prepare statistics for periodic reporting to HTDs and/or Senior Management. 2. Monitor completion status and troubleshoot technical issues for MHA officers. Others 1. Streamline work processes through e.g. RPA Key Challenges 1. Meeting the expectations of management and stakeholders and ensuring that service standards are met amidst a constant high volume of cases. 2. Understand the diverse profiles of the HTDs and their requirements in order to accurately assess and recommend relevant solutions to meet the organisation’s needs. 3. Keep up with changes to HR policies and operating landscape. What we are looking for 1. Meticulous and independent worker who is able to carry out your responsibilities with minimal supervision. Good time management and be able to meet tight deadlines. 2. A team player with excellent interpersonal skills to engage, negotiate, and establish rapport with internal teams and other stakeholders to achieve goals and objectives. 3. Preferably with experience in the work areas. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Excel, SAP system and VOICES system would be an advantage. (This is a temporary contract position)

What the role is The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies. Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering. Government Digital Services (GDS), has been at the forefront of transforming the digital landscape of Singapore government and we have produced products like TraceTogether, LifeSG and gowhere.gov.sg that are used by millions of users. The Singapore Government Developer Portal Team in the Engineering and Productivity tribe of Government Digital Services(GDS) is in the business of creating a platform that will accelerate the digital transformation of government agencies by enabling the discovery and accessibility of WOG digital services. We do so by working with various Singapore Government Web Service providers to provide a unified way for users to discover and access those services. We are looking for seasoned delivery managers who enjoy working with highly motivated people, love solving user problems and have the ability to capture spoken, and unspoken users’ needs and translate them into user-centric user stories. What you will be working on Working with stakeholders to identify & understand the requirements of software systems. Plan and participate in product conceptualisation sessions with stakeholders. Elicit and document business/user requirements and translate them into user-stories. Manage requirements by clarifying and reviewing them via walkthrough with stakeholders. Analyze requirements to drive the design or review of test cases/business model/processes. Works closely with the development team and stakeholders on project schedule and issues. Continuously finds means and ways to improve operations, streamline work processes and work cooperatively and jointly with various users' departments to provide quality service. What we are looking for Proven product management experience in a fast paced, agile environment working directly with engineers and designers (ideally at least 5 years) 3+ years of experience in a technical product leadership role within the cloud Prior experience as a software engineer Experience managing software-as-a-service technology products Experience creating B2B service offerings that cater to wider audience Strong understanding of the cloud industry. Ability to analyze data, problem-solve, and scope business requirements. Decompose significantly complex technical propositions into straight forward solutions Good written and verbal communication, including minutes taking and technical writing skills. Able to engage stakeholders and manage their expectations. Ability to work effectively and independently under pressure, meet deadlines, multitask and to prioritize tasks effectively. Experience with developer tooling or developer relations (bonus) Experience with Agile methodology (Scrum/Extreme Programming) and UX development environment (bonus). Certified Scrum Master or Certified Product Owner and/or Certified Business Analysis Professional (bonus). We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is meaningful to innovation. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s important for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round. Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hours

Job_Title: Intern (AWS EMR - Text Analytics), IT Architecture
Job_Descriptions: What the role is You will be part of a team involved in projects that leverage on Data Analytics and Machine Learning to provide a better customer experience to NLB’s users. This includes providing personalized recommendations to users, improving the relevancy of search results through Text Analytics, and supporting quantitative research. What you will be working on Conduct research, analyse the data required for text analytics and operationalise the existing process. Work on improvements to the existing workflows and automate the processes where necessary. Staff work arising from operational activities, eg. taking minutes, submission of forms. Implementing solutions on AWS cloud using services like AWS EMR, Amazon Personalize. What we are looking for Students specialising in disciplines such as Computer Science, Data Science, web application development or related courses. Students with ability to understand and work on applications developed using Python, Java, C#, Node.js, NOSQL databases are preferred. The work location is at ERR BizPark @ Chai Chee. This is a 24 week internship progamme.

Job_Title: Technical Support Consultant/ Application Systems Consultant
Job_Descriptions: What the role is What you will be working on What we are looking for Competencies have long been used as a framework to help focus employees' behaviour on things that matter most and help us drive success. We are looking for candidates with the following competencies:

What the role is The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies. Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering. Government Infrastructure Group (GIG) The Government Infrastructure Group (GIG) is responsible for digital infrastructure that supports the Whole-of-Government (WOG). We are the infrastructure architects and engineers who architect, design and deliver an agile, secure and sustainable infrastructure which enables a digital government for Singapore. How we work Aside from formulating the infrastructure strategy and roadmap at WOG level, we also develop prototypes using new technologies and establish standards and best practices to guide the design and implementation of information systems that support the enterprise infrastructure. We examine factors such as people, culture, policies and processes to provide a secure, predictive and always-on platform, enabling public officers to work anywhere and anytime. By leveraging on innovative Cloud and Saas technologies, we architect, design, build and deliver Cloud and Datacentre hosting environments and common services which support government agencies in accelerating and developing modern applications and services. Transforming ICT infrastructure through modernisation and automation is also our key focus. Using latest technology and best practices, we deliver secure and utility-based services to WOG, so that government agencies can function efficiently and seamlessly. We are also passionate about building and uplifting ICT engineering know-how for the WOG in critical infrastructure domains, which we advance through experimentation, prototype development, consultancy and training. Job Overview As a Senior Infrastructure Engineer, you will be responsible to manage the Big Data infrastructure that provides the compute, storage and data visualization platform. You will work with a team of data analyst and data engineers to provide driven insights for users from Whole-of-Government. What you will be working on Lead as subject matter expert for data analytics compute solutions, storage and data visualization technologies. Designing, evaluating and implementing framework and platform that can handle the needs of a rapidly growing database. Architecting and scaling data analytics infrastructure, finding opportunities to improve and optimize workloads, processes to ensure that performance levels can support continuous accurate, reliable and timely delivery of data products. Manage continuous uptime of Data platform services by developing High availability tools and best practises. Manage the continuous testing and deployment of data pipelines, new data platform services and analytics dashboards. Manage and run highly critical production services who provides analytics capabilities to our various users across the WOG. Review and adopt relevant industry best practices for Government IT infrastructure Ensure that project implementation and operations are aligned to Government technology standards and policies What we are looking for Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Computer, Electronics Engineering, Information Technology or related disciplines. Minimum 5 years of hands on experiencing in big data infrastructure preferably in products such as Cloudera and Qlik Proficient in common big data tools like Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Nifi in a large scale. Well versed in setting up continuous integration and deployment for big data or other projects Excellent written and verbal communication and ability to influence and communicate effectively with non-technical audience and senior management Keep abreast of ICT technologies, skillsets and industry practices Preferably obtained certification in the following: o ITIL V3 Foundation certified o Cloudera Certified Associate (CCA) certified o Qlik Sense System Administrator certified We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is meaningful to innovation. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s important for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round. Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hours

C12 - IT Project Senior Analyst The IT Project Senior Analyst is a seasoned professional role. Applies in-depth disciplinary knowledge, contributing to the development of new techniques and the improvement of processes and work-flow for the area or function. Integrates subject matter and industry expertise within a defined area. Requires in-depth understanding of how areas collectively integrate within the sub-function as well as coordinate and contribute to the objectives of the function and overall business. Evaluates moderately complex and variable issues with substantial potential impact, where development of an approach/taking of an action involves weighing various alternatives and balancing potentially conflicting situations using multiple sources of information. Requires good analytical skills in order to filter, prioritize and validate potentially complex and dynamic material from multiple sources. Strong communication and diplomacy skills are required. Regularly assumes informal/formal leadership role within teams. Involved in coaching and training of new recruits. Significant impact in terms of project size, geography, etc. by influencing decisions through advice, counsel and/or facilitating services to others in area of specialization. Sr. Associate - Projects Technical Lead Qualification : Bachelors in science , engineering or equivalent Responsibility : Project Planning and Setup : Understand the project scope, identify activities/ tasks, task level estimates, schedule, dependencies, risks and provide inputs to Module Lead for review. Provide inputs to testing strategy, configuration, deployment, hardware/software requirement etc. Review plan and provide feedback on gaps, timeline and execution feasibility etc as required in the project. Participate in KT sessions conducted by customer/ other business teams and provide feedback on requirements. Requirement Understanding and Analysis : Analyze functional/non functional requirements and seek clarifications for better understanding of requirements. Based on understanding of system upstream & downstream, provide feedback and inputs on gaps in requirements and technical feasibility of requirements. Design : Prepare the LLD/ detailed design documents based on HLD and briefing from Module Lead. Seek inputs from the developers on specific modules as applicable. Consolidate all modules and provide to Module Lead/ Architects/ Designers for review. Suggest changes in design on technical grounds. Develop components inventory for the code to be developed tying it to the nonfunctional requirements. Perform sampling of data to understand the character/ quality of the data (project dependent in the absence of data analyst or designer). Identify tools and technologies to be used in the project as well as reusable objects that could be customized for the project. Coding : Follow coding standards and best practices to develop code and check code quality. Share developed code with supervisor for review. Rework on the code based on inputs if required. Perform complex integration. Guide the developers in identifying, preparing and conducting unit test cases and fixing defects based on results. Consolidate the test results and share with supervisor. Provide periodic status update to supervisor and highlight / recommend any changes in design based on challenges faced. Anticipate unreported defects and raise the same to supervisor. Conduct technical troubleshooting. Conduct reviews for codes created by team. Testing Management : Develop unit test case for each module. Conduct/ guide conducting of unit and integration testing and fix defects. Review/ approve code to be moved to testing environment. Provide support to the QA team and coordinate for various phases of testing. Address queries raised by QA within defined timelines. Investigate critical defects and establish need for fixing. Raise issues to leads/QA. Report defect status as per project standard process within agreed timelines. Share revised code with supervisor for review. Assist team lead and project manager on estimates around defect fixes. Configuration Management : Maintain versions of the code or consolidate version maintained by the Developers. Provide support as required to the Administrators during configuration, code backups, deployment etc. Deployment : Assess and create deployment/ roll back plan. Validate if all the components have been migrated and the right version is checked in. Maintain deployment tracker. Perform sanity checks post deployment to ensure smooth production. Share activity status with supervisor and highlight concerns if any. Project Execution Monitoring & closure (Support to Project Management activities) : Monitor work of the developers and share work achieved with them. Provide guidance through SDLC. Provide status of progress to leads. In case of change requests, provide inputs on the plan. Service Support and Maintenance : Specific to production and maintenance support : Provide support for 1 week and hand over to production team. Identify if the incoming request is a service request/ defect during the warranty or an incident. If it is code defect in the warranty, highlight to Lead and initiate defect fix process. Post warranty, support in transition to maintenance team. Knowledge Management : Post release participate in project review call and discuss points on what went well and what didn't. Create and update knowledge articles (case studies, lessons learnt) in the knowledge management repository. Guide developers in creating such documents. Publish white papers/ blogs/ articles (if required). People Management : Conduct training through academy or internally within the team. Conduct technical, face to face interviews for internal transfer or external hiring. Provide feedback on Developers form technical /domain standpoint to the module lead. Must Have Skills Power BI Report Server MS Power BI Good To Have Skills Azure Analysis Services Azure DW

Job_Title: Senior Manager / Manager, ICT&SS Policy Specialist
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Government Technology Agency (GovTech) aims to transform the delivery of Government digital services by taking an "outside-in" view, putting citizens and businesses at the heart of everything we do. We also develop the Smart Nation infrastructure and applications, and facilitate collaboration with citizens and businesses to co-develop technologies. Join us as we support Singapore’s vision of building a Smart Nation - a nation of possibilities empowered through info-communications technology and related engineering. The Governance Group within GovTech designs and implements progressive policies that continuously raise the technology standards across all Government agencies, and respond to the ever-changing technology and business landscape. What you will be working on As a ICT&SS Policy Specialist, you will partner a multi-disciplinary team such as the specialists from GovTech Capabilities Centres to develop and implement ICT&SS Policies, Standards and Guidelines to uplift the Government's use of technology. You will: Develop the ICT&SS policies, standards and guides across multiple technology domains (e.g. cybersecurity, modern application architecture, ICT infrastructure, application system development), considering best-in-class technology solutions and practices, WOG, agency and domain-specific perspectives. Develop targeted and effective communication / engagement plans and materials at WOG level, considering the stakeholders’ priorities and sphere of influence. Engage a wide range of stakeholders (from engineers to senior leadership, and CDSOs/CIOs/MCISOs/CDOs to agencies’ ICT&SS delivery teams), across all government agencies to enable them to acquire better understanding of the policy intents and requirements, and operationalise for their respective ICT&SS. Use appropriate scientific research methods to assess the impact of ICT&SS policy problems; collect and analyse relevant data using suitable methods to support problem definition and assessment of technology policy solutions; put forth reports and proposals to facilitate deliberation of ICT&SS policy issues and options. What we are looking for You should have at least 10 years of working experience in ICT&SS design, delivery and operation in the Singapore Government agencies, of which a minimum of 5 years’ experience is in ICT governance and have good working knowledge of the Singapore Government Instruction (IM) for ICT&SS Management. You have/ are: Strong analytical, conceptualisation and problem solving skills, able to think critically and take a broad/ strategic perspective as well as drill deep to understand policy issues/ problems, business needs and any other challenges. Sound technical knowledge in modern technologies, and able to apply tech know-how in the Singapore Government ICT&SS context to address policy issues. A good team player with strong influencing and people skills, possess excellent written and oral communication with the ability to facilitate discussions to elicit/ manage/ prioritise key issues, and pitch complex ideas to influence different stakeholders. Proactive, quality-conscious, results-oriented and thrives under pressure in a fast-paced and dynamic tech environment. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company as we believe that diversity is meaningful to innovation. Our employee benefits are based on a total rewards approach, offering a holistic and market-competitive suite of perks. This includes generous leave benefits to meet your work-life needs. We trust that you will get the job done wherever you are, and whatever works best for you – so work from home or take a break to exercise if you need to*. We also believe it’s important for you to keep honing your craft in the constantly-evolving tech landscape, so we provide and support a plethora of in-house and external learning and development opportunities all year round. Subject to the nature of your job role that might require you to be onsite during fixed hours

What the role is At Sport Singapore, we aspire to transform the nation through an active lifestyle designed around innovative, fun and meaningful sporting experiences. Sport has the unique ability to bring people together through play, regardless of age, gender, race, ability or social status. It imparts life values, nurtures character and builds resilience. It inspires and evokes the Singapore spirit through shared experiences and strengthens our national identity. We help Singaporeans Live Better Through Sport. Sport Singapore is constantly on the lookout for individuals who are passionate about what they do. Anchored in our values of Passion for Sport, Strength through Teamwork and Care for People, we believe in working and playing, not just as a team, but as a family. What you will be working on Responsibilities: Reporting to the Division Head, you will utilise oral and written communication as well as organisation skills to guide, monitor, and empower a team from Programme Innovation 1 of SportCares to use sports and other initiatives for social development with the outcome of improving the lives of underprivileged children, youth at risk and isolated and vulnerable seniors. You will also fulfil the following responsibilities: Establish new and maintain existing partnership to increase the width of the outreach. Identify sport trends and demand to better attract the participation of the beneficiaries. Keep staff abreast of compliance with procurement policies and regulations through management and control of procurement procedures. Conduct and complete programme evaluations to determine level of effectiveness and necessary changes. Work with the team to refine current and create new programmes using the sport for social development framework in order to effectively execute the programmes. Lead sports programme staff in their development, review and delivery of sport programmes to allow for the deepening of outreach Establish partnership with social development partners to deepen the outreach through partner programmes and initiatives Identify social development gaps in current programmes to deepen our engagement of the beneficiaries Create an environment that promotes positive communication, strategize and plan to reach goals and build relationships all around. What we are looking for Requirements We are looking for self-motivated individuals who value integrity, teamwork and take pride in going the extra mile to provide excellent service. In addition, an ideal candidate should possess the following: Relevant Sport Science / Sport Management; or Social Work / Social Studies / Social Development; or Related field qualification Min. 8 years of working experience in sports sector with at least 3 years’ experience in leading, managing and empowering a team Familiarity in developing coaches. Availability on weekends as and when required Passion in working with either one of the segments (youth, families and seniors) is a must. Experience in running programmes and outreach (not necessary sports related) to either one of the segments (youth, families and seniors) Experience in working with partners Must be able to multi-task and be reactive to changes yet proactive in planning and executing Only shortlisted applicants will be notified within 2 weeks after closing date. The level of offer will commensurate with applicant’s experience and track records. Successful candidates will be offered a 2/3-year contract in the first instance. Successful candidates will be offered a 2/3-year contract in the first instance.

RESPONSIBILITIES: · Processing of TPS payroll · Prepare monthly headcount and payroll reconciliation · Monthly submission of Bank file for payroll payment · Monthly submission of CPF Contributions via online · Prepare monthly and quarterly payroll journal entries for uploading to GEOS · Annual local TPS employee income tax filing and submission via IRAS website · Processing of yearly bonuses (AWS & DRIVE) payout run · Prepare actual and forecast funds request to Treasury and keep close follow-up · Coordinate and prepare yearly payroll calendar for all pay-groups · Creation of employee payroll bank file in JP Morgan bank system · Attend to employee pay enquires and liaise closely with TMOS/BMOS and JP Morgan bank for any non-receipt of payroll payment and all non-receipt should be treated as important / urgency basis and to closely follow-up · Attend ad-hoc payment request and to be processed and approved within 24 hours · Support and comply payroll related surveys · Record keeping of payroll related documents and correspondence · Involve in Annual Budgeting exercise · Yearly Statutory external Financial Standards Audit by PWC · Support P&C and Payroll Manager for any ad-hoc assignment as at when is required REQUIREMENTS · Working experience in a Shared Service Center (SSC) or Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) environment is preferred. · Advanced Diploma in Human Resource Management or Advanced Diploma in Accountancy or equivalent professional qualification with at least 8 years of multi-county payroll processing and supervisory experience in one or two of the following countries; Singapore, Malaysia, India, Australia, China, UAE and Saudi Arabia. · Knowledge of SOX will be an advantage. · Computer skills with knowledge of an ERP system such as SAP/EuHReka and Sage Easy Pay payroll software and GEOS system. · Good knowledge in Microsoft Excel, Word, Access and MS Office applications. As a Captain, you will be responsible for upholding the highest quality standards for the food and beverage (F&B) operations in our restaurant. EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE NTC Certification; or six months to two years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. SKILLS & ABILITIES · Customer-oriented approach and patience · Problem solving and decision making skills · Hands on experience in cashier duties · Excellent people skills · Responsible and trustworthy · Attention to cleanliness and safety

Job_Title: Product Specialist - Premium Equity Advisor (Associate Director/Director)
Job_Descriptions: Product Specialist - Premium Equity Advisor (Associate Director/Director) At Bank of Singapore, we are constantly on the lookout for exceptional individuals to join our team. We promote a culture of openness, teamwork and fairness. Most importantly, we invest in our people through our programmes that develop them on both professional and personal levels. Besides attractive remuneration packages, we offer non-financial benefits and opportunities to develop your potential within OCBC Group’s global network of subsidiaries and offices. If you have passion, drive and the will to succeed, rise to the challenge today! Bank of Singapore opens doors to new opportunities. Start your career with Bank of Singapore as a Product Specialist - Premium Equity Advisor ! ! We are looking for an enthusiastic and motivated team member, who thrives in a fast-paced environment, and is excited to make meaningful contributions to the Equity Advisory team. The candidate, as a Premium Equity Advisor, will be responsible for the growth of Equities & Derivatives business through direct engagement with the most important Equity investing clients of the Bank. The role involves providing proactive tailored advisory solutions to such clientele with the objective to deepen the wallet-share and mind-share with our clients. The candidate should be a self-starter with entrepreneurial mindset in managing daily client engagement. The ideal candidate should demonstrate a result-oriented mindset, measured through various growth metrics both quantitatively and quantitatively. Premium Equity Role (External Client Coverage) Direct Client coverage responsibilities, in partnership with Relationship Managers. Responsible for actively engaging such Clients, with a specific focus on actively providing advice on equity related investments. To be successful in the role, the Advisor is expected to be able to effectively communicate relevant market information and actionable investment ideas to such Clients under coverage, taking care to ensure specific circumstances for every Clients ("know-your-client"). Premium Advisor functions in close collaboration/partnership with the broader Equity Advisory team in ensuring the best ideas (in line with the Bank's research view), and thought-leadership are distributed to end-Clients. Part of the responsibilities include execution of Client trades, and relevant follow-ups, as well as risk management on Clients' positions, with the aim to optimize Client's portfolio performance. Premium Advisor has to ensure compliance on the rules of engagement, and also best execution policy, acting in the best interest of Clients. Also, as part of the long-term growth of the business, Premium Advisor is expected to maintain excellent working relationships with Front Office sales teams to actively cultivate a pipeline of potential Clients. This may involve participation in client meetings and also periodic sales meetings from time to time to market the Equities franchise. An effective Advisor is expected to be commercial with a keen focus on growing the business while making sure that Clients servicing needs and portfolio performance are always prioritized. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in any discipline. Candidate should possess at least 10 years of relevant Securities sales experience in sell-side or buy-side institution. Key attribute is to be able to clearly rationalize an actionable investment idea. Candidate must demonstrate previous experience in managing active client engagement in an Advisory role (not just Execution, which is more of a passive role). Excellent communication & interpersonal skills required. CFA qualification or equivalent an added plus

Job_Title: Assistant VP, Network & Infrastructure Security, Group Infrastructure
Job_Descriptions: About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches. Job Responsibilities Responsible for managing Enterprise and Regional LAN WAN network infrastructure services Responsible for the upkeep of network infrastructure which includes device management life cycles, inventory, budgeting, capacity and performance planning and etc. Involved in the development, implementation and maintenance of network operating processes and procedures Involved in the design, planning and implementation for new projects and setup On 24 x 7 operational standby with strong customer service orientation and drive Job Requirements Good Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology or relevant qualifications Minimum 3 to 4 years’ relevant working experience in managing large, complex LAN/WAN networking/security platform Strong technical competencies with hands-on experience in routers, switches, firewalls, proxies, VPN concentrators, link balancers, load balancers, ACE servers, WiFi, DNS/DHCP systems, Network management tools and etc Working experiences on SD-WAN, SDDC and Micro-segmentation Working experiences in managing Cloud technology such as AWS, Azure and GCP Experience with scripting and network automation. Good analytical skills, meticulous, energetic, resourceful and inspirational. Possess good written and documentation skills and effective communication skills able to collaborate and work with various stakeholders. Good team player and able to work effectively at all levels with the ability to influence others to move towards consensus. Eager to learn new skills / technology and keep abreast with industry trends and best practice Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. Apply now and make a difference.

Job_Title: Aladdin Business, Product Marketing Aladdin Studio, Vice President
Job_Descriptions: Aladdin Business, Product Marketing Aladdin Studio, Vice President Description About this role BlackRock is one of the world's leading asset management firms and Aladdin® is the central nervous system powering the investment decisions of both the firm and its clients. Aladdin is a $1bn technology business that has significant growth aspirations over the next five years. Recently, Aladdin launched Aladdin Studio, a suite of tools meant to empower the Aladdin Community to build on top of Aladdin and unlock innovation. The Aladdin Product Marketing team is focused on driving awareness, engagement, and adoption for the Studio offering across the community, including prospects, and existing clients. As part of this team, you connect directly with our users to understand their business problems and help deliver solutions. We partner with product and client teams to build products that deliver a superior user experience and have a robust community of evangelists. The Product Marketing Manager (PMM) for Aladdin Studio is responsible for working cross-functionally to drive awareness and adoption of Aladdin Studio's product suite across engineers, data scientists, citizen developers and other technology professionals. Aladdin Studio includes free and premium capabilities that integrate with the investment process and help our clients build on top of Aladdin to solve their unique business challenges. In this role, the successful candidate is responsible for defining the strategies that deliver happy customers throughout the product lifecycle. This includes measuring, optimizing, and being responsible for the user journey as it relates to product and feature adoption. Primary responsibilities Lead team responsible for one of Aladdin Studio's premium offerings - including Aladdin APIs, Aladdin Data Cloud, Aladdin Compute and the user segments who leverage them Devise strategies to grow usage among target segments for Studio capabilities including citizen developers and engineers Create and implement plans to grow the number of "Developers" in the Aladdin Community Craft a narrative to the community on Aladdin Studio's capabilities - demonstrating to them how Aladdin Studio can be used to automate and retire manual processes, integrate with third party systems, and meet bespoke requirements Own and execute digital activities for new product launches and other public facing campaigns Oversee the creation of high-quality product communications, use case guides, and documentation Connect industry knowledge and market trends with user feedback to influence product decisions and prioritization Build relationships with senior touchpoints at clients and partners Assist in Aladdin business development activities as a subject matter expert - attending prospect meetings, participating in proof-of-concept sessions, and crafting gold copy responses to RFPs Provide management oversight to junior product marketing staff Essential skills / experience 6-9 years product marketing, product management, or project management experience with a focus on products for technologists Proven track record in bringing new products to market and successfully driving their adoption to enterprise clients Experience building a community of developers and driving adoption of technology products Ability to collect and distil requirements from internal and external users to provide technology partners with a clear understanding of enhancement opportunities and their relative priority Entrepreneurial drive and technical insight to make great products better Experience managing and cultivating high performing teams Familiarity with cloud native or serverless technologies Strong communication and presentation skills with an ability to convey complex concepts simply and clearly to clients Customer service mindset and experience dealing with users Track record of influencing behaviour at various levels in the organization including cross-functional leaders Self-starter who enjoys working in a fast paced, high-intensity environment Experience with programming, data visualization, notebooks, and/or business intelligence frameworks highly valued Our benefits To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about. About BlackRock At BlackRock, we are all connected by one mission: to help more and more people experience financial well-being. Our clients, and the people they serve, are saving for retirement, paying for their children's educations, buying homes and starting businesses. Their investments also help to strengthen the global economy: support businesses small and large; finance infrastructure projects that connect and power cities; and facilitate innovations that drive progress. This mission would not be possible without our smartest investment - the one we make in our employees. It's why we're dedicated to creating an environment where our colleagues feel welcomed, valued and supported with networks, benefits and development opportunities to help them thrive. For additional information on BlackRock, please visit careers.blackrock.com | www.blackrock.com/corporate | Instagram: @blackrock | Twitter: @blackrock | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/blackrock BlackRock is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law. BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.

Purpose: Overall responsible for the manufacturing activities of flavors, to achieve the required levels of operational efficiency while meeting customer's quality, lead-time requirements and ensure better than industry standards to meet customer satisfaction. Duties & Responsibilities: · Direct control of the whole Flavor production team through efficient production planning, control of raw materials and quality production process. · Support Plant Manager in managing all Flavor production activities. · Ensure good manufacturing practices that adhere to ISO, Food Safety, HACCP and EHS requirements. · Ensure finished products comply with customer specifications and company regulatory requirements and standards. · Ensure efficient and timely execution of the production schedule. · Plan and monitor factory preventive maintenance to make certain that all equipment and machineries are functioning properly. · Plan and monitor factory maintenance activities to assure good housekeeping. · Work closely with the QA/QC and Process Industrialization Department to ensure quality of products. · Investigate and find out the root cause with regards to customer complaints and internal rejects. · Work closely with Planning, Purchasing and Research & Development Departments to ensure efficient stocks level of raw materials to meet timely delivery of finished products. · Manage all CAPEX and projects related to Flavor Production. · Initiate reviews of production budget, processes, policies and procedures to improve efficiency, reduce cost and increase productivity whilst maintaining industry standards of quality and safety. · Monitor, study and improve on machine utilization, work & material, production cost performance and initiates cost reduction program. · Make plans for the future expansion in line with business goals to increase the sales of flavor production. · Identify, plan and coordinate developmental training needs for staff to maintain standards of competencies. Job Requirements · Tertiary Education or equivalent in years of similar experience. · At least 5 years relevant experience working in chemical plant with managerial function. · Leadership and Managerial Skills. · Good knowledge of Good Manufacturing Practices, international Certification Standards, such as ISO, etc. · Prior knowledge of Food Safety and HACCP. · Able to communicate effectively with all levels of staff. · Good organizational and leadership skills. · Chemical Knowledge.

Product Specialist - Equity Advisor (Associate Director/Director) At Bank of Singapore, we are constantly on the lookout for exceptional individuals to join our team. The candidate, as a product specialist within the Equities Advisory team, will be responsible for growing the Equities and Derivatives business. The main responsibility of the role is to originate and distribute equities and derivatives investment ideas and solutions through internal channel to RMs & ICs. Also expected to work in close collaboration with Premium Advisors (part of Equities Advisory team) who are more focused on external client coverage. The candidate will also be a dedicated Equities and Derivatives resource to attend internal meetings with RMs and ICs to present ideas and updates, attend joint calls and meetings with end clients, and work with the CIO and research teams to develop investment themes and ideas. Candidate will be challenged to undertake project work in the trading department's fast-growing data and digital initiatives. As such, digital skillsets from previous experience is highly valued. Equities Advisory Originate daily, actionable cash equity, and equity derivative investment ideas for the Front Office, in line with Bank of Singapore's research views, validated against additional elements such as technical signals, momentum, short term catalysts, flows etc. Assist with implementation of the desk's flagship 'High Conviction List' of top global equity ideas. Continuously review the top equity holdings of clients within the bank and provide recommendations regarding re-balancing, taking profit or provide recovery ideas. Work closely with the Equity Research team and other asset class advisory teams to deliver a broad range of investment solutions. Help drive the build-out of the trading floor's data capabilities, as well as the migration of investment content to digital channels. CFA qualification or equivalent an added plus. We are ultimately looking for high character individuals who are resilient, intellectually curious, team-oriented, and take pride in their work. Candidates should preferably have at least 10 years of relevant Equities and/or Derivatives experience in a sell-side or buy-side institution. Notwithstanding, outstanding candidates with fewer years of work experience, but with demonstrable ambition, hunger to learn, and a passion for the markets will be considered. Candidates must have strong equities knowledge, including the ability to understand fundamental and technical factors. As part of our initiative to continue the build our franchise data & digital capabilities, candidates with experience on digital/technical skillset (macros/VBA, Python, Power BI, Qlikview, SQL) highly preferred. Excellent communication skills are a must. Candidates must be able to articulate and defend an investment thesis, while having the confidence to present in front of large groups. Strong writing skills preferred.

Product Owner About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities For Agile Deliveries, the Product Owner is responsible for maximising the business value of the product resulting from work done by the Development Team. The PO is the person with ultimate accountability for the successful delivery which includes all aspects of the data relating to their Agile Delivery The PO role is usually assigned to the senior manager who has operational/business responsibility for the Product. This ensures that business requirements are adequately addressed in the Project and there is smooth transition and hand-over to BAU. The PO is responsible for: Representing the stakeholders, and has the mandate to prioritise scope(functions/features) on behalf of the business Creating and maintaining a prioritised Product Backlog, ensuring it is visible, transparent and clear Preparing the Agile Execution Document, including the Initial Release Plan and other associated mandatory milestones and tracking and reporting delivery against the Initial Release Plan Clearly communicating priorities, objectives/goals, mission and acceptance criteria to the Agile Delivery Team Ensuring the Agile Delivery Team members understand items in the Product Backlog to the level needed The PO may ask the PgPMO or Scrum Master to update the Clarity data on their behalf. Ensuring that all submissions to committees (status reports, AED, Red packs, Closure Reports etc.) are of the right quality and are timely. Communicating progress outside the core Agile Delivery Team including reporting RAG status to PgSC Ensuring Project deliverables are of the desired quality and have appropriate endorsements/ sign-offs Transitioning and hand over to BAU. Owning the review of Benefits over the lifecycle When requested, presenting the Agile Delivery Closure report to the PgSC or PRC before the Project is closed. They are the sole person (not a committee) responsible for managing the Product Backlog. While the PO may represent the desires of a committee in the Product Backlog, those wanting to change a Product Backlog item's priority must request the PO to do so. For the PO to succeed, the entire organisation must respect his or her decisions. The PO's decisions are visible in the content and prioritisation of the Product Backlog. The Development Team needs to work from the prioritised product backlog as agreed with the PO. They should not be requested to work from a different set of requirements by any other stakeholders. Job_Title: Markets Operations – Derivatives and Margining Operations Manager
Job_Descriptions: Markets Operations – Derivatives and Margining Operations Manager Citi Markets Operations is currently at a pivotal point in its evolution and journey to implement a target operating model. We take pride and are passionate about our People and our culture. We are invested in our People and their development. We are transforming and simplifying our operating model, creating an exciting environment which encourages diversity of thought and inclusion. We are a dynamic, global, and diverse Organisation, with a presence in over 60 Countries; covering all front post execution Operations teams including product aligned Middle Oﬃce groups, Settlements, Margin, Asset Servicing, Listed Derivative & Commodities Operations. We support an extensive range of Capital Markets products and services including Fixed Income (FX, Rates, Credit, Muni, Cash and Derivatives) where Citi is consistently a dominant top 3 player in the market, Equity (Cash, Derivatives, Prime Brokerage, Futures, Listed Derivs, FXPB) where Citi has a signiﬁcant growth program to continue to build out its capabilities and services; and Syndicates where we support both FI and EQ new issues and IPOs. Our Operations groups are core to the success of the Markets business and have signiﬁcant impact across the lifecycle of a trade. We partner extensively with a range of internal stakeholders including Front Oﬃce Sales and Trading Desks, Compliance, Legal, Finance and HR; alongside having signiﬁcant interaction with our external client base, playing a key role in the overall client experience. We have a Client relationship group, dedicated to overseeing the Organizational service performance and strategic partnership for our top tier client base, where we play a key role in supporting our global clients to ensure they have a ﬁrst-class experience when doing business with Citi. Our Business Intelligence and Process Re-engineering group works alongside our Operations teams delivering automation solutions to solve for operational challenges. We partner with Citi's innovation labs to drive optimization, and overall play a pivotal role in enabling us to transform to achieve our target operating model. Our Technology partners develop and implement a wide range of applications that support the Operations, Change, Design and Implementation groups in providing innovative products and solutions. We have re-imagined how to provide technology and service in our domain through the alignment of our team vision, culture, and aggressive retirement plan for legacy applications and adoption of a micro-based containerized cloud environment. We encourage our people to create, explore and be adventurous whilst taking measured risk, adopting safe practices to protect the ﬁrm. Data lineage and optimization is core to how we develop our eco system. We are growing our capabilities using artiﬁcial intelligence, natural language processing and machine learning. Our roles entail ensuring we operate in a robust control environment, whilst in a fast-paced workplace. We comply with global regulations and internal policies and adopt a proactive approach to identifying opportunities to reduce risk through the continuous evaluation of our controls; to protect our clients, the ﬁrm, and our reputation. We work closely with our external global peers, partners, and regulators, and play an integral part in leading an agenda at the forefront to optimize and streamline processes and drive strategy across our industry. Job Purpose: Reporting into Singapore Markets Ops Leadership Team, the primary responsibility of the Derivatives and Margining Operations Manager will be Proactive engagement with Singapore country and APAC Regional Markets Operations stakeholders (Business, Technology, Finance/PCG, Legal, Operations) in order to support the business and clients trading in Markets products, such as FX, FX Option and OTC Derivatives products. Play a leading role in managing the end to end process of the OTC Margining functions. Drive and implement sustainable processes, automation/migration initiatives, and standard adherence to policies. Working very closely with Operations Control on developing and adhering to an effective control framework that fully meets Audit, Compliance and Regulatory requirements; delivery of periodic presentations to external regulators as required. Involvement in shaping/building standardized and sustainable operational workflow and service standards for new product/production variations launches by Global/APAC Markets business. ie. NPAC process. Ensuring robust infrastructure and tools (Dashboards, MIS, Alerts etc.) are in place to effectively manage risk and service our clients to a high standard. Involved in preparing & publishing strong MIS information for regular Management Updates High level of focus on digitization, automation and elimination of manual touch points (MTP). People Agenda: Involvement in the successful People and Engagement strategy to help attract, develop, retain and recognize a diverse and talented global workforce Promoting a culture of continuous improvement and cultivating a robust service and control environment Engaging with and leading our People. Developing effective and diverse teams across a global footprint Championing diversity and inclusion to create a working environment which allows our People to thrive and excel Qualifications and Skills: Degree or equivalent work experience preferred 5-10+ years of experience in Tier 1 global financial institutions including extensive experience in handling large projects delivering operational activities, especially in FX, FX Option, OTC Derivatives and Margining processes. Experience delivering strategic change programs spanning multiple years in a fast paced, large global financial services firm, ideally in an operations organisation Energetic, flexible, collaborative, and proactive; a leader who can positively and productively add product impact to both strategic and tactical technology Strong, influential communicator who is articulate and concise, demonstrated success interacting with senior management both in the business, corporate functions as well as the Operations, Business and Technology environments Strong risk management and control mindset Provides evaluative judgment based on analysis of factual information in complicated, unique and dynamic situations; draws on diverse range of internal and external sources Self-reliant, good problem solver, results oriented Demonstrated experience leading people and developing effective and diverse teams. Ability to establish and build trust with professionals throughout the business as a leader, advisor and business partner to the organization with a clear client orientation. Strong awareness of both external and internal best practice perspectives, maintaining a balanced and fresh viewpoint. Ability to conceptualize aspects of the organization's model and its future development. Hiring_Company: Consortium For Clinical Research And Innovation, Singapore Pte. Ltd.
Job_Descriptions: About PRECISE Precision Health Research, Singapore (PRECISE) is the central entity set up to coordinate a whole of government effort to implement Phase II of Singapore's 10-year National Precision Medicine (NPM) strategy. PRECISE is part of the Consortium for Clinical Research and Innovation Singapore (CRIS) umbrella of research-related business entities. About the role You will be part of the Business Development team and be responsible for implementing and managing public-private partnerships to attract investments, develop research and enterprise capabilities and create jobs for Singapore. Individuals who are keen to see precision medicine create opportunities for businesses and impact Singapore’s healthcare and population health, and for those who can handle the diverse worlds of business, government and academic worlds, will find a good fit for this role. Responsibilities: · Project development The Project Manager is expected to work with the Business Development Manager to facilitate the development of specific project agreements by arranging and participating in technical and business discussions, developing term sheets and project plans, facilitating review by participating organisations and relevant departments, and managing relevant approval processes. · Project management To ensure successful project execution and delivery, the Project Manager is expected to take on tasks such as budget management, project performance management and reporting, and project variations. · Other duties The Project Manager is expected to take on secretariat role for selected meetings and assist in other ad hoc duties assigned by PRECISE. · Future development The Project Manager can expect to develop knowledge in intellectual property, R&D contracts, project management, and a strong understanding of how to apply technology to make an impact. As the Singapore National Precision Medicine programme is rapidly evolving, the Project Manager may also be offered opportunity in business development, industry intelligence, and licensing. Requirements: · Degree in Life Sciences or a related field; a postgraduate degree is an advantage · At least 6 years of working experience in research programme management and/or project management in either academia or industry · Some familiarity in contractual terminology · Appreciation of science and technology development and innovation and willingness to learn new technical jargons · Effective and thoughtful written and verbal communicator · Strong organisational and administrative skills; good negotiation skills · Able to identify and contextualise stakeholder issues, and manage them appropriately · Willing, adaptable and flexible to take on other required/necessary tasks

What the role is The Building and Construction Authority (BCA) champions the development of a future ready built environment for Singapore. Besides regulating building safety, we lead and transform the built environment sector in delivering a safe, high quality, sustainable and friendly built environment. We are looking for resourceful, energetic and self-motivated individuals who are inspired to play an active role to make a difference to Singapore’s built environment. What you will be working on The Building and Construction Authority (BCA) is responsible for driving the outcomes of the Construction Industry Transformation Map (ITM). You will be part of the team that partners identified companies on their transformation journey. You will have the opportunity to engage a variety of stakeholders and at various levels to understand business trends and enterprise transformation plans, as well as offer solutions to achieve success. Responsibilities: Serve as the main contact person for a portfolio of identified companies and oversee end-to-end processes of account development and servicing, as well as project negotiation and execution. Cultivate strategic relationships and build trust with key stakeholders and identified companies, through a deep understanding of their needs, operations, structure, and dynamics Identify, negotiate, and structure project opportunities to secure “win-win” outcomes for key stakeholders and Singapore’s built environment sector Source and activate relevant resources and expertise (in BCA, government, ecosystem partners) to support stakeholder engagements and projects Build a sound understanding of industry and technology trends, government offerings and BCA’s products/services to create opportunities and formulate appropriate business development strategies What we are looking for Requirements: At least 5-8 years of relevant work experience in business/corporate development roles. Experience in the built environment sector is an advantage. Strong analytical and strategic thinking skills, with a knack for offering actionable solutions Keen business acumen and experience in negotiation/conflict management, structuring deals, and project management Able to build and maintain positive stakeholder relationships and work in a dynamic, cross-functional team environment Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and spoken, including ability and experience in engaging and managing stakeholders across all levels of seniority internally and externally Possesses positive attitude, excellent work ethic and is a team player Successful candidates will be offered contract employment. Remuneration shall commensurate with qualification and experience. Interested applicants, please apply online
