The Opportunity Esco Lifesciences Group provides enabling technologies, products and services to the life sciences and healthcare industries, supporting academic research and scientific discoveries, clinical practice, as well as biopharmaceutical R&D and manufacturing. Headquartered in Singapore, Esco has an extensive sales network in over 100 countries, direct sales and service offices in over 20 countries, 8 manufacturing and R&D hubs in the US, Europe, the UK, China, Singapore, Indonesia, and over 1300 employees worldwide. Esco is poised to benefit from the sustained growth of the healthcare and biopharma industries in Asia and globally. Esco has achieved market leadership in China, and globally, in multiple categories within some of the fastest-growing segments — with China being its largest and fastest growing market. As a Singapore-headquartered company, Esco is a nexus of East and West, bridging technologies, products and talent across the world, with global operations spanning the US, Europe and Asia. Main Duties The ideal candidate will be involved with the general accounting function including preparing journal entries, maintaining balance sheet schedules, ledgers, reconciliation, monthly closings and account analysis, and supporting colleagues from various departments. Candidate must have strong interpersonal skills, independent, and able to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment. Responsibilities: · Prepare journal entries and maintain the general ledger · Responsible for month-end closing, preparation of monthly financial reports, and other reports as required by management · Review and monitor financial performance vs. budgets and prepare cash flow forecasts · Reconciliation and analysis of accounts, as necessary · Monitor bank accounts and resolve issues, if any · In-charge of invoicing, monitoring receivables, and follow up collection from customers · Prepare purchase orders, review and process payment vouchers, and expense reports · Monitor and control inventories · Ensure compliance with all accounting, tax, statutory, legislative requirements and group policies · Other tasks assigned by management The Ideal Candidate Would Possess: · Degree in Accountancy, with at least three (3) years working experience in General accounting · Must be a Certified Public Accountant (CA/CPA) · Audit background preferred, but not compulsory · Working knowledge in Microsoft NAV is an advantage · Organized, analytical, and can work under pressure · Can maintain high accuracy of work · Able to converse and read in English · High professional integrity, honesty, and trust · Proactive and a team player

Job_Title: Tech Support Analyst - Executive Support Manager
Job_Descriptions: Tech Support Analyst - Executive Support Manager About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities Business Ensures that support and services provided to Executives meet established service level commitments and End User Satisfaction Serves as a first point of escalation for executives and takes end-to-end ownership of resolving reported issues and fulfilling requests Tracks issue response, resolution times, and customer satisfaction Reviews all performance data, and where deficiencies are identified, ensures appropriate corrective actions are pursued in a timely manner Regularly communicates improvements and changes to Executives, including ways in which available technology can be fully utilized to drive greater productivity Builds productive relationships with Executives and support staff Resolves technology issues encountered by executives in a timely manner and ensures systemic issues are escalated and remediated to prevent further occurrences Influences the broader technology community to drive required improvements in support and services offered to executives Proactively pursues, through insights gained by working with executives, improvements to existing processes and technology offerings, including introduction of new technologies that maximize productivity Provides one-on-one training regarding the features and functionality of a broad set of technologies used by Executives Recognises and identifies deficiencies and drives all necessary changes Superior service orientation Ability to effectively interface with business executives Ability to navigate the technical and diverse challenges involved in supporting the executive management team of a global enterprise Willing to travel locally and overseas to support offsite events Provide IT home setup and support for senior executive members Provide IT Support for virtual events (on site and remote) Provision of support between 7:00 and 19:00 plus out of hours and weekends (on rota) Customer facing role Build relationships and collaboration with Global Support staff to drive consistently high-level support Take a pro-active approach wherever possible Build appropriate culture and values. Set appropriate tone. Collaboration with Business partners Manage Client knowledge base Regulatory & Business Conduct Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group's Values and Code of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. Lead to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank's Conduct Principles : Fair Outcomes for Clients; Effective Financial Markets; Financial Crime Compliance; The Right Environment. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters. Key Stakeholders The role will form part of a dedicated team who provide high level proactive support for the most senior members of staff in the organisation. Team members will perform and establish general IT maintenance tasks and resolve moderate complex problems immediately. The team lead will provide special handling for all technology issues that originate in the Directorate. The role will provide customer facing support and work across divisions and Global regions as a point of contact for the MT & Board Support Team for End User Services. Our Ideal Candidate Degree educated in Computer Science/Engineering or a related discipline Minimum 5 years of experience in similar background. Foundational understating of ITIL Broad knowledge of Desktop and End User Technologies Windows 10 OS, advanced troubleshooting Excellent Microsoft Operating Systems and Office Automation High technical proficiency with in-depth knowledge of modern IT infrastructure technologies including networks, telephony, AV systems, storage, servers, data centre, messaging, databases, desktops, mobility & user devices Strong experience in Microsoft systems administration coupled with relevant professional qualifications (typically MCSE) Active Directory, Exchange, SharePoint, SCCM Mobile device support and management - iOS and Android Advanced troubleshooting and root-cause analysis to avoid re-occurring issues Experience with different web conferencing and collaboration systems (Skype, Blue Jeans, Zoom, Webex, Teams) End-to-end management of all support tickets Ability to operate at a break-fix level to diagnose and address common issues experienced by VIPs Ability to learn new technologies Non-Technical Skills Build relationships with executive members of staff and their support teams Represent MT & Board Support function working with key members across divisions\regions Proven experience supporting staff at the Executive and Board levels Must be courteous, polite, friendly and professional Work well in a team environment Excellent communication skills written and verbal when interacting with executives Excellent organizational, time management and crisis management skills Service-oriented mindset Financial Acumen when working with vendors for offsite events Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages . We welcome conversations on flexible working.

Job_Title: Business IT and Solutions Delivery Manager (Contract)
Job_Descriptions: Business IT and Solutions Delivery Manager (Contract) This position is for a 12-months contract. Role As Business IT and Solutions Delivery Manager (Contract), the incumbent will support the team in projects and BAU activities. Responsibilities Projects Coordinate and support Overseas Offices as User Representative in projects driven by Group functions Assist in the consolidation and evaluation of user requirements Work with Business Users and IT to review mappings and functional specifications Prepare UAT Plan, Test Scripts and coordinate testing execution and follow-up on test results Assist in documentation and provide walkthroughs on system related enhancements Provide post implementation support BAU Activities Conduct GCIF user group tagging or un-tagging Assist in the MidasPlus Template User Template Review Assist in the MidasPlus limits Review Assist in the SWIFT limits Review Support the MidasPlus GL Account Description Review Support and participate in activities relating to validating and executing Group Separation Strategy for overseas offices. *LI-AL Qualifications Requirements Degree holder with minimum of 3-4 years in supporting projects implementation Possess good interpersonal & communication skills with the ability to communicate and work effectively with team members and system users Possess critical thinking and problem-solving skills Knowledge of core banking systems will be a plus

Store Manager About OCBC Having purpose and making a real impact drives what we do at OCBC, for our customers, colleagues and the community. People count on us to deliver an amazing banking experience, but more importantly one that is uncomplicated and complements their changing lifestyle and business needs. Our employees are the architects that make this all possible; they are high performing individuals and teams, experts in their field and above all believe in our purpose and commitment to customers. What you'll do The Store Manager reports to the Customer Service Manager and is responsible whereby the store manager will manage a lifestyle store within a new mega branch in its operations, resource management as well as staff development. The incumbent is self- driven, exhibits unparalleled top-tiered service delivery and support and not only inspires others but leads by example as well. Supervise a team of Lifestyle Ambassadors to deliver the service standards and financial target for for the store Train, guide, inspire and provide service learning to the team. Maintain positive image of the store with high standards of premise management, including visual merchandising at Lifestyle areas. Manage customer feedback and complaints and ensure tight control and compliance in the store Work closely with internal departments (Marketing, Group Lifestyle Financing) to conceptualized promotions/campaigns eg. new client onboarding, products, credit cards etc Prepare sales forecasts and curates products and merchandises especially during festive seasons Liaise with vendors to ensure stocks, products and merchandises are at the optimum level Ensure accuracy of payments and pricing of the products Qualifications What you bring Diploma or degree in Banking or Finance More than 5 years of experience in retail customer service leadership role. Excellent people management skills. Independent, result driven and customer centric. Adaptable and flexible with work schedule

What the role is The Business Management Department (BMD) provides corporate support for Meteorological Service Singapore (MSS) under the National Environment Agency. BMD is responsible for customer relationship management including contracts, facility management, outreach and events. What you will be working on You will be part of the team in BMD, working in close partnership with other divisions within MSS to drive the publicity/marketing, communications and event management efforts of MSS. Broadly, you will be responsible for the following areas: Design multimedia content materials including graphics/infographics/images for publicity materials such as videos, newsletters and posters to support MSS’ outreach and communications efforts Film and edit in-house produced videos, including directing subjects and incorporating/creating graphics to enhance the video’s quality Photography and management of stock images for MSS publicity materials Ad hoc duties as assigned by MSS, which may include helping out in events, administrative duties, video production related procurement, involvement in department’s projects etc. What we are looking for Job Requirement: Relevant qualification in media communications with 2-3 years of relevant, hands-on experience in graphic design and video production Familiar with photography Well-versed with Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects and Photoshop Resourceful with an eye for detail and aesthetics Good team player and able to work with various stakeholders Able to multi-task well and possesses a sense of urgency Additional skillset and experience with Blackmagic Design software would be advantageous Please submit samples of your design portfolio, clearly stating the areas of your involvement (if the sample provided was a result of team effort). Applicants will be updated on the status of their applications within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

Job_Title: Exec / Senior Exec/ Asst Devt Partner, Business Services (1 Year Contract)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is Within the Industry Cluster group in ESG, you will be part of the team that drives industry growth of our Singapore economy and builds competitive Singapore companies internationally. As part of Business Services Division, you will have the opportunity to engage with Singapore companies from the professional services sector, and to help them to enhance their enterprise capabilities and productivity through the Enterprise Development Grant. What you will be working on Within the Business Services Division, you will help to evaluate grant applications and assess projects to ensure eligibility of applicants, robustness of projects, and completeness of applications. In addition to engaging companies, you will also interact with solution provider vendors and other government agencies to clarify and answer enquiries relating to the grant applications (through evaluating the eligibility criteria, key areas of solutions and governance) and to provide recommendations to support or otherwise. You may be required to carry out research on sector-related projects, in order to augment the division's understanding and outreach within the sector. Additionally, you will be required to recommend improvements to the end-to-end grant process and perform some administrative duties to support the division. What we are looking for Candidates should minimally have a diploma in any discipline, and 3-4 years of working experience in preferred areas of business operations, finance, administration or marketing. They should demonstrate strong communication (verbal and written) and analytical skills, be able to work independently and possess basic understanding and/or interest in grant administration, policy and governance. Candidate who possess basic understanding and/or interest for the sector would have an advantage

Job_Title: Executive / Senior Executive, Schemes Operations Systems (Contract)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Financing Ecosystem Division drives and supports Enterprise Singapore’s efforts to grow Singapore companies by improving their access to financing. You will be part of a team to support robust processing and back-end operations of government financing schemes. What you will be working on Your job scope includes, but is not limited to the following: Performing user acceptance testing on a regular basis to ensure that the system is developed in accordance to requirements Engaging stakeholders to understand system requirements and propose possible solutions in terms of system design What we are looking for You must be comfortable working with complex IT system and conducting user acceptance testing. You will be required to work independently and must be reliable in following through on the work assigned to you. You should possess an inquiring and analytical mind and take pride in your work and constantly be looking out for better or different ways of doing things. An ideal candidate would possess the following experience and qualities: Background in Business, Finance or Computer Science. Meticulous and proficient in the process of user acceptance testing and be able to complete robust testing of test scripts within the given time frame. Experience in working with complex IT systems and Agile development projects is an added advantage Be an effective team player with good stakeholder management skills, meticulous in your work, with good numeracy, communication and writing skills.

Job_Title: Asst Devt Partner / Devt Partner, Startup Development (1-year contract)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is As part of the Startup Development Division, you will play a part in developing a vibrant local startup ecosystem through engaging with local and international partners and startups, as well as administrating Startup SG schemes. With tech startups growing in numbers, a steady supply of well-groomed talent is instrumental in driving Singapore’s startup ecosystem forward. You will be part of a dynamic team that focuses on growing a pipeline of local tech talent professionals and attracting top tech talents to work in Singapore. Specifically, your role will cover the administration of work visas/ passes to facilitate the flow of talent into Singapore. What you will be working on Processing of applications including document verification, evaluating eligibility against scheme criteria, liaising with applicant for information Providing customer service through managing enquiry email inbox Supporting of general admin duties including coordinating meetings, data entry, email filing and tracking of scheme progress What we are looking for Good team player with the ability to work independently Positive attitude and eager to learn Good communication and partner engagement skills Familiar with Microsoft Excel Minimally 2 years of working experience in the relevant areas of administration work

Job_Title: Development Partner, Food, Household and Electronics
Job_Descriptions: What the role is You will be part of the Trade Division driving international trading for Singapore and enhancing Singapore as a global trading hub. The Division is involved in attracting global traders to manage their trading operations from Singapore, as well as supporting Singapore Wholesale Trade companies in their growth and capability development. What you will be working on You would be part of the Food, Household and Electronics team and would be in charge of a portfolio of companies which are primarily in food wholesale and distribution. You are expected to: a) Actively engage companies in this sector and attract global traders to base and grow their operations in Singapore; b) Be involved in projects to develop strategies and processes, to ensure that Singapore remains a conducive business environment for companies in this sector; and c) Help to develop the capabilities of Singapore food traders and assist these companies to internationalise. What we are looking for You should have 3-5 years of working experience in international business or business development, with an interest to contribute to the public service. Knowledge of, or prior experience in the Wholesale Trade sector would be viewed favourably.

Job_Title: Development Partner/ Senior Development Partner, Financing Ecosystem
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The role will involve monitoring, analysing, reviewing and enhancing existing Government financing schemes to ensure their effectiveness in meeting the financing demand of Singapore enterprises, in order to support their growth both domestically and overseas. What you will be working on You will be involved in the research and analysis that focuses on the monitoring and assessment of Singapore enterprises' state of access to financing, through extensive engagement with a wide range of public and private stakeholders. An understanding of Singapore's current financing landscape, knowledge of the success factors of key global financial hubs which Singapore can adopt/adapt is required. You will also be required to review and devise the division's overall strategies to enhance the financing ecosystem in Singapore, including through research and benchmarking of Singapore's financing landscape against other jurisdictions, and identifying emerging trends, business models and tools in the market. What we are looking for - Trained in Business, Economics or Finance, you should ideally have at least 5 years of relevant work experiences with the financial industry, such as banking and insurance, especially in areas such as SME financing, Trade Financing, Project Financing and Credit / Risk Assessment. - You should have a strong analytical mind with excellent verbal and written communication skills. Applicants will also be evaluated on their experience and interest to contribute to the public sector in an enterprise development role. - A strong ability to communicate and engage with both external and internal stakeholders is critical. You must be comfortable with writing up memos, policy papers and developing cohesive presentation slides.

Job_Title: Associate, HRIS Business Analyst, Group Human Resources - (WD30474)
Job_Descriptions: Business Function Group Human Resources has the important role of attracting, retaining, and nurturing talent to ensure that DBS continues to be a competitive employer in Asia. With a well-established team of HR partners, we support and deliver effective people-based solutions and services across businesses. Our goal is to build a high-performance organisation by empowering and engaging our employees. Because we believe that banking is about people. We are looking for someone to be an active team member on the HRIS Centre of Excellence team which looks after our 3 main HR systems of Core HR (Workday), Learning Hub and Recruiting Hub. You will be supporting our HR colleagues on issue resolution, change requests, BAU requests and testing. You will be expected to take ownership and resolve most of these items by making system configuration changes or data changes in our HR systems. Responsibilities -    Actively participate in all phases of the Workday lifecycle, assisting stakeholders with support and leveraging the Workday application. -    Responsible for the requirement gathering, analysis, design, scheduling, construction and delivery of the Workday solution based on business requirements. -    Understand different various regional specific regulatory and statutory requirements and how these can be met with. We work with teams in Hong Kong, India, Taiwan, China and other regional countries. -    Implement change requests by configuring Workday and at times also check the configuration of another team member to ensure quality assurance is met. -    Demonstrate the configurations through the iterative development of prototypes. -    At times there opportunities for project work; execute day-to-day project activities throughout all phases of the project and documentation. -    Identify and push for automation and streamlining processes across HRSS. -    Ensure business requirements specified by process owners are accurately represented and understood by the applications development team. -    Develop scalable solutions with a consistent, user-friendly customer experience, that is intuitive and easy to use, and that can be used (and adapted where necessary) across the entire DBS Group. -    Ensure operation issues are properly tracked to closure with documented resolutions/workaround in accordance to SLA. -    There are also opportunities to learn and be exposed to other HRIS technology in order to cross skill and grow your expertise in different domains, like LMS, Recruitment, Chatbots, IPA, Virtual Reality/AR tech and any new HR innovations. Requirements -    Degree (and above) in Information Technology or a technical related course -    At least 2 years-experience implementing/supporting Cloud based HR systems related solutions -    Preferably 1-2 years experience in implementation and configuration of HCM Workday solution -    Customer focus with a 'can do' attitude. -    Good risk and control Operations knowledge. Understand HR regulatory policies and audit procedures for HRIS security -    Good knowledge and understanding of HR practices and processes. -    Possesses and displays good verbal, written communication, presentation, interpersonal skill and ability to influence stakeholders and partners across vendors and teams -    Meticulous and independent worker. Ability to multi-task and still deliver quality outcomes. -    Analytical, resourceful and possess great problem-solving skills. Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Job_Title: Manager/ Assistant Manager (Community Engagement & Relations Department)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Community Engagement & Relations Department (CERD) is looking for a highly motivated and dynamic individual who is passionate about the environment, and enjoy working closely with the people, private and public sectors to develop and implement community outreach programmes in areas such as dengue prevention, clean tables, public cleanliness, personal and public hygiene, food waste reduction, resource conservation and energy efficiency. What you will be working on The key duties vary according to the specific area of work assigned, but may generally include: Develop, implement and sustain community outreach programmes on environmental topics Establish good rapport with 3P partners to inculcate pro-environmental values and mobilise community actions Manage/support events jointly organised with the 3P sectors (public/private and people sectors) such as Grassroots Organisations/schools by setting up educational booth at community events and/or conducting e-outreach at digital events. Activities may include conducting physical/online talk and quizzes/ manning of games at booths and are usually held on weekends. Train and manage partners’ volunteers for localised outreach events such as dengue prevention house visits, litter picking events, recycling drives etc. Manage 3P Partnerships Fund for community outreach projects within the district. Attend partners’ meetings (e.g. monthly meetings and other event/ project meetings with community groups) during weekday’s nights/weekends when required. What we are looking for The job might be for you if you possess the following: Able to work flexible hours and perform duties on weekday nights, weekends or public holidays when the need arises Keen interest in environmental public health and protection A passion for working with the community Excellent writing, communication and interpersonal skills Strong leadership skills and able to work independently as well as a team player An aptitude for public engagement Resourcefulness and good analytical skills Have physical stamina to conduct door to door house visits and stand for extended periods while organising physical events and manning exhibition booths Able to work in a fast-paced and highly volatile environment that would require the ability to manage multiple priorities and stakeholders at the same time As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment Applicants will be updated on the status of their applications within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting.

Job_Title: Credit Analyst, Financial Institution Credit Risk Management - (2100026J)
Job_Descriptions: Conduct credit assessment on new & existing corporate names in various industries and recommend limits for approval to support OCBC Bank Group’s trading/treasury operations. Perform credit reviews  timely and promptly. Be well versed with the Bank’s credit policies and procedures . At least 3 years of relevant corporate credit experience. Strong knowledge of, and experience in, credit analysis. Sophisticated analytical skills including extensive experience in analyzing financial statements in order to assess credit risks. Team player, results-oriented and shows ability to adapt. Willingness and ability to express opinions and work in a high pressure environment. Excellent written and interpersonal communication skills.

Experience in bank's middle office; working with numbers and financial statements is an added advantage Meticulous and proficient in Excel or equivalent software to analyse large volume of data Comfortable working with volume of applications Good numeracy, writing and interpersonal skills Be an effective team player with good stakeholder management skills, meticulous in your work, with good communication and good writing skills.

Provides education and evaluation to nursing and patient care staff, and facilitates evidenced-based research within a specialized area of nursing. Collaborates with medical practitioners to incorporate nursing processes into the plan of care for a specialized group of patients. Performs direct specialty nursing services to patients as required, ensuring adherence to Joint Commission standards and all related policies, procedures, and guidelines. Duties and Responsibilities 1. Provides educational leadership to patients and care providers to enhance specialized patient care within established healthcare setting. 2. Assists patients and caregivers with educational needs, problem resolution, and health management across the continuum of care. 3. Collaborates with medical providers, patient care staff, and unit management in the planning, implementation, and delivery of educational curricula. 4. Initiates skills development programs within the parameters of established care models; monitors trends and implements educational strategies to ensure compliance with quality standards and parameters. 5. Provides direct specialized nursing services to an assigned group of patients, providing specialized patient care within nursing protocols and assisting in the performance of all related nursing duties. 6. Develops patient care plans, incorporating evidenced-based research and national standards; consults with and serves as a resource to ensure quality patient care. 7. Educates technical and patient care staff in the use of new equipment, supplies, and instruments; coordinates in-service training and workshops for appropriate staff. 8. Ensures proper care in the use and maintenance of equipment and supplies; promotes continuous improvement of workplace safety and environmental practices. 9. Performs miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned. Minimum Job Requirements · Associate's degree in Nursing; at least 3 years of experience directly related to the duties and responsibilities specified. Certification/Licensure: State of New Mexico Licensed Registered Nurse or licensure pending as documented by temporary licensure OR current RN licensure from a state participating in the multi-state privilege to practice compact with New Mexico. · Completed degree(s) from an accredited institution that are above the minimum education requirement may be substituted for experience on a year for year basis.

A Customer Success Manager is responsible for developing and maintaining customer relationships that promote retention and loyalty. Your role is to work closely with customers to ensure that their goals are met, that they are satisfied with the services they receive and to improve upon areas of dissatisfaction. Work closely with business development team to understand the customer goals and ensure that there is a clear path to meeting the goals. Maintain a detailed understanding of the platform and support customers as needed on use of the platform. This will be done via a mix of customer training sessions, emails and phone calls. Initiate and conduct regular review meetings with the customers to gather feedback and review progress. Work with cross-functional teams to address customer complaints and concerns promptly. Establish and practice policies and procedures that optimise customer experience. Requirements Exceptional ability to foster positive customer relationships. Excellent communication and presentation skills are a must. Able to communicate effectively with diverse individuals and teams. Ability to work cross-functionally to get things done. Process-oriented and organised. Tech-savvy and able to easily use web-based software. Experience working in education or corporate learning is a plus. 3 years of experience in a customer-facing role is preferred.

Job_Title: Associate / Senior Associate, Innovation Eco-system Development (Contract)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Innovation Eco-system Development team drives the effort to strengthen the ecosystem for Singapore enterprises to form an innovative economy. We also identify, catalyse and drive both local and regional platforms for market-led innovation and related thematic projects, in order to strengthen Singapore’s position as a test-bedding and scale up hub. What you will be working on You will support the Innovation Eco-system Development team’s Startup SG policy initiatives that drive mentorship and startup capital support for first-time entrepreneurs, fast-track the development of proprietary technology solutions, or support incubators and accelerators to run programmes to nurture startups. You will also periodically review relevant project proposals and drive initiatives that enable companies to develop their innovation capabilities for growth. Your responsibilities will include: Assisting in the operationalisation of Startup SG schemes, including tracking programme partners’ progress and outcomes, maintaining project databases, and handling disbursements Reviewing Singapore’s strategies for innovation and providing inputs to better enable companies to grow through innovation Supporting the Division’s ad-hoc projects, events and/or research What we are looking for A background in Business, Engineering or Technology related disciplines would be advantageous. You should be independent, resourceful and self-motivated. You should have good interpersonal, communication and writing skills, as well as strategic thinking skills. You should be an innovative and dynamic individual, with unique combination of entrepreneurship experience, business acumen and strong interpersonal skills. You should also process customer-facing skills and be able to speak with confidence about Enterprise Singapore’s mandates. Fresh graduates are welcomed to apply!

To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities Support Singapore Private Banking Business team, SG Booking Centre Head, as well as Servicing & Transaction Head to deliver strategic projects that will help drive efficiency of the team and improve the client experience of Private Banking clients Work with various Business and Control stakeholders to define the steps required to execute the wider CPBB strategy Provide on-the-ground support to resolve issues to key Order Management Systems &/or other business initiatives in a timely fashion to minimize business disruption Act as the SG Private Bank Lead for cross functional projects, ensuring two way sharing of risks, areas of concern and opportunities. Identify and implement best practices in resources and processes, ensuring consistency and relevance to the business. Provide Training and Communications for strategic initiatives to business teams and ensure full oversight for implementation and post implementation review Be part of Client Journeys/Tribes and participate in the large-scale projects Our Ideal Candidate Degree holder or equivalent Business Planning Management Experience Problem Solving and Analytical Skills, including usage of project management tools Interpersonal and Stakeholder management skills At least 5 years of similar working experience in bank, with prior experience with Private Banking and Wealth Business. Agile Scrum, project lifecycle and benefits management End to end understanding of Private Banking and Wealth products and processes Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages . We welcome conversations on flexible working.

Job_Title: Associate / Senior Associate, Global Innovation Network (Contract)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is You will be part of a team that aims to strengthen Singapore's connections to major innovation hubs globally. A key part of your work will involve connecting Singapore technology and innovation companies with overseas partners in major innovation hubs and key demand markets. What you will be working on To achieve the goals of the Global Innovation Network team, you will play a role in engaging both local and international partners such as venture capitalists, incubators and accelerators with the objective of growing the Singapore start-up ecosystem. By supporting the various programmes under the Global Innovation Network, you will play a part in supporting business and capability development amongst innovative enterprises. These programmes include acceleration programmes to support internationalisation, as well as Co-Innovation & SIIRD (Singapore-Israel Industrial R&D Foundation) grant calls. You will also be involved in marketing efforts. What we are looking for You should be an innovative and dynamic individual, with unique combination of entrepreneurship interest, business acumen and strong interpersonal skills. You should also process customer-facing skills and be able to speak with confidence about Enterprise Singapore's mandates. A background in Business, Engineering or Technology related disciplines would be advantageous. You should be independent, resourceful and self-motivated. You should have good interpersonal, communication and writing skills, as well as strategic thinking skills. Fresh graduates are welcome to apply!

L1 Application Support Responsibilities: Investigate production issues, respond based on production incident TRO (target resolution objective) and upkeep FCR (first call resolution) Manage and respond to users queries in timely manner and correlate patterns indicative of wider issues or defects Timely execute start-of-day, end-of-day and intraday proactive checks for applications Perform special events monitoring like ecommerce merchant's sale and regular updates to stakeholders Manage incident, task SOPs and conduct regular recertification for continued sanctity and validity Analyze and conduct service reviews across application groups adding critical value to shift-left and demand management Requirement: Prior hand-on production support experience of OPEN Systems - might ask to write or show during interview Good support knowledge in either one of the retail or wholesale payment or customer information systems Willing to work in onsite shift-support model (follow-the-sun) Ability to easily adopt to any technology / environment - UNIX / open, AS/400 and mainframe Hands-on experience in writing SQL queries and parsing logs for issue investigation Strong written, oral communication skills and able to manage user / vendor / customer 3 or more years' production support experience in bank or financial vendors across multiple technologies / platform Be able to work in fast pace and high pressure working environment

What the role is The Innovation Eco-system Development team drives the effort to strengthen the ecosystem for Singapore enterprises to become more innovation-led. We focus on identifying and catalysing local and regional opportunities for market-led innovation, to strengthen Singapore’s position as an innovation and startup hub. What you will be working on You will work with a dynamic team that develops and implements initiatives that help startups and small-medium enterprises to innovate and develop differentiated offerings for commercialisation. You will work with and analyse data to support innovation and enterprise schemes, such as open innovation challenges that address industry challenges while benefiting local enterprises. Your responsibilities will include: Liaising with data owners to establish common understanding for data processing Supporting the confluence of different data sources on a technical level, which involves pre-processing and integration Deriving key business insights to supplement workflows and decision-making with a data-driven perspective, through data analysis and building visualisations to communicate value Developing a Tableau indicator dashboard to summarise scheme performance Developing a recommender engine to match innovative solvers with suitable capabilities to demand drivers Other product / project management responsibilities, where required What we are looking for Skillsets in Data Management / Data Science / Analytics and a good understanding of Relational Database Management Systems, with proficiency in MS Excel and Access, Python, SQL and Tableau. While working experience is preferred, our team prioritises individuals who possess enthusiasm and the right attitude to learn on the job. Knowledge of AGILE (SCRUM methodology) product / project management Good interpersonal, communication and writing skills, as well as strategic thinking skills Independent, resourceful, and self-motivated, with interest in Singapore’s innovation and enterprise ecosystem

What the role is You will be involved in the following areas: 1) Export Promotion and Facilitation To develop and implement new export promotion initiatives, with a focus on SMEs. You are expected to work with both internal and external stakeholders within Whole-of-Government, as well as with external partners like Trade Associations and Chambers to meet the export promotion deliverables. You must possess strong project management and facilitation skills. 2) Promote Better Usage of FTAs You will be the OIC responsible for specific FTAs. The specific duties include updating and maintaining the relevant FTA webpages on the Enterprise Singapore corporate website. You will also hold one-to-one company briefing sessions to help companies understand the benefits of FTAs and customise FTA advice to their specific situation and market(s). You will also promote usage of the Tariff Finder tool and will support in the preparation of annual reports on FTA outreach and utilisation. 3) Grant Application Evaluation and Project Assessment You will help to evaluate grant applications and assess projects to ensure eligibility of applicants, robustness of projects, and completeness of applications. What you will be working on What we are looking for You should be trained in Business, Supply Chain, Legal or Technology related disciplines. You should be independent, resourceful and self-motivated. As the role requires close coordination with both internal stakeholders and external stakeholders, the ideal candidate must demonstrate strong teamwork. Additionally, you should be able to carry out research and analysis of issues, and have good business acumen. Candidates who are able to communicate and write well, and have prior trade facilitation experience, will have an advantage.

Job_Title: Vice President, Business Development (Institutional Business), UOB Asset Management
Job_Descriptions: Vice President, Business Development (Institutional Business), UOB Asset Management Vice President, Business Development (Institutional Business), UOB Asset Management Posting Date: 22-Jan-2022 Location: Raffles Place, Singapore, SG Company: UOB Asset Management Ltd About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values - Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department UOB Asset Management is a leading Asian asset manager with award-winning investment expertise in fixed income and equities. Headquartered in Singapore, we offer global investment management expertise to individuals, institutions and corporations from a regional network spanning Thailand, Malaysia, Brunei, Japan and beyond. Our comprehensive product suite includes innovative solutions covering retail unit trusts, exchange-traded funds and customised portfolio management services. Job Responsibilities Key responsibilities will include: Working with our Institutional Sales team and bank Relationship Managers to identify opportunities, generate client leads and market investment funds and solutions to corporate clients of UOB. Marketing investment funds and solutions to third party clients, including preparation of Requests for Proposals (RFPs) and Due Diligence Questionnaires (DDQs). Developing and delivering customised investment proposals for such solutions in close consultation with portfolio managers and analysts. Performing client onboarding, managing client relationships and servicing of client requirements. Supporting proposal preparation to sophisticated clients of Group Wholesale Banking. Job Requirements A degree holder with minimum 3 years' investment sales and marketing experience in a similar capacity in the asset management, financial services industry and/or experience providing capital market solutions to corporate or institutional clients. As a sales driven individual, excellent customer skills and a strong sense of initiative, drive and ability to work under pressure to meet and exceed sales objectives. Good knowledge and understanding of investment assets and products, and strong ability to present investment proposals. Experience with fund sales in a corporate wealth or financial advisory environment is a definite advantage. Able to work independently, possess good interpersonal and communication skills. CFA charterholder and/or fund management experience would be a strong advantage. Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. Apply now and make a difference.

Job_Title: Development Partner, Startup Development (1 year contract)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is You will play a key role in deepening ESG’s understanding of the Singapore’s startup ecosystem through various data intelligence gathering and sense-making efforts. This is achieved mainly through the Startup SG Network (SSN), an online community of startups and ecosystem partners. Your role includes engagement of startups and partners to onboard them onto the platform, support in training of existing data model, and track and monitor the growth of the network. Additionally, you would be part of the team in identifying the needs of startups and the possible solutions that SSN can provide to address the needs. What you will be working on What we are looking for Minimally 2 years of working experience in the relevant areas of Data Science / Analytics or Communications Experience in startup-related work would be advantageous Good communication and partner engagement skills Good team player with the ability to work independently Familiar with Excel and SQL and is comfortable handling large amount of data Experience with product development or Agile framework is a plus

Job_Title: Deputy Director, Tax & Multilateral Organisations Management
Job_Descriptions: What the role is The Tax & Multilateral Organisations Management team supports ESG to enable our Singapore enterprises to gain access to financing and in-country connections. Organisations managed include the World Bank, the Asian Development Bank and the International Chamber of Commerce. The department also supports ESG's vision by developing and implementing tax policy to support Singapore's companies capability development, internationalisation, and to maintain Singapore's position as the leading trading hub in Asia. The team is responsible for: Reviewing the tax policies and guidelines, taking into account the changing business environment and needs of companies; Monitoring international tax developments; and Ensuring that the tax incentives deliver the intended policy outcomes. What you will be working on As Deputy Director, Tax & Multilateral Organisations, you will be responsible for leading a team of financial development professionals to: Cultivate the multilateral organisations Undertake joint initiatives Facilitate introductions to our local enterprises and monitor progress Achieve ESG's tax policy objectives through reviews of existing tax incentives Manage communication with key stakeholders (government agencies/ministries and industry partners) Oversee the scheme administration of ESG's tax incentives, including ensure relevant audit and reporting procedures are adhered to Stay attuned to international tax developments and assess the impact on Singapore companies Formulate ESG's position for the negotiation of Avoidance of Double taxation treaties with other countries What we are looking for Background in Tax, Accountancy or Economics, with at least 10 years of experience in tax and/or policy implementation. A background in tax advisory will be an added advantage. Able to work across the organisation to understand problem statements for the enterprise landscape and to suggest solutions Experienced in senior stakeholder management Possess good interpersonal, writing and communication skills Global mindset, enterprising and a team player

Job_Title: Investment Manager / Senior Investment Manager, SEEDS Capital
Job_Descriptions: What the role is As the investment arm of Enterprise Singapore, SEEDS Capital catalyses smart investments into innovative Singapore-based early-stage startups with strong intellectual content and global market potential. We adopt a co-investment model, working hand-in-hand with institutional investors from around the world. Leveraging our collective expertise and networks, we help startups commercialise, realise their business development plans and expand globally. We focus our investments into emerging and strategic sectors aligned with national priorities, including Manufacturing, Trade & Connectivity, Human Health & Potential, Urban Solutions & Sustainability, and Smart Nation & Digital Economy. As an Investment Manager of SEEDS Capital, you will play a key role in sourcing, engaging and supporting high growth start-ups that are targeting disruptive opportunities in key industry clusters. You will leverage ESG’s equity investment programs, financial and non-financial initiatives to support the start-ups' needs in areas such as financing, markets and talent. You will source, assess and engage a portfolio of companies, and work closely with investor partners, other government agencies, and accelerators/incubators to facilitate the effective delivery of SEEDS Capital’s mandate. What you will be working on Work with partners (e.g. Venture Capital firms, Accelerators, Corporate Venture Capitalists) to identify and manage deal flow opportunities. Assess commercial viability, strategic considerations, conduct due diligence and recommend deals for investment. Manage post-investment operations. Monitor portfolio companies’ performance (e.g. fund-raising activities, revenue and valuation growth) and work closely with both internal and external stakeholders to help the companies grow value and achieve a healthy return on investment. Develop, manage and/or execute programs and projects to support growth of portfolio companies. What we are looking for If you are someone who is resourceful, communicates and collaborates well, has an agile and analytical mind, and willing to commit to a challenge, we want you! You should be trained in Business, Engineering or Technology related disciplines. You should be able to carry out research and analysis of issues and have good business acumen especially for early stage start-ups. Prior experience in early stage investment and startup ecosystem development would be advantageous.

Job_Title: Development Partner / Senior Development Partner, Global Innovation Network
Job_Descriptions: What the role is You will be part of a team that aims to strengthen Singapore's connections to major innovation hubs globally. A key part of your work will involve connecting Singapore technology and innovation companies with overseas partners in major innovation hubs and key demand markets. What you will be working on To achieve the goals of the Global Innovation Network team, you will need to: Engage the wider technology and innovation community in Singapore, including companies, relevant government agencies, ecosystem builders, VCs, accelerators/incubators, mentors, tech conferences etc. Be the central coordinator and go-to person for technology and innovation-related interests within Innovation and Enterprise Group, which will involve coordination with the various Corporate Group divisions that manages Singapore enterprises including technology startups, SMEs and corporates, as well as international teams that are located in-market; Manage programmes that facilitate business and growth opportunities for Singapore technology startups and SMEs in International markets Catalyse platforms for co-innovation by facilitating more partnerships with large enterprises and government agencies, establishing position as reference pilot and test-bedding hub in the region Identify and manage overseas partners to deepen global connections & Deepen and grow networks globally, support startups to internationalise and attract global startups. What we are looking for You should have minimally 3 5 years of working experience, business development and/or relevant experience in technology business would be advantageous. You should be a self-starter, be results-oriented, able to demonstrate strong business acumen and strategic thinking. Excellent communications skills and the ability to perform under pressure & in a collaborative environment will put you in good stead. Overseas travel for business purposes may be required, frequency of about 2-3 times a year, dependent on changes in the pandemic situation.

Job_Title: Development Partner / Senior Development Partner, Startup Development
Job_Descriptions: What the role is As part of the Startup Development Division, you will be working closely with Singapore's startup ecosystem partners to support the execution of initiatives and programmes that will drive the growth of the startup ecosystem in collaboration with partners. What you will be working on To achieve the goals of the Startup Development Division, you will need to: Establish strong relations within the start-up ecosystem, both locally and globally, and with public agencies working with startups, to understand the needs of various stakeholders. Work closely with both internal and external stakeholders to ensure that both physical and online infrastructures are available to facilitate connections between startups, investors and enablers in the startup ecosystem. Such infrastructure includes startup clusters at LaunchPads and Startup SG Network Manage and develop the Startup SG Network, to ensure that the platform meets the needs of the startups and various enablers in facilitating connections, and monitor users' growth on the platform, together with the IT team and external developers. Administer programmes under the ambit of Startup SG, which includes identifying, evaluating and managing projects that are supported under the programmes. In addition, you will have the opportunity to review, ideate, and refine the division's engagement of startups, investors and enablers to foster tighter connections within the startup ecosystem to support Singapore-based startups in their growth. Through these areas of work, you will have the opportunity to interact with global and local startup ecosystem players and develop tight partnerships with Startup SG programme partners such as incubators and accelerators. What we are looking for - You should have at least 5 years of relevant working experience related to project management, product development or partnership management. - You should have some experience in digital product development and/or management and a working knowledge of product development methodology including the agile framework. - You should be independent, resourceful and self-motivated. You should have good interpersonal, strong written and verbal communication skills, as well as strategic thinking skills. - A strong interest in entrepreneurship and/or the startup ecosystem is preferred. Any prior experience in the startup ecosystem would be advantageous.

Client Services Desk Team/Function Overview The FX & Local Markets businesses operate on a global 24-hour basis covering trading centers in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. The Client Services team executes onboarding of Citi's clients for these businesses primarily through Citi's proprietary FX trading platforms. Services provided by the desk involve interaction with external institutional clients across client segments on client profile maintenance, usage of platforms, issue and query management, as well as related support to internal Sales teams. Role / Position Overview We are seeking a highly motivated candidate with relevant experience, to join the Client Services team supporting Citi's FX businesses globally. The purpose of this role will be to provide the first line of support to external institutional clients on Citi's FX platforms, onboard those clients on Citi's proprietary e-trading platforms, perform trading related maintenance activities, and liaise with the business and technology groups in managing the overall customer experience and relationship with Citi. The successful candidate will join the Client Services team in Singapore and will work with the respective sales and technology support groups to provide exceptional customer service across our proprietary trading applications. Key Responsibilities: Provide world-class onboarding and maintenance support to a geographically diverse institutional user base Develop an in-depth knowledge of the fundamentals of FX/ FX Sales and Trading business and the dealing lifecycle in so much as how it benefits clients Work with unit SMEs on various client/platform onboarding related processes, as well as with multiple levels of management during BAU risk oversight Ensure all client issues raised during the shift are tracked and resolved closely with the controls and governance manager, leads, and other key stakeholders to prioritize resolution Handle high risk requests for clients immediately and ensure they are escalated and socialized with the right stakeholders Analyzes emerging exceptions and usage trends for clients, risks and work with product and tech partners on solution designs to mitigate business impact by leveraging expert analytical and technical skills. Ensure there is a clear and distinct focus on platinum clients as regards prioritization, handling, escalation and communication Coordinate issue and corrective action management processes, identifying root causes, impacts to business, and steps required. Monitor progress of corrective action plans. Provide appropriate guidance back to clients. Coordinate alignment and optimization of unit processes across regions, with the assistance of the unit controls and governance manager, and leads. Work with governance and controls manager and leads to identify, escalate and track key risk indicators Manage the client services mailbox by way of prioritization and task assignment as required Ensure all incoming requests are then ticketed and tracked on the appropriate technology tools Collate customer feedback on our platforms and ensure they are translated into new class-leading initiatives on process and system optimization where applicable. Job Family Group: Technology Job Family: Applications Support Time Type: Full time Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Hiring_Company: Mcd Global Franchising Limited Singapore Branch
Job_Descriptions: McDonald’s is proud to be one of the most recognized brands in the world, with restaurants in over 100 countries and billions of customers served each year. As the global leader in the food services industry, we have a legacy of innovation and hard work that continues to drive us. Today, we are growing with velocity and are focused on modernizing our experiences, not to make a different McDonald’s but to build a better McDonald’s. We are a people business just as much as we are a restaurant business. We strive to be the most inclusive brand on the planet by building complementary teams who create delicious, feel good moments that are easy for everyone to enjoy, Joining McDonald’s means thinking big daily and preparing for a career that can have impact around the world. The Service Manager will support the GMA Lite Services Lead in managing the end-to-end Support & Deployment services for the McDonald’s global mobile app (GMA Lite) that is live in over 60 markets worldwide. This role focuses primarily on the GMA Lite eCommerce (Mobile Order & Pay) capability, including support for the accelerated deployment of the Mobile Order & Pay projects and serving as a technical liaison for the Mobile Order & Pay markets and the service providers. Key Responsibilities Liaise with the McDonald’s service providers and deployment project teams to ensure that key Service deliverables for Mobile Order & Pay project deployments and feature activations are met. Engage with the Mobile Order & Pay market teams and supervise the service providers to facilitate the resolution of incidents and problems. Provide guidance – with hands-on approach where applicable – to the service providers in the management of tickets, including collaboration with other services for the resolution of Mobile Order & Pay tickets. Participate in major incident management and issue triage both during and outside of regular office hours where necessary to drive the resolution of issues and restoration of service for Mobile Order & Pay. Work with the Product and Technical teams to ensure documentation of the Mobile Order & Pay capabilities are up to date and shared to the service providers as required. Organise and provide training for the service providers on new and existing Mobile Order & Pay capabilities to ensure and upscale the quality of the Service in meeting the product and business requirements. Serve as the GMA Lite Service secondary point of contact during the non-EU business hours, and support the GMA Lite Services Lead in the management of the GMA Lite service as required. Knowledge and Experience Minimum Requirements Experience working in a distributed (virtual) and culturally diverse teams across multiple time zones. ITIL knowledge of or ITIL 4 certification Experience in providing technical support or delivering support services in a similar capacity. Technical expertise in mobile app and/or ecommerce platforms. Strong organisation and/or project management skills, with knowledge or experience with agile methodology Proven analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for details. Customer-centric mindset, with a focus on organizational goals. Strong English language communication skills – written and spoken. Quick learner, and able to adapt to changes in priorities with ease and work well under pressure. Collaborative, curious, energetic, and motivated with a strong bias for action; proven track record of getting things done.

Job_Title: Executive Director, Head of Deposits (Singapore & Region), Personal Financial Services
Job_Descriptions: Executive Director, Head of Deposits (Singapore & Region), Personal Financial Services Executive Director, Head of Deposits (Singapore & Region), Personal Financial Services Posting Date: 22-Jan-2022 Location: Raffles Place, Singapore, SG Company: United Overseas Bank Limited About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values - Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Retail function provides Personal and Business Banking customers with financial solutions tailored to their needs. We help them manage their money wisely and meet their financial goals through an extensive range of products and services. These include deposit, insurance, secured and unsecured loans, investment and wealth advisory services. Personal Financial Services We design and provide products and services that empower our customers to enjoy greater banking convenience while they extract more value from their money. In particular, we are focused on promoting and developing healthy saving and investment practices across generations. Job Responsibilities Responsible for strategy, growth and performance of Deposits Products for all client segments in Singapore and the Region, including revenue and life cycle of the products - from conception to delivery and maintenance. The role is responsible to: Set strategy and direction for overall deposit business, ensure client segment relevance, scale growth in deposit balances, drive product profitability, product mix and quality of portfolio Design new & refresh product proposition aligning to segment proposition to acquire deposits, balancing cost and stickiness and to complete existing product gaps Drive, grow and manage Singapore deposit portfolio achieve business performance objectives Work with regional businesses to shape their deposit portfolio and execute the strategy to achieve the right deposit shape Lead the interface with support functions to ensure the best possible end to end delivery Work with Marketing and Segments, Channels, Sales & Digital banking teams to deliver performance objectives Ensure proper controls, and full compliance with internal policies and external regulations Lead and manage teams/talents, build the team bench strength capable of ensuring delivery of the business' short and longer-term objectives Job Requirements Degree holder with at least 15 years of relevant experience in Banking / Finance Industry Strategic business acumen coupled with ability to operationalize and drive execution across countries in a region to drive Deposits growth Strong leadership qualities, excellent interpersonal skills and multicultural awareness and sensitivity Strong analytical skills on product portfolio and profitability Deep knowledge and understanding of deposits products, pricing, Asset & Liability Management, including fund transfer pricing; risk management, Basel III Framework, etc Sound understanding of business guidelines and compliance requirements and issues Strong people management skills with ability to drive teamwork and operate effectively within the organisation In-depth understanding of key business driver in dedicated geographical market(s) with sound understanding of legal, political and economic situation/framework; including understanding of cultural ethnic and religious market conditions Good communication and presentation skills Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. Apply now and make a difference.

Job_Title: Director, Liquidity and Balance Sheet Mgmt
Job_Descriptions: Director, Liquidity and Balance Sheet Mgmt About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities Support the business strategy in alignment with changes in regulations (Basel III). This includes keeping abreast of the changing regulatory landscape, impact, business risks and opportunities. Review of current model and framework that calibrates Operational Deposits and identify opportunities which can be implemented in partnership with Cash Product and Sales teams. Collaborate with Product and Finance to provide in-depth business analytics that challenge existing business rationale or assumptions, providing business insights in Operation Deposit movements. Close partnership with Group Treasury in translating regulatory changes and impact to TB. Funds Transfer Pricing (FTP) policy management in partnership with Group Treasury, providing TB Product and Sales teams necessary guidance on addressing FTP implementation and issues. Conduct training sessions for Group, Regional, and Country teams on Operational Deposits Model and sharing of best practices across the network. Partner with Regional and Country Product teams to draft strategy papers tabled at various liquidity forums to help drive Transaction Banking Balance Sheet optimisation. Provide necessary managerial support to offshore teams in building knowledge base to help develop necessary value add MIS which drives business decisions. Key Stakeholders Global Head of Cash Product, Regional and Country Cash Product and Sales Head, Head of Treasury Liquidity Policy Our Ideal Candidate 8+years' experience and Good understanding of Transaction Banking products Knowledge on regulatory framework (Basel 3) and regulatory changes in the external environment. Excellent analytical skills; ability to manage large data. Hands-on individual and a self-starter. Good stakeholder engagement capabilities, with the ability to own and manage initiatives, and to co-ordinate across a matrix organisation. Ability to influence across product partners and to deliver results with minimal supervision. A team player able to adapt to a multi-cultural diverse team. Ability to challenge the status-quo and to facilitate discussions. Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages . We welcome conversations on flexible working.

Scrum Master / Technical Business Analyst Introduction to the role: Works collaboratively with clients and stakeholders - both external and internal to the company - to research and elicit, analyze, validate and document business requirements, and to ensure that those requirements clearly reflect true business needs, correctly representing all stakeholders. Translates business needs into system/ application requirements and project components to help determine solutions to business problems. Assists team members in producing functional requirements for tool development. Proactively identifies and manages changes to requirements and identify risks for the company's clients. Effectively manages client's expectations. Applies industry and information technology expertise to support proposals, feasibility studies, implementations and new business development. Responsibilities: Formulate and define system scope and objectives using knowledge of information technology and industry knowledge/ requirements. Act as a liaison between client and technical solutions/ support groups, using strong communication skills to elicit, document, analyze and validate business processes, systems, and solution requirements. Proactively research, identify, and specify solutions to problems. Support and conduct visualization, user experience and configuration elements of solution design. Document requirements specifications using high-maturity methods, processes and tools. Support requirements management and change management processes. Support aspects of the business cycle, including proposals, feasibility studies, and implementations. Consider the business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment. We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be notified / contacted. Job_Title: AVP, Portfolio Administration, Mezzanine Capital Unit (Private Equity & Special Opportunities)
Job_Descriptions: AVP, Portfolio Administration, Mezzanine Capital Unit (Private Equity & Special Opportunities) OCBC Bank is the longest established Singapore bank, formed in 1932 from the merger of three local banks, the oldest of which was founded in 1912. It is now the second largest financial services group in Southeast Asia by assets and one of the world's most highly-rated banks, with an Aa1 rating from Moody's. Recognised for its financial strength and stability, OCBC Bank is consistently ranked among the World's Top 50 Safest Banks by Global Finance and has been named Best Managed Bank in Singapore by The Asian Banker. Department Description Mezzanine Capital Unit, a business unit within OCBC Bank's Global Investment Banking division, offers comprehensive financing solutions involving debt-and-equity solutions to OCBC Bank's existing and prospective clients in Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia and Greater China. We partner our investee companies in their business expansion and value creation plans by leveraging our extensive business network and deep industry knowledge. The Portfolio Administration team works closely with the various Investment teams to manage the end-to-end middle- and back-office functions. Key Responsibilities: Responsible for portfolio administration and reporting matters in the areas of financial, management, regulatory compliance, etc Prepare/review department's financial analysis and investment performance for management reporting, internal submissions for financial, regulatory, compliance reporting Maintain department's central investment and cashflow database Coordinate with the investment teams on the funding, booking, valuation and accounting of new investments, post-funding investment reviews, tracking of key covenants and compliance events/dates Coordinate the annual portfolio valuation exercise by actively engaging the investment teams, business risk managers, external valuers, and other relevant departments Prepare the quarterly portfolio valuation analysis with inputs from the investment teams, business risk managers, and other relevant departments Liaise with external and internal auditors during audit exercises Assist with corporate secretariat matters relating to the investment vehicles, including the preparation of resolutions, updating of authorized signatories, renewal of power of attorney, opening of banking and securities accounts, etc. Assist in the annual budget/operating plan exercise Assist in the annual review of the department's product program, policy and procedure manuals, market risk limits, system accesses, etc Assist in fund administration and operational matters of the Lion-OCBC Fund Qualifications The ideal Candidate would meet the following requirements: Able to think logically, independently in a structured manner, strong problem-solving skills Highly detail-oriented, meticulous and well-organised Strong aptitude for numbers and comfortable handling large volumes of data Intellectually curious, keen to learn new things and able to comprehend broad and complex concepts Good interpersonal skills to engage stakeholders across departments and divisions, and good communication skills to articulate points clearly and succinctly Strong work ethic and self-driven Good Excel, database and PowerPoint skills Good academic track record, preferably in Accounting or Finance 3-5 years working experience in the banking and finance industry (middle office, finance and accounting, business planning) Familiarity of private equity industry will be an advantage Ability to speak/read/write in Mandarin is preferred as the role is required to cover Greater China At OCBC, we recognise your drive, passion and talent. We will bring out the best in you and empower you to excel. Fulfil your life goals and career ambitions with us. *We regret that only shortlisted Candidates will be notified.
